title: Data Analyst
description: At Precise Solutions, we are looking for top talent consultants to bring on as employees of our organization and service our clients in the various Life Sciences Industries. We are much more than a consulting firm! Precise Solutions provides competitive compensation packages with great salaries, benefits, health insurance, paid time off and employer-based 401k contributions.<br><br><strong><u>We Currently Have An Immediate Need For The Following<br><br></u></strong>Job Title: Data Analyst<br><br>Location: Lake County, IL USA<br><br>Compensation: $54.00 per hour, Paid Time off, Company 401k contributions, Health, dental, and vision insurance. Total Annual Compensation including benefits is $125,000.00<br><br>Resume Requirements<br><br>The following resume requirements must be met for resume to be considered<br><ul><li>Candidates first and last name (legal spelling) must be at the top of the resume </li><li>Valid email address must be at the top of the resume. LinkedIn links will not be accepted it must be a valid email address so our recruiters can respond to your resume </li><li>Please refrain from submitting resumes with candidates photo they will not be considered<br></li></ul><strong><u>Data Analyst Job Description<br><br></u></strong>The Business Data Analyst will be responsible for data modeling, Power BI dashboard creation and maintenance, ETL automation, ad-hoc reporting, and long term analytical and statistical projects. The Business Data Analyst will support cross-functional stakeholders and work with multiple sources and a wide range of data technologies and systems (e.g. SQL, Power BI, Hive, etc..)<br><br>Data Analyst Years of Experience/education and/or certifcations required <ul><li>BA/BS in Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, Finance </li><li>5+yrs most recent experience as a Data Analyst </li><li>Demonstrated strength in SQL, data modeling, ETL development, and data warehousing </li><li>3+ yrs Experience with Power BI </li><li>Experience creating PowerPoints and Dashboards for leadership<br></li></ul>Data Analyst Primary Duties and Responsibilities <ul><li>Creating and maintaining data dictionaries, use cases, functional and non-functional requirements documents, test plans and other project documents </li><li>Assisting with requirements facilitation and KPI definition/alignment </li><li>Assisting with user acceptance testing </li><li>Assisting with dashboard demos and feedback gathering </li><li>Think strategically and analytically about business and technical challenges, with the ability to work cross functionally </li><li>Ability to distill problem definitions, models, and constraints from informal business requirements </li><li>Demonstrate deep understanding of source data from various internal/external systems </li><li>Support key business systems and applications </li><li>Further establish the newly implemented change management process </li><li>Communicate and present findings to stakeholders </li><li>Work in an ambiguous environment, drawing out and developing business requirements to meet changing needs </li><li>Working with technical teams to capture data driven metrics<br></li></ul>Data Analyst Qualifications <ul><li>BA/BS in Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, Finance, or relevant work experience </li><li>Demonstrated strength in SQL, data modeling, ETL development, and data warehousing </li><li>Advanced experience in Power BI </li><li>Experience with Power BI, Tableau, or other similar BI tools </li><li>The ideal candidate will have extensive experience with development of metrics and business analytics, and have the aptitude to incorporate new approaches and methodologies, and a strong understanding of Data Warehouse (DW) concepts, while dealing with ambiguity </li><li>Excellent business and communication skills are a must to develop and define key business questions and to build data sets that answer those questions </li><li>Should be able to work cohesively with stakeholders to understand business requirements and implement reporting solutions<br></li></ul>Data Analyst Top Skills REQUIRED: <ul><li>Demonstrated strength in SQL, data modeling, ETL development, and data warehousing </li><li>3+ yrs Experience with Power BI </li><li>Demonstrate deep understanding of source data from various internal/external systems. </li><li>Communicate and present findings to stakeholders </li><li>Excellent business and communication skills are a must to develop and define key business questions and to build data sets that answer those questions </li><li>Experience creating PowerPoints and Dashboards for leadership </li><li>The ideal candidate will have extensive experience with development of metrics and business analytics, and have the aptitude to incorporate new approaches and methodologies, and a strong understanding of Data Warehouse (DW) concepts, while dealing with ambiguity </li><li>Should be able to work cohesively with stakeholders to understand business requirements and implement reporting solutions<br></li></ul>Data Analyst Nice To Have Skills <ul><li>Experience using HIVE <br></li></ul>Powered by JazzHR

title: Asset Verification Data Analyst - Remote | WFH
description: We are seeking an enthusiastic and skilled Asset Verification Data Analyst to join our dynamic team! As an Asset Verification Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in independently confirming financial data, collaborating with various professionals, including examiners at a federal agency. Our Asset Verification unit operates in multiple client offices nationwide, and this particular position will be based in vibrant Chicago, IL.<br><br><strong><u>What You'll Be Doing<br><br></u></strong>Collaborating with examination staff to review accounts and conduct statistical sampling routines, ensuring representative samples of accounts are derived.<br><br>Analyzing and interpreting accounting records and financial statements of firms under examination, reviewing, examining, and identifying inconsistencies, irregularities, errors, and potential fraudulent activities.<br><br>Performing asset confirmations according to end user requirements, utilizing Microsoft Office software and a commercial-off-the-shelf (COTS) product.<br><br>Providing valuable input and guidance on best practices and user guides for the asset verification process, actively contributing to enhancements of the account verification tool to optimize its effectiveness and user-friendliness.<br><br>What you need to be considered for this role (required):<br><br>A Bachelor's degree in accounting, finance, economics, or a related field.<br><br>A minimum of 3 years of relevant experience.<br><br>Proficiency in Microsoft Office suite, particularly advanced skills in Excel.<br><br>Experience in analyzing large amounts of data in a meticulous manner.<br><br>Proven ability to generate clear and insightful reports, incorporating charts, graphs, and prose, to benefit financial, legal, and enforcement personnel.<br><br>Excellent customer service and communication skills.<br><br>A dedication to delve beyond surface-level analysis and uncover the underlying behavior behind financial data.<br><br>Exceptional multitasking abilities, with the capacity to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines with minimal supervision.<br><br>A strong attention to detail, maintaining a high level of accuracy.<br><br>A strong work ethic and a collaborative mindset to thrive in a team-oriented environment.<br><br>Excellent verbal and written communication skills.<br><br>U.S. citizenship is required (dual nationals are not eligible).<br><br>A successful completion of a Public Trust background investigation is mandatory for this position.<br><br><strong><u>About Us<br><br></u></strong>We are a leading technology-driven company dedicated to delivering value-added services and technology-based solutions that yield tangible results for Federal agencies. Founded in 2002, our minority-owned Small Business, Ascella Technologies, Inc. (Ascella), has established a solid reputation in providing an extensive range of financial management, accounting, system, data analytics, optimization, Agile, and IT support services to various Federal agencies. Ascella is on a continuous growth trajectory, and we are actively seeking talented individuals to join our team and contribute to our mission of delivering value-added technology-based solutions. At Ascella, "Your Success is Our Commitment."<br><br><strong><u>Why Ascella Employees Excel<br><br></u></strong>Innovative Thinkers: We value every employee's ideas and encourage creativity at all levels. You will have the opportunity to contribute innovative solutions and be part of defining how we approach our work. We provide an environment where you can tackle real business challenges and find unique solutions.<br><br>Lifelong Learners: We foster a culture of continuous learning and personal growth. As an Ascella team member, you will be part of a collaborative environment, working with experienced professionals who are dedicated to both individual and organizational development. You will be challenged and supported in your pursuit of knowledge and advancement.<br><br>Customer-Centric: Customer satisfaction is paramount to us. We are committed to delivering excellent service and proactively finding solutions to meet current and future needs. Our dedication to customer experience is deeply embedded in our mission and values. You will collaborate with passionate individuals who are focused on ensuring customer satisfaction.<br><br>Employment Type: Full-Time<br><br>Salary: $ 62,000.00 78,000.00 Per Year

You will collaborate with passionate individuals who are focused on ensuring customer satisfaction.<br><br>Employment Type: Full-Time<br><br>Salary: $ 62,000.00 78,000.00 Per Year

title: Data Engineer
description: <strong>About Us</strong><p><br></p>Dyson is a global technology enterprise. We’re growing fast and our ambition is huge – more categories, more locations and more people. Dyson launched in the US in 2002, and since then operations have grown exponentially. Our US headquarters is based in Chicago's Fulton Market neighborhood. We also have employees working in field sales, our service centers, and in our growing number of Dyson Demo Store’s across the country.<p><br></p>Data and analytics excellence at Dyson is delivered by a diverse and collaborative global community, at the heart of that community is a hub team that enables all others: In Dyson’s Data Analytics team, there has been significant investment into cloud technologies and tools; combined with an expansive scope and no shortage of ambition and momentum, Dyson Data Analytics team is recognized throughout the organization to the highest level as critical to all of Dyson's strategic objectives. With a ‘one-team’ approach, the global community is on a mission to: Evolve existing solutions to stay ahead; Embed emerging solutions to capitalize on potential benefits; Deliver conceptualized and future solutions to introduce net-new capability.<p><br></p><strong>About The Role</strong><p><br></p>At Dyson, Data Engineers are Software Engineers specializing in building data intensive applications. In this role, you will be responsible for:<p><br></p><ul><li>Delivering Data Engineering excellence in the end-to-end delivery of complex data engineering projects and programs for Dyson </li><li>Reviewing technical designs and providing feedback </li><li>Designing and building end-to-end data solutions for analytics </li><li>Migrating existing pipelines onto the platform </li><li>Deployment, testing activities with hands on engineering and automation experience including CI/CD/CD and DataOps mindset </li><li>Adapting quickly to change in requirements and be willing to work with different technologies if required </li><li>Developing and maintaining data pipelines in a Backend/Distributed Data Systems team while remaining hands-on is very important </li><li>Strengthening data quality and reliability </li><li>Improving data lineage and governance </li><li>Progressing standards and best practices for the platform and operational excellence </li><li>Maintaining our documentation culture </li></ul> <strong> <br><br><strong>About You<br></strong><ul><li>Adept at writing clean code that can be easily understood by others </li><li>Able to understand and improve legacy code </li><li>Identify and build abstractions and tools to solve recurring challenges</li><li>Apply best practices and ways of working among our global data engineering team </li><li>Provide constructive feedback through PRs and pairing </li><li>Seek to close gaps in documentation </li><li>You feel strongly about data and want to empower the organization with it  </li><li>You seek technical excellence and is self-driven and motivated </li><li>You want to build robust, scalable and reliable software and solutions </li><li>You have experience with SQL and strong programming skills in a modern language (Python/Kotlin/Java/Scala) </li><li>You are comfortable writing production grade software that solves problems often presented with ambiguity </li><li>You proactively identify challenges and opportunities; seeking improvement as a team. </li></ul> <strong>Benefits:<br><br></strong>At Dyson, how we reward you is linked to our high-performance culture. But it’s about more than salary and bonus. Through a package of financial, lifestyle and health benefits, we support whatever stage of life you’re in and the moments that matter.<br><br><strong>Financial Benefits<br></strong><ul><li>401K with up to a 4% match</li><li>Company paid Life Insurance and AD&amp;D</li><li>Flexible Savings Account (FSA) and Health Savings Account (HSA)<br><br></li></ul><strong>Lifestyle Benefits<br></strong><ul><li>Competitive Paid Time Off Benefits including Separate Holiday, Sick, and Vacation Time</li><li>Pre-tax Commuter Benefits (applicable areas only)</li><li>Generous Child Care Leave Program</li><li>Wellness Program</li><li>Employee Assistance Program</li><li>Generous Dyson Product Discounts<br><br></li></ul><strong>Health Benefits<br></strong><ul><li>Multi-Level Healthcare Coverage Options</li><li>Vision &amp; Dental Coverage</li><li>Company paid Short-Term and Long-Term Disability <br><br></li></ul>Dyson is an equal opportunity employer. We know that great minds don’t think alike, and it takes all kinds of minds to make our technology so unique. We welcome applications from all backgrounds and employment decisions are made without regard to race, colour, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other any other dimension of diversity.</strong>

title: Power BI
description: <strong>Job Details </strong><p><br></p><strong><strong> Job Title: Power BI </strong></strong><p><br></p><strong> Location: Des Plaines, IL </strong><p><br></p><strong> Duration: 6+ Months (Possibility of extension) </strong><p><br></p><strong> Pay Rate: $46 </strong><p><br></p><strong>Job Description</strong><p><br></p><strong> Duties </strong> :<p><br></p>This position is to support the BI reports and visualizations for the existing Global Supply Chain Business System organization through the development of database tools for the organizations we support.<p><br></p>The ideal candidate will have the ability to use critical thinking to develop available data into tools that best support the business needs.<p><br></p>The candidate for this position should have the following skill sets:<p><br></p><ul><li> Cognos Report Development (ability to write code to build reports directly or through Cognos) </li><li> SQL Query Development experience </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Skills</strong><p><br></p>These additional skills would be helpful in working with the existing subject matter experts in the development and execution of business tools or processes<p><br></p><ul><li> Proficient in Power BI Dashboarding and Report Development, including DAX development. </li><li> Relational Database Development Experience </li><li> Microsoft Office Tools </li></ul><p><br></p>The primary role will be to learn and develop tools to support the routine business processes and recommend solutions to support the business. This role will be used to produce and post routine reports and then automate the report generation.<p><br></p>This role is full time and is expected to be on site initially. Once the skills and capability have been established, then limited remote working options can be considered

title: Google Analytics Data Specialist
description: <strong>Opportunity<br><br></strong>Media.Monks is looking for an experienced <strong>Google Analytics Data Specialist</strong> with enterprise-level client facing experience in analytics and implementation of marketing and e-commerce projects. This experience should include helping clients to develop data strategies, complex measurement projects, and experience driving value with expert knowledge and client relationship skills.<br><br>You will be responsible for analytics initiatives, including managing relationships with a number of enterprise clients, building out their analytics framework, overseeing tagging, and ad-hoc reporting needs.<br><br>The ideal candidate <strong>MUST</strong> have a history of working with <strong>Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, </strong>and the <strong>Google Marketing Platform</strong> to help a variety of businesses, overseeing or directly having a hand in the implementation of their data collection, as well as finding ways to utilize this data to drive value for their clients through reporting and analysis.<br><br>This role also offers a huge opportunity for growth within our North America and global data team, the ability to participate in innovation on projects, and the potential to advance the practice of analytics and data from the forefront.<br><br><strong>The Role <br><br></strong><strong>Responsibilities Will Include<br><br></strong><ul><li>Provide subject matter expertise in Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager to your clients via scheduled reports, ad-hoc reports, overseeing the tagging and analytics framework, and a variety of analysis and insight initiatives.</li><li>Develop analytics and data strategies for some of the largest brands in the world with a focus on measurably lifting their business. </li><li>Share your data and marketing analytics expertise with your clients and the MightyHive team; acting as a thought leader for your client, and an active participant in the knowledge growth of the MightyHive team.</li><li>Manage the relationship and projects for enterprise clients</li><li>Assist clients in understanding the importance of online measurement, and provide best practice guidelines for their general data strategy, as well as specific technical implementations.</li><li>Assist the data team in propelling our practice forward with new go to market initiatives and solutions.<br><br></li></ul><strong>What We Are Looking For<br><br></strong>We are looking for candidates that can wear two hats comfortably - “business” and “data” - with at least 2-3 years of client facing experience with Google Analytics. Ideally, this experience is with a digital marketing consulting firm, agency, or advertiser.<br><br>Beyond the experience with Google Analytics, in our eyes the most important qualities are intellectual curiosity, autonomy, and proactivity.<br><br><strong>Required Skills &amp; Experience<br><br></strong><ul><li>You have deep knowledge and experience using Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, and other parts of the Google Marketing Platform. </li><li>You have a deep knowledge and understanding of the data, adtech, and martech industry.</li><li>You have experience managing strategic projects and/or clients.</li><li>You’re someone who can sit in a room/Zoom with large clients and confidently establish yourself as a business partner while providing guidance on their analytics and data strategy.</li><li>You lean into a challenge; resilient and are a practitioner of accountability.</li><li>You are a self-directed, resourceful, and a critical thinker with attention-to-detail and problem-solving skills.</li><li>You are someone who loves to collaborate within cross-functional teams.</li><li>You have self and situational awareness; an ability to ‘read the room’; a leader and a listener.<br><br></li></ul><strong>Preferred<br><br></strong><ul><li>You have experience implementing, and utilizing the data from a variety of other digital analytics tools such as Adobe Analytics, Optimize 360, etc. </li><li>You have experience with BI/Data analysis tools (Data Studio, Tableau, PowerBI, etc.).</li><li>Familiarity with cloud data (GCP / BigQuery, AWS, etc) and how to leverage it is a big plus.<br><br></li></ul><strong>What We Offer<br><br></strong><ul><li>Career growth in a disruptor space &amp; entrepreneurial opportunity within the Media.Monks network </li><li>A globally diverse &amp; inclusive culture</li><li>Remote working environment</li><li>Flexible time off + 15 paid holidays</li><li>Company contribution (3%) to 401k, regardless of employee contribution</li><li>Company paid medical, dental, and vision insurance with additional niche benefits</li><li>Base Salary Band: $80,000 - $120,000<br><br></li></ul><strong>About Media.Monks<br><br></strong>Media.Monks is on a mission to create a new future for this industry. Our vision? Build everything with a belief that changing for good comes from changing who does the work. Yep, that means you. Welcome to the party—one global, cross-cultural collective with a passion for using our skills to create better and a better world. That’s how we’re able to connect the dots between data, content, digital media, and technology from everywhere we are—a true end-to-end model. Joining the Media.Monks collective means having the opportunity to create award-winning work with some of the most gifted, focused, joyful, talents from all over the world.<br><br>At Media.Monks, you’ll be joining a highly ambitious company on a global mission to win the decade by changing the industry for good. Partner to 8 of the 10 most innovative companies in the world, Media.Monks works with established as well as up-and-coming global, regional, DTC and B2B brands, helping them own their data and build out customer ecosystems to elicit smart, efficient, high-impact engines for growth. We deliver table stakes quickly, creating cost efficiencies from day one to push up the creative effectiveness of our work with every cycle.<br><br>We are an equal-opportunity employer committed to building a respectful and empowering work environment for all people to freely express themselves amongst colleagues who embrace diversity in all respects. Including fresh voices and unique points of view in all aspects of our business not only creates an environment where we can all grow and thrive but also increases our potential to produce work that better represents—and resonates with—the world around us.<br><br>

This experience should include helping clients to develop data strategies, complex measurement projects, and experience driving value with expert knowledge and client relationship skills.<br><br>You will be responsible for analytics initiatives, including managing relationships with a number of enterprise clients, building out their analytics framework, overseeing tagging, and ad-hoc reporting needs.<br><br>The ideal candidate <strong>MUST</strong> have a history of working with <strong>Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, </strong>and the <strong>Google Marketing Platform</strong> to help a variety of businesses, overseeing or directly having a hand in the implementation of their data collection, as well as finding ways to utilize this data to drive value for their clients through reporting and analysis.<br><br>This role also offers a huge opportunity for growth within our North America and global data team, the ability to participate in innovation on projects, and the potential to advance the practice of analytics and data from the forefront.<br><br><strong>The Role <br><br></strong><strong>Responsibilities Will Include<br><br></strong><ul><li>Provide subject matter expertise in Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager to your clients via scheduled reports, ad-hoc reports, overseeing the tagging and analytics framework, and a variety of analysis and insight initiatives.</li><li>Develop analytics and data strategies for some of the largest brands in the world with a focus on measurably lifting their business. </li><li>Share your data and marketing analytics expertise with your clients and the MightyHive team; title: DATA PRIVACY SPECIALIST (BUREAU OF TECHNOLOGY) - ACTIVELY RECRUITED
description: <strong>Cook County </strong><strong>Offices <br><br></strong><strong>Under The President<br><br></strong><strong>Administrative Hearings<br><br></strong><strong>Auditor<br><br></strong><strong>Bureau of Administration<br><br></strong><strong>Bureau of Economic Development<br><br></strong><strong>Bureau of Finance<br><br></strong><strong>Bureau of Human Resources<br><br></strong><strong>Bureau of Technology<br><br></strong><strong>Facilities<br><br></strong><strong>Office of the President <br><br></strong><strong>Job Summary<br><br></strong>Under the direction of the Data Privacy Officer (DPO) or designee, implements and supports the development of County privacy policies, procedures, and operations to ensure privacy requirements and regulations for the protection of personal information. Conducts analysis and creation of strategies for privacy program improvement. Provides training and educational materials related to privacy protection and assists in mitigating risks related to the unauthorized access of sensitive information. Performs privacy risk assessments, privacy impact assessments and other related documentation. In collaboration with the Security Operations Center (SOC), provides management with reports detailing alerts and warnings of potential risks, threats and vulnerabilities to critical data. Performs other duties as assigned.<br><br><strong>This position is Actively Recruited and At Will.<br><br></strong><strong>Minimum Qualifications<br></strong><ul><li>Possession of a High School diploma or General Education Development (GED) certificate is required.</li><li>Three (3) years of full-time work experience as an analyst in Information Technology (IT), Risk Management, Audit or Information Security is required.</li><li>A certification in Information Security, Audit or Risk Management is required.<br><br></li></ul><strong>OR<br></strong><ul><li>Graduation from an accredited college or university with an associate degree is required.</li><li>One (1) years of full-time work experience as an analyst in Information Technology (IT), Risk Management, Audit, or Information Security is required.</li><li>A certification in Information Security, Audit or Risk Management is required.<br><br></li></ul><strong>Preferred Qualifications<br></strong><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree in Information Security Computer Science, Management Information Systems, or Technology System.</li><li>International Association of Privacy Professional certifications such as Certified Information Privacy Professional (CIPP): Certified Information Privacy Management (CIPM); or Certified Information Privacy Technologist (CIPT).</li><li>Certified Information Systems Auditor (CISA).<br><br></li></ul>Pursuant to Executive order 2021-1 and cook county’s Mandatory covid-19 Vaccination policy, the selected candidate will be required to either <strong>submit PROOF OF FULL VACCINATION</strong> <strong>OR A REQUEST FOR reasonable ACCOMMODATION</strong> <strong>prior to the start of employment.</strong> please click the following hyperlinks for the full text of executive order 2021-1 and the cook county mandatory COVID-19 vaccination policy.<br><br>Executive Order 2021-1 Vaccination Policy<br><br>Mandatory COVID-19 Vaccination Policy<br><br><strong>Candidates who are contacted will be required to produce original required documents (e.g., current driver’s license, diploma, school transcript, certifications, etc.) listed on the Notice of Job Opportunity within five (5) days of being </strong><strong>extended an offer, in writing, by the Bureau Chief of BHR (or designee). </strong><strong>Candidates will be notified of how to submit required documents.<br></strong><ul><li>Degrees awarded outside of the United States with the exception of those awarded in one of the United States territories and Canada, must be credentialed by either the World Education Services (WES) or Educational Credential Evaluators (ECE). <br><br></li></ul><strong>Knowledge, Skills, Abilities And Other Characteristics<br><br></strong>Knowledge of IT security theory; technologies; policies; best practices and enterprise architectures. Knowledge of the product development life cycle focusing on privacy recommendations and system categorization. Strong analytical and problem resolution skills. Excellent oral and written communication skills including the ability to document requirement, designs, communication plans, project plans, project status reports and other relevant project-related issues. Ability to work 24/7 including holidays and weekends if needed for incident response. Ability to work independently.<br><br><strong>Physical Requirements<br><br></strong><strong>Sedentary Work <br><br></strong>Sedentary Work involves exerting up to 10 pounds of force occasionally or a negligible amount of force frequently to lift, carry, push, pull, or otherwise move objects. Sedentary work involves sitting most of the time, but may involve walking or standing for brief periods of time.<br><br><strong>The duties listed are not set forth for purposes of limiting the assignment of work. They are not to be construed as a complete list of the many duties normally to be performed under a job title or those to be performed temporarily outside an employee's normal line of work.<br><br></strong><strong>Benefits Package<br></strong><ul><li>Medical, Dental, and Vision Coverage </li><li>Basic Term Life Insurance </li><li>Pension Plan and Deferred Compensation Program </li><li>Employee Assistance Program </li><li>Paid Holidays, Vacation, and Sick Time </li><li>You May Qualify for the Public Service Loan Forgiveness Program (PSLF) <br><br></li></ul>For further information on our excellent benefits package, please click on the following link:<br><br>http://www.cookcountyrisk.com/<br><br>The County has a hybrid work environment which allows employees telecommuting and flexible scheduling options.<br><ul><li>This position requires successful completion of post-offer tests, which may include a background check, drug screen and medical examination.<br><br></li></ul>Falsification of any information in the application process will result in disqualification, dismissal after hire, and/or placement on the County’s Ineligible for Rehire List for a period of two (2) or five (5) years. For current County employees, such falsification may result in discipline, up to and including termination, and placement on the County’s Ineligible for Rehire List for a period of two (2) or five (5) years. <em>See</em> Cook County Code of Ordinances, Article II, Sections 44-54 <em>Unlawful Practices Relating to Employees and Employment - Penalty</em>, 44-56 <em>Political Discrimination</em>; Cook County Employment Plan, Section V.N. <em>Pre-Interview License and Certification Verification</em>; Supplemental Policy No. 2014-2.13 <em>Ineligible for Rehire List</em>; and Cook County Personnel Rules 3.3(b) (7) (d)<br><br><strong><u>EEO Statement <br><br></u></strong>Cook County Government is an Equal Employment Opportunity (“EEO”) employer. Cook County prohibits illegal discrimination and harassment and affords equal employment opportunities to employees and applicants without regard to race, color, sex, age, religion, disability, national origin, ancestry, sexual orientation, marital status, parental status, source of income, housing status, military service or discharge status, gender identity, genetic information, or any other protected category established by law, statute or ordinance as further defined in Chapter 44. Human Resources, Article II. Personnel Polices, Section 44-53 of the Cook County Code of Ordinances and Chapter 42. Human Relations, Article II. Human Rights, Section 42-35 of the Cook County Code of Ordinances.<br><br><strong><u>NOTE: As an internal candidate, should you be offered the position, salary allocations shall abide by the Cook County Personnel Rules.<br><br></u></strong><strong><u><br><ul><li>Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without sponsorship.<br><br></li></ul><strong><u>Social Media Disclaimer<br><br></u></strong>The County’s hiring process is governed by the Cook County Employment Plan which prohibits employment actions from being influenced by any Political Reasons or Factors for Non-Exempt Positions. The advertisement of this position by any individual does not constitute an offer or promise of employment, promotion, or any other employment action and shall not influence the County’s hiring decision. Cook County officials and employees who become aware of or receive a complaint that involves an allegation of Political Reasons or Factors being considered in the hiring process of Non-Exempt positions are obligated to refer the complaint to the Cook County - Office of the Inspector General. If the Cook County Inspector General sustains allegations of Political Reasons or Factors being considered, Cook County will disqualify the Applicant or Candidate from consideration for employment and disciplinary action will be imposed on any involved Cook County employees, if applicable.<br><br><strong>Job Posting<br><br></strong>May 17, 2023, 12:54:50 PM<br><br><strong>Organization<br><br></strong>Offices Under the President</u></strong>

title: Data Developer (SSIS/ADF) - REMOTE
description: <strong>THE OPPORTUNITY: <br><br></strong>We are seeking a talented <strong>Data Developer (SSIS/ADF) </strong>to serve as a technology data developer. The Data Developer works independently and plays a role on key strategic projects as related to data infrastructure, reporting, data triage, master data management, and other related data initiatives.<br><br><strong> WHAT YOU CAN LOOK FORWARD TO: <br><br></strong><ul><li>Serves as a developer on strategic and enterprise level data driven projects, collaborates with other areas of technology as well as business units.</li><li>Follows and advises on industry standards and advances on data driven technologies and tools.</li><li>Designs, implements, and updates best practices for the data development team.</li><li>Creates enterprise level end-to-end data flow diagrams and logical data models.</li><li>Develops and reviews complex SSIS and Azure Data Factory pipelines for various reporting and data development projects. </li><li>SQL, T-SQL scripts, stored procedures, SSIS workflows development is required.</li><li>Creates and maintains documentation related to data development best practices, enterprise level data flow diagrams, and project code promotion.</li><li>Provides recommendations to technology tools, products and services in order to help keep our environment on the cutting edge of technology.</li><li>Develops and designs solutions with security as a critical design requirement for data, systems and applications.</li><li>Adheres to development processes and standards including code management.</li><li>Adhere to Agile principles and philosophies (Scrum or Kanban, as applicable) in fulfillment of the role.</li><li>Collaborate within the direct team in accordance with Team Agreement, Definition of Ready, and Definition of Done.</li><li>Work as a cross-functional team member in an Agile setting to help complete and deliver the team commitments.</li><li>Collaborate across teams and across business areas in the spirit of an Agile mindset.</li><li>Fulfill the role in the spirit of the Agile Manifesto, with emphasis on delivery of incremental value with frequent iterations and feedback loops.<br><br></li></ul><strong>WHAT YOU’LL NEED TO SUCCEED: <br><br></strong><ul><li>Best practices for data development within a PCI environment.</li><li>Ability to analyze enterprise level data sources and determine relationships between disparate sources.</li><li>Determine methodologies for integration with third-party data sets.</li><li>Expertise in data warehousing and data modeling methodologies, tools and best practices.</li><li>Agile methodologies.</li><li> Expert knowledge of SSIS and Azure Data Factory. </li><li> Snowflake development experience is a plus. </li><li> Excellent communication skills and ability to translate complex concepts to simple and easier terms for business leaders and users of data. </li><li> Ability to review existing processes and identify logic problems to address. </li><li> Ability to formulate a plan that aligns and supports to delivery timelines. </li><li> Ability to lead large data driven enterprise projects. </li><li> Ability to coach, mentor and lead others. </li><li> Ability to identify, recommend and set best practices for the data developer role. </li><li> Must be detail focused. </li><li> Must possess strong communication skills. <br><br></li></ul><strong>REQUIRED EDUCATION and EXPERIENCE</strong>:<br><br><ul><li>College degree in CIS, Data Management, Data Analytics, or similar, or equivalent training and/or experience.</li><li>5-10+ years’ experience working in a data function or equivalent position where primary responsibility is working with data, database design and data development is the primary responsibility.<br><br></li></ul>#TechRecruiting<br><br>For California, Colorado and New York Applicants: In accordance with the Equal Pay for Equal Work Act, the expected salary range for this position is between:<br><br>$98,000.00 - $124,000.00<br><br>Actual Pay will be adjusted based on experience and other job-related factors permitted by law.<br><br>This position qualifies for the following benefits; Co-op Solutions offers a competitive Total Rewards package: 401(k) with generous company match, Health, Dental, and Vision Insurance options, Health Savings Account/Flexible Spending Account, Life Insurance, Short- and Long-Term disability benefits, Pregnancy and Parental Leave, Tuition Reimbursement, Paid Time Off (PTO), Paid Holidays, Community Volunteer Time Off, and an Employee Assistance Program.

commitments.</li><li>Collaborate across teams and across business areas in the spirit of an Agile mindset.</li><li>Fulfill the role in the spirit of the Agile Manifesto, with emphasis on delivery of incremental value with frequent iterations and feedback loops.<br><br></li></ul><strong>WHAT YOU’LL NEED TO SUCCEED: <br><br></strong><ul><li>Best practices for data development within a PCI environment.</li><li>Ability to analyze enterprise level data sources and determine relationships between disparate sources.</li><li>Determine methodologies for integration with third-party data sets.</li><li>Expertise in data warehousing and data modeling methodologies, tools and best practices.</li><li>Agile methodologies.</li><li> Expert knowledge of SSIS and Azure Data Factory. </li><li> Snowflake development experience is a plus. </li><li> Excellent communication skills and ability to translate complex concepts to simple and easier terms for business leaders and users of data. </li><li> Ability to review existing processes and identify logic problems to address. </li><li> Ability to formulate a plan that aligns and supports to delivery timelines. </li><li> Ability to lead large data driven enterprise projects. </li><li> Ability to coach, mentor and lead others. </li><li> Ability to identify, recommend and set best practices for the data developer role. </li><li> Must be detail focused. </li><li> Must possess strong communication skills. <br><br></li></ul><strong>REQUIRED EDUCATION and EXPERIENCE</strong>:<br><br><ul><li>College degree in CIS, Data Management, Data Analytics, or similar, or equivalent training and/or experience.</li><li>5-10+ years’ experience working in a data function or equivalent position where primary responsibility is working with data, database design and data development is the primary responsibility.<br><br></li></ul>#TechRecruiting<br><br>For California, Colorado and New York Applicants: In accordance with the Equal Pay for Equal Work Act, the expected salary range for this position is between:<br><br>$98,000.00 - $124,000.00<br><br>Actual Pay will be adjusted based on experience and other job-related factors permitted by law.<br><br>This position qualifies for the following benefits; Co-op Solutions offers a competitive Total Rewards package: 401(k) with generous company match, Health, Dental, and Vision Insurance options, Health Savings Account/Flexible Spending Account, Life Insurance, Short- and Long-Term disability benefits, Pregnancy and Parental Leave, Tuition Reimbursement, Paid Time Off (PTO), Paid Holidays, Community Volunteer Time Off, and an Employee Assistance Program.

title: Business Systems Analyst
description: <strong>Title: Cognos Reporting / Business Systems Analyst<br> Duration: Through end of 2023 to start<br> Location: Des Plaines, IL 60018<br></strong> <br> This position is to support the BI reports and visualizations for the existing Global Supply Chain Business System organization through the development of database tools for the organizations we support.<br> <br> The ideal candidate will have the ability to use critical thinking to develop available data into tools that best support the business needs.<br> <br> The candidate for this position should have the following skill sets:<br> <br> 1. Cognos Report Development (ability to write code to build reports directly or through Cognos)<br> 2. SQL Query Development experience<br> <br> These additional skills would be helpful in working with the existing subject matter experts in the development and execution of business tools or processes:<br> <br> 1. Proficient in Power BI Dashboarding and Report Development, including DAX development<br> 2. Relational Database Development Experience<br> 3. Microsoft Office Tools<br> <br> The primary role will be to learn and develop tools to support the routine business processes and recommend solutions to support the business.  This role will be used to produce and post routine reports and then automate the report generation.  <br> <br> This role is full time and is expected to be on site initially.  Once the skills and capability have been established, then limited remote working options can be considered.<br>

title: Survey Developer (REMOTE NATIONWIDE)
description: E15 Group<br><br>At E15, we are the spark that ignites. Our team delivers next-generation insights based on data, not hunches, to drive business in healthcare, campus, corporate, sports, entertainment, hospitality, and retail industries to help companies make forward-looking decisions to benefit their business and their guests. For more information on what we are about as a company, check us out by following the link below: www.e15group.com<br><br><strong>LOCATION</strong>: Position is eligible to be remote Nationwide and work in the Central timezone.<br><br><strong>Job Summary<br><br></strong>The Survey Developer will have the opportunity to make code decisions and build cloud infrastructure and pipelines that will deliver data solutions to our Food and Beverage client, FLIK. You will help bring best practices to the team while collaborating with a team of Data Engineers. This position is fully remote. You will report to the Technical Program Manager.<br><br>What you'll do:<br><ul><li>Collaborate with our reporting, analytics, and data science teams to understand data sources and business requirements</li><li>Program surveys and dashboards according to requirements provided by business stakeholders</li><li>Troubleshoot survey design and data collection efforts</li><li>Review survey requirement documents and provide clear and concise written feedback with regards to programming considerations</li><li>Collaborate with Data Engineering team to ensure technical data requirements are met</li><li>Support day-to-day project management, keeping all team members and stakeholders up to date on programming status, timing, risks, dependencies, and blockers</li><li>Resolve support tickets for the survey program, e.g., updating survey content, granting user access, etc.</li><li>Provides documentation on current and future processes to cross-train and allow team continuity.</li><li>Delivers ad-hoc surveys for presentations and other requests.<br><br></li></ul>What you’ll bring:<br><ul><li>1+ years experience with programming languages (SQL, JavaScript)</li><li>Experience with Form Builder a plus</li><li>Experience building dashboards in Qualtrics or Tableau a plus</li><li>Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Analytics, or related field</li><li>Proficiency in Microsoft Office products - Excel, Word, PowerPoint</li><li>Knowledge of Monday.com a plus</li><li>Strong communication, interpersonal, and team skills</li><li>Ability to set and achieve goals</li><li>Strong problem-solving skills, attention to detail and ability to think outside the box<br><br></li></ul>What we offer:<br><ul><li>Competitive compensation</li><li>Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision insurance</li><li>Life &amp; disability insurance</li><li>Retirement plan + competitive match</li><li>20 days of Paid Time Off per year plus corporate holidays</li><li>Flexible Spending Accounts (FSAs)</li><li>Additional benefits like health, wellness, and employee assistance programs, pet insurance, and a discount marketplace<br><br></li></ul>Earliest Start Date: ASAP<br><br>Location: Remote<br><br>Ability to travel: 10%<br><br><strong>Apply to E15 today!<br><br></strong>E15 is a member of Compass Group USA<br><br><strong>Click Here To Learn More About The Compass Story<br><br></strong><strong>Compass Group is an equal opportunity employer. At Compass, we are committed to treating all Applicants and Associates fairly based on their abilities, achievements, and experience without regard to race, national origin, sex, age, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other classification protected by law.<br><br></strong><strong>Associates at E15</strong><strong>are offered many fantastic benefits.<br></strong><ul><li> Medical </li><li> Dental </li><li> Vision </li><li> Life Insurance/ AD </li><li> Disability Insurance </li><li> Retirement Plan </li><li> Paid Time Off </li><li> Holiday Time Off (varies by site/state) </li><li> Associate Shopping Program </li><li> Health and Wellness Programs </li><li> Discount Marketplace </li><li> Identity Theft Protection </li><li> Pet Insurance </li><li> Commuter Benefits </li><li> Employee Assistance Program </li><li> Flexible Spending Accounts (FSAs) <br><br></li></ul><strong>Req ID: 1186857<br><br></strong><strong>E15 Group <br><br></strong><strong>Joel Riet <br><br></strong><strong>[[req_classification]]</strong>

title: Junior Salesforce Developer
description: <strong>Overview</strong><p><br></p>Starting salary $60,000 - 75,000 based on location, education and experience.<p><br></p>Do you enjoy traveling, meeting customers, hands-on troubleshooting, and working with a great team? If so, this could be the job for you!<p><br></p>We’re looking for people who think critically, communicate effectively, and love seeing a project to completion. You’ll be traveling regionally and across the country, doing programming and troubleshooting of systems and equipment. You will be getting your hands dirty while fixing cutting-edge smart automation equipment.<p><br></p>If you don’t want a desk job, love to work with your hands, and enjoy traveling to new places - your dream job is right in front of you! If you like to sleep in your own bed each night, this is NOT the job for you.<p><br></p>ProAutomated’s core values are Camaraderie, Caring, Determination, Excellence, Innovation, Integrity &amp; Confidence. We are a close-knit company who cares deeply about our team members on both a personal and professional level. As a fair and progressive company, we invest in those who invest their time and energy in us. If you are seeking an entry-level position with a company you intend to build a career with and these values resonate with you, please continue below!<p><br></p>Military/Veteran friendly employer. When surveyed, our military/veteran team members overwhelmingly valued having a job with a sense of purpose, traveling, and appreciated the high standards/expectations of our work.<p><br></p>A snapshot of what we offer:<p><br></p><ul><li>Paid training</li><li>Ability to gain experience with different customers and systems including Honeywell, Intelligrated, Daifuku, Siemens and more.</li><li>Laptop, iPhone, and tools provided for use</li><li>Bonus pay for bonus work!</li><li>Full benefits (Health, Dental, Life, company matching 401k)</li><li>Vacation time upon completion of training &amp; "Take-as-you-need-it" vacation after 18 months of employment.</li><li>5% salary increase at 6 months of employment.</li><li>Annual performance-based increases</li><li>Catastrophe fund to aid ProAutomated team members impacted by major events</li><li>A private company that listens to team members and takes their suggestions seriously.</li></ul><p><br></p>Candidate requirements to set you up for success:<p><br></p><ul><li>Desire to travel - this job is 100% travel.</li><li>Must live within 50 miles of a major international airport.</li><li>Excellent written and verbal communication skills.</li><li>Ability to think clearly and logically through complex situations.</li><li>Comfortable adapting to same day and next day changes to project scope and location.</li><li>Must own a personal car within 45 days of employment with ProAutomated.</li><li>Must be authorized to work in the US for US positions.</li><li>Availability to work a 10-4 schedule. This means working 10 days on a jobsite and then having 4 days off before returning to the job site.</li><li>Availability to work weekends and overnight shifts when necessary.</li><li>Recommended: PLC or programming experience/education or technical field background.</li><li>Recommended: 4 year degree or equivalent experience. Candidates who do not have sufficient education/experience may be considered for Field Service Technician roles.</li></ul><p><br></p>What you will love doing:<p><br></p><ul><li>Ensuring systems are installed correctly (sensors &amp; equipment are calibrated and wired properly).</li><li>Addressing and solving problems with confidence.</li><li>Simple field programming &amp; testing.</li><li>Constant movement. This job will have you on your feet and moving all day! </li><li>Working with new equipment and technology.</li></ul><p><br></p>Interested in finding out more about ProAutomated? Please visit the page of our website.<p><br></p>Principals only. Recruiters, please don't contact this job poster. DO NOT contact us with unsolicited services or offers.<p><br></p>Watch below to get a sense of how your adventure with ProAutomated begins:<p><br></p>Powered by JazzHR<p><br></p>UNQIwMXsqW

title: Entry Level Engineer - Automated Systems
description: Our Client, a premiere manufacturer of motion control and drive systems that set the worldwide benchmark in machine building and driver technology seeks a Applications Engineer to join it’s team due to phenomenal growth. This is a great time to join this group as the industry segments they serve are red hot, leading for mid-term growth projections to double.<p><br></p>In this role you will be working with customers in the selection and application of motion control equipment including items servo motors, gear heads, gear boxes, and other electro-mechanical and mechatronics systems. Not only are my client company’s products world classes, but you will be working on some really cool and intriguing projects within forward thinking companies. You will be working on highly visible projects with customers where you will analyze customer needs, then develop and write formal technical specifications, performance requirements and proposals for application and integration of products for customer applications.<p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor degree in Engineering with a specialization in Mechanical or Electrical</li><li> 2+ years’ experience in working with electro-mechanical devices and/ or servo motors, drives, gear boxes, mechatronic systems.</li></ul><p><br></p>To confidentially learn more about this interesting opportunity and to network with our experienced team about similar opportunities apply today!

title: Applications Engineer
description: Application Developer - Chicago<br><br><strong><u>Company Description<br><br></u></strong>RedMane Technology LLC is an application software consulting and systems integration company based in Chicago. We deliver software solutions for our clients throughout the United States and Canada by means of building new applications, implementing cloud and packaged systems, and/or modernizing legacy systems.<br><br>RedMane has earned an exemplary service reputation that prioritizes a highly collaborative culture. Our primary objective is to ensure the solutions we design and implement meet or exceed the needs of our clients for their mission critical systems.<br><br>The diverse and passionate teams within RedMane address complex, real world challenges. Technology is just our tool.<br><br>The Role<br><br>RedMane has a full-time opportunity for an application developer as we continue to grow our Chicago based practice. The application developer will perform development for our no code / low code, highly configurable SaaS product. This product incorporates leading-edge technologies, from cloud-based mobility to data visualizations and artificial intelligence. The developer will work on a dynamic development team in an Agile/Scrum environment to deliver a customized solution for our clients.<br><br><strong><u>Skills &amp; Role Requirements<br><br></u></strong>The Application Developer will need to have:<br><ul><li>3- B years of experience in software development, preferably in a C- 3, JavaScript, .NET, and SQL Server environment. </li><li>1- B years of experience with Node.js, GoJs, Angular, or similar technologies. </li><li>Bachelor'2019s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or other field. </li><li>Strong attention to detail and problem-solving skills. </li><li>Highly self-motivated with the ability to work independently. </li><li>Proven ability to efficiently learn and apply new ideas and concepts. </li><li>Ability to organize time, staff, and projects efficiently.<br></li></ul>All professionals at RedMane are expected to possess these qualities: <ul><li>A strong ethical foundation, capable of thriving in an environment and culture where honesty, integrity, and accountability are core values. </li><li>A collaborative spirit, a team orientation, and a willingness and desire to contribute to the success of others.<br></li></ul>We Offer You<br><br>RedMane has an environment that offers challenging and interesting work. A place where you can have fun and express your talent and creativity. You will be working side by side with like-minded peers in a non-bureaucratic environment where sharing knowledge is the norm. Everyone at RedMane shares a passion for making a real difference for individuals, communities, and the world.<br><br>Additionally, we believe you should have fun and enjoy growing your career; we provide the supportive and empowering environment to make it happen. RedMane is very proud to offer employees professional and personal perks that include:<ul><li>A flexible work environment that includes hybridized locations and schedules with free catered lunches in the office three days a week.</li><li>Market based compensation with a full range of benefits including medical, dental, vision, 401(k), short and long-term disability insurance, etc.</li><li>A culture that promotes and fosters career growth through professional training and mentoring.</li><li>An employee wellness program that includes free access to professional fitness coaches, structured dietary/nutrition plans, weekly Pilates classes in the office, and events that range from 5k- 7s to triathlons.</li><li>Opportunities to give back to the community through our RedMane Community Impact Team which organizes events like Feed My Starving Children, Toy Drives, and other charitable activities.</li></ul>

title: Application Developer - D Chicago
description: <strong>About Improvado<br><br></strong>We are a Series A startup with $30 million just raised in investments. We are rapidly scaling and doubling revenue growth every year.<br><br>We build ETL for marketing data: TikTok, Facebook, Google (300+ data sources). We processed trillions of data rows for a customer. Among our customers: ASUS, Illy, Activision, Adroll, Docker, Hims, OMD, and the University of San Francisco.<br><br><strong>Responsibilities<br></strong><ul><li> Data extraction. Develop new integration for interactions with third-party API</li><li> CI supervising. Interaction with qa team, researching for bugs causes</li><li> Infra. Cluster configuration. Roles/access management<br><br></li></ul><strong>Tools That Our Team Using<br></strong><ul><li> Warehouses: BigQuery, Redshift, Amazon S, Clickhouse, PostgreSQL, Azure SQL</li><li> Languages and frameworks: Python3, Django, RabbitMQ, Celery, k8s, Redis<br><br></li></ul><strong>Requirements<br></strong><ul><li> 2+ years of experience with Python+Django</li><li> 4+ years of commercial software development</li><li> The ability to work confidently in Linux</li><li> Real experience with db (management, query optimization)<br><br></li></ul><strong>Why Improvado<br></strong><ul><li> 100% remote work (with flexible working hours)</li><li> Strong product/market fit: marketing data product for US-based enterprises</li><li> Ideal time &amp; stage to benefit from companies growth - just got Series A :)</li><li> Extremely fun &amp; open startup environment</li><li> Chance to get the company's stock options in the future</li><li> Well-tuned workflow and development processes;</li><li> Modern tech stack (async frameworks, Clickhouse, high load, event-driven architecture, CI/CD, Kubernetes, AWS)</li><li> Strong engineering culture (test coverage&gt;90%, Domain-Driven Design, “clean architecture”)</li><li> Constant salary indexation and clear professional growth roadmap (performance reviews)<br><br></li></ul>

title: Python Developer
description: <strong>We are open to hybrid candidates located near any Zeno US Office: NYC, DC, CHI, Silicon Valley/San Francisco.</strong><p><br></p><strong>We are open to fully remote candidates who are not located near a Zeno office and reside in the following states: CA, CO, CT, FL, GA, IL, IN, KY, MA, MD, MI, MN, NC, NJ, NY, OH, OR, PA, TN, TX, UT, VA, WA, WI</strong><p><br></p><strong><u>About The Job</u></strong><p><br></p>We are looking for an analytically talented individual to join the Zeno Group Analytics team. This individual will be responsible for managing the analytics strategy and performance reporting across our digital/paid media accounts.<p><br></p>This role is for a Senior Analyst in a communications world - straddling the intersection between numbers and messages. Daily, you will utilize tools and strategies to translate raw data into valuable business insights and optimization suggestions. Working closely with the PR and Digital teams in order to implement data-driven recommendations generated through proprietary in-house learnings at scale and across multiple clients.<p><br></p><strong><u>About You</u></strong><p><br></p>As a Senior Analyst, you will be the analytics lead for your respective accounts, getting involved at the inception of new campaigns/programs as well as new business opportunities. You will work with digital channel owners and media monitoring experts to help analyze performance and identify key learnings and provide recommendations that will propel the client forward. You will lead client-specific projects from data cleaning and aggregation to visual creation and finally to report completion as you analyze the results to create actionable insights that will guide strategic decisions, uncovering real-time optimization opportunities that impact the bottom line.<p><br></p>The candidate must be data agnostic, willing to leverage information from a bevy of sources to best analyze the problem and forge a solution. This person will build, develop and maintain data structures, reporting systems and build customized dashboards based on KPIs that will support key business decisions and shape future programming recommendations.<p><br></p>This analytics team works in lockstep with the digital team at Zeno and will interact with every facet of the organization and, at times, clients as well. If you have an affinity for a wide gamut of data and are yearning to augment your knowledge, this role will allow you access to some of the most diverse datasets and tools around. That said, this person must be willing to get their hands dirty and roll up their sleeves in order to optimize existing processes, create best practices, work cross-functionally, ensure data validation, as well as build data visualizations from the ground up.<p><br></p><strong><u>This Person Must</u></strong><p><br></p><strong><u>Love to tinker:</u></strong> What better way to learn than diving in and trying new tools or approaches to data and strategy? The more creative the solution, the better!<p><br></p><strong><u>Be a self-starter</u></strong>: Someone who loves taking challenges head-on.<p><br></p><strong><u>Love Technology</u>: </strong> An aptitude for and general interest in technology will go a long way to success in this role.<p><br></p><strong><u>Think critically</u>: </strong> PR is difficult to measure in nature, we're looking for candidates that can think outside the box and are solution-oriented.<p><br></p><strong><u>Learn, teach and collaborate</u>:</strong> This role is as much about teaching those around you as it is taking on challenges of your own. Collaboration is key and communication is essential.<p><br></p><strong><u>Be willing to laugh</u>: </strong> We have a lot of fun and we hope you would, too.<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Providing end-to-end marketing analytics support for multiple clients across our paid media portfolio.</li><li>Identifying appropriate KPIs based on business objectives and authoring related measurement and test plans. </li><li>Evaluating and recommending specific measurement partners/tools. </li><li>Implementing and testing tracking infrastructure prior to campaign launch, including tracking tag generation from website analytics systems (e.g., Google/Adobe Analytics) and/or ad serving systems (e.g., DCM). </li><li>Aggregating data from various sources (including but not limited to site analytics, third-party ad servers, social listening platforms, call center data, CRM, etc.) into integrated report templates or dashboards. </li><li>Providing quality assurance of data throughout the life of a campaign, including ongoing tracking, maintenance, and issue resolution with regard to measurement framework while programs are in the market. </li><li>Drawing insights from campaign data and making actionable recommendations for improvement; presenting findings to internal teams and/or clients. </li><li>Developing and maintaining relationships with key partners in the data, measurement, and analytics space.</li><li>Providing an accurate and timely review of junior staff work products as needed. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 (i.e., at least 2 weeks after last dose) and, if hired, present proof or vaccination before start date. Candidates may request an accommodation due to a disability or sincerely held religious belief or an exception required under applicable law. </li><li>3+ years of experience as a hands-on marketing analyst for paid media. </li><li>Intermediate level proficiency of web site analytics packages (Google, Adobe), online ad serving systems (DCM, The Tradedesk) or Supermetrics.</li><li>Working Knowledge of Tableau and / or Looker Data Studio.</li><li>Intermediate level proficiency of Microsoft Excel and pivot tables.</li><li>Detail-oriented and well-organized. </li><li>Strong qualitative and quantitative skills. </li><li>Strong communication skills (written &amp; verbal).</li><li>Ability to manage timelines and multitask across a variety of projects. </li><li>Ability to work independently as well as part of a team. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><em>Pay range: $52,000-$78,000/year USD</em></strong><p><br></p><strong><em>An employee’s pay position within the salary range will be based on several factors including, but not limited to, relevant education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, seniority, geographic location, performance, travel requirements, revenue-based metrics, any contractual agreements, and business or organizational needs. The range listed is just one component of DJEH’s total compensation package for employees. Other rewards may include annual bonuses, a Paid Time Off policy, and region-specific benefits.</em></strong><p><br></p><strong><u>About Us</u></strong><p><br></p>Zeno Group is the fiercely independent and global integrated communications agency, born from PR. We bring together the boldest and brightest talent to help clients across industries and sectors unleash the power of strategic communications. Guided by our ‘Fearless Pursuit of the Unexpected,’ we push the boundaries to achieve real business value and societal impact for clients. Winner of the industry’s most coveted awards including the 2021 <em>PRovoke </em>Global Creative Agency of the Year, 2021 <em>PRovoke</em> North American Agency of the Year and 2021 <em>PRWeek</em> Agency of the Year. We are honored to be a three-time winner of <em>PRWeek</em>’s Best Places to Work. Zeno has also been previously recognized by the Cannes Lions International Festival of Creativity. Zeno is a DJE Holdings Company.<p><br></p><strong><u>About Our Benefits</u></strong><p><br></p>Healthy, happy employees make Zeno better, so we have programs that support physical, mental and financial wellness. Our culture and benefits are designed to promote flexibility, celebrate diversity and support work/life balance. We offer a variety of medical, dental and vision insurance with prescription plans, as well as short and long-term disability. Our Be Kind to Your Mind program focuses on mental health, providing a paid subscription to Headspace and access to mental health providers and other services through a best-in-class employee assistance program. Employees are encouraged to bring their authentic self to Zeno and participate in our employee resource groups which build communities for sharing and support. And while we love our work, we believe in the restorative power of time off with generous vacation, paid holidays and self-care time. Employees are supported in their pursuit of financial wellness with a 401(k) plan, pretax flexible spending accounts, tuition assistance, life insurance and free access to a certified financial coach. And our unique ZenoFit program provides a monthly allowance to fund activities in your personal life that bring you joy and keep you healthy. These and other benefits are available to non-temporary employees in the US.<p><br></p>

title: Senior Analyst, Digital
description: Position Overview <br><br>Our client is looking to bring in an End Point Security Engineer to assist them with their migration to Crowdstrike. They are seeking an individual who has performed a similar migration in the past and how is comfortable being hands-on and also working with business stakeholders and leadership.<br><br> Top Skills' Details <br><ul><li> Knowledge on optimizing and enhancing a Endpoint Security program post implementation with Crowdstrike (Other nice to haves McAfee Endpoint Security (Solidcore for change monitoring), SentinelOne]</li><li> O365 Security experience (implementing Microsoft Information Protection, securing Azure AD)</li><li> Experience with EPO managing BitLocker and Firewall modules</li><li> Understanding of various ways to secure legacy operating systems that cannot be modernized</li><li>Beyond Trust is a plus as they are integrating it into their environment<br><br></li></ul> Description <br><br>Primary focus is on the operational management, engineering and support of Endpoint Security products within their environment.<br><br>The successful individual will assist with reviewing existing &amp; new Endpoint Security products, policies, controls and processes to help strengthen and optimize current Endpoint Security capabilities, as well as identifying any gaps or technical solutions to further enhance the team's effectiveness and alignment with operational best practices.<br><br> Additional Areas Of Responsibility Include <br><ul><li> Securing Endpoint Protection across an organization including legacy operating systems (ie. Windows 2003)</li><li> Understanding of security parameters within Windows/ Linux and ways to secure these through Crowdstrike</li><li> Experience working with MSSP and managing the relationship as it pertains to Endpoint Protection</li><li> O365 Security (implementing Microsoft Information Protection, securing the environment within Azure AD)</li><li> Knowledge of BeyondTrust and migration from McAfee</li><li> Own the engineering and maintenance for Crowdstrike, Microsoft Information Protection, SentinelOne, and McAfee Solidcore for whitelisting</li><li> Work with Security Operations team to understand Endpoint alerts needed, and ways to continuously make this more effective for their day to day operations</li><li> Collaboration with technology and business partners across functions/processes to ensure product currency, alignment, understanding and ongoing communication on product upgrades, policy changes or new deployments</li><li> Make recommendations and assist in the implementation of changes to strengthen processes, procedures and compliance resulting in enhanced information security, service continuity or reduced IT risk.<br><br></li></ul> Required Skills <br><br>Significant experience (+5 years) and demonstrated expertise working in the fields Infrastructure Security and Endpoint Security.<br><br>Specific knowledge related to Endpoint Security products and required skill sets including:<br><ul><li> Anti-virus</li><li> Endpoint protection on legacy operating systems</li><li> Host Based Intrusion Prevention</li><li> Next generation endpoint protection and advanced threat detection tools</li><li> Real time endpoint data collection and investigation tools</li><li> Infrastructure maintenance including application and database servers</li><li> VB Scripting/Automation</li><li> Microsoft SQL query language<br><br></li></ul>Good knowledge about current security industry solutions, best practices, developments and trends.<br><br> About TEKsystems <br><br>We're partners in transformation. We help clients activate ideas and solutions to take advantage of a new world of opportunity. We are a team of 80,000 strong, working with over 6,000 clients, including 80% of the Fortune 500, across North America, Europe and Asia. As an industry leader in Full-Stack Technology Services, Talent Services, and real-world application, we work with progressive leaders to drive change. That's the power of true partnership. TEKsystems is an Allegis Group company.<br><br>The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

title: Endpoint Security Engineer
description: A client in the Greater Chicago area is seeking a Systems/Networking Engineer to join their team. In this role you will manage and maintain Windows servers, ensuring optimal performance, security, and availability. You will configure, monitor, and troubleshoot network infrastructure, and you will provide technical support and assistance to end-users, resolving issues related to systems, networks, and connectivity. This is a full time, direct hire role.<br><br><strong>Location:</strong> Hybrid in the Great Chicago area (on site 3x/wk)<br><br><strong>Salary: </strong>Up to 120K DOE<br><br><strong><u>Requirements<br></u></strong><ul><li>Proven experience as a Systems/Networking Engineer in a Windows environment </li><li>Strong knowledge of Windows servers, VMware, and Active Directory administration </li><li>Familiarity with network protocols, routing, and switching. </li><li>Experience in configuring and troubleshooting VPNs and firewalls </li><li>Solid understanding of network security principles and best practices <br></li></ul><strong><u>Pluses<br></u></strong><ul><li>Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field </li><li>CCNA/CCNP certification\<br></li></ul>indsepchi2hi
industry: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Technology, Information and Internet

Bug Tracking (Jira) tools<br><br>Experience with Agile software development methodology and working with distributed development teams preferably worked in Jira tool<br><br>Analytical mindset and good problem-solving skills.<br><br>Excellent written and verbal communication.<br><br>Experience in working with clients to understand requirements, come up with design and estimate efforts<br><br>Active team player &amp; title: Toshiba Developer
description: <strong>Overview</strong><p><br></p>Starting salary $60,000 - 75,000 based on location, education and experience.<p><br></p>Do you enjoy traveling, meeting customers, hands-on troubleshooting, and working with a great team? If so, this could be the job for you!<p><br></p>We’re looking for people who think critically, communicate effectively, and love seeing a project to completion. You’ll be traveling regionally and across the country, doing programming and troubleshooting of systems and equipment. You will be getting your hands dirty while fixing cutting-edge smart automation equipment.<p><br></p>If you don’t want a desk job, love to work with your hands, and enjoy traveling to new places - your dream job is right in front of you! If you like to sleep in your own bed each night, this is NOT the job for you.<p><br></p>ProAutomated’s core values are Camaraderie, Caring, Determination, Excellence, Innovation, Integrity &amp; Confidence. We are a close-knit company who cares deeply about our team members on both a personal and professional level. As a fair and progressive company, we invest in those who invest their time and energy in us. If you are seeking an entry-level position with a company you intend to build a career with and these values resonate with you, please continue below!<p><br></p>Military/Veteran friendly employer. When surveyed, our military/veteran team members overwhelmingly valued having a job with a sense of purpose, traveling, and appreciated the high standards/expectations of our work.<p><br></p>A snapshot of what we offer:<p><br></p><ul><li>Paid training</li><li>Ability to gain experience with different customers and systems including Honeywell, Intelligrated, Daifuku, Siemens and more.</li><li>Laptop, iPhone, and tools provided for use</li><li>Bonus pay for bonus work!</li><li>Full benefits (Health, Dental, Life, company matching 401k)</li><li>Vacation time upon completion of training &amp; "Take-as-you-need-it" vacation after 18 months of employment.</li><li>5% salary increase at 6 months of employment.</li><li>Annual performance-based increases</li><li>Catastrophe fund to aid ProAutomated team members impacted by major events</li><li>A private company that listens to team members and takes their suggestions seriously.</li></ul><p><br></p>Candidate requirements to set you up for success:<p><br></p><ul><li>Desire to travel - this job is 100% travel.</li><li>Must live within 50 miles of a major international airport.</li><li>Excellent written and verbal communication skills.</li><li>Ability to think clearly and logically through complex situations.</li><li>Comfortable adapting to same day and next day changes to project scope and location.</li><li>Must own a personal car within 45 days of employment with ProAutomated.</li><li>Must be authorized to work in the US for US positions.</li><li>Availability to work a 10-4 schedule. This means working 10 days on a jobsite and then having 4 days off before returning to the job site.</li><li>Availability to work weekends and overnight shifts when necessary.</li><li>Recommended: PLC or programming experience/education or technical field background.</li><li>Recommended: 4 year degree or equivalent experience. Candidates who do not have sufficient education/experience may be considered for Field Service Technician roles.</li></ul><p><br></p>What you will love doing:<p><br></p><ul><li>Ensuring systems are installed correctly (sensors &amp; equipment are calibrated and wired properly).</li><li>Addressing and solving problems with confidence.</li><li>Simple field programming &amp; testing.</li><li>Constant movement. This job will have you on your feet and moving all day! </li><li>Working with new equipment and technology.</li></ul><p><br></p>Interested in finding out more about ProAutomated? Please visit the page of our website.<p><br></p>Principals only. Recruiters, please don't contact this job poster. DO NOT contact us with unsolicited services or offers.<p><br></p>Watch below to get a sense of how your adventure with ProAutomated begins:<p><br></p>Powered by JazzHR<p><br></p>340UzTV9xD
