title: Entry Level Field Service Engineer
description: A financial services company in Illinois is actively seeking an analytical and dedicated Python Developer for a promising opportunity on their staff. In this role, the Python Developer will be responsible for improving the performance and reliability of signal research, historical simulation, portfolio construction, and optimization platforms. Apply today!<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p>The Python Developer will be responsible for:<p><br></p><ul><li>Building new tools for conducting statistical analysis over large datasets</li><li>Designing infrastructure to more effectively leverage cutting-edge compute cluster</li><li>Working in collaboration with quantitative researchers to translate their needs into scalable, standardized solutions</li><li>Developing and executing pipelines for onboarding new data sources for ingestion in research and production</li><li>Establishing an engineering culture within the trading team</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Degree in computer science, engineering, or similar technical discipline</li><li>3+ years of professional software engineering experience, with Python as a primary language</li><li>Significant experience working with Python scientific computing packages (numpy, scipy, pandas, matplotlib, sklearn, etc.)</li><li>Strong quantitative reasoning skills</li><li>Demonstrated interest in working at the intersection of research and software engineering</li><li>Ability to multitask</li><li>Team-oriented</li><li>Exceptional communication skills</li></ul>
industry: Banking, Venture Capital and Private Equity Principals, and Financial Services

title: Python Developer
description: <strong>Want to be a part of our team?<br><br></strong>Provides technical support to field engineers, technicians, and product support personnel who are diagnosing, troubleshooting, repairing, and debugging complex electro/mechanical equipment, computer systems, complex software, or networked and/or wireless systems.<br><br>Responds to situations where first-line product support has failed to isolate or fix problems in malfunctioning equipment or software. Reports design, reliability, and maintenance problems or bugs to design engineering/software engineering. May be involved in customer installation and training.<br><br>Provides support to customers/users where the product is highly technical or sophisticated in nature.<br><br><strong>Working at NTT<br></strong><ul><li>Services Window: 9*5</li><li>After office hours on call support will be provided for priority tickets. </li><li>Location: Gurgaon office</li><li>Resident Engineer will have minimum 3 years of experience along with relevant security monitoring experience NAC, EDR, WAF, NIPS, Anti-APT, Antivirus etc solution</li><li>He should have knowledge on monitoring tool i.e SolarWinds etc. </li><li>He should have knowledge on VMC vulnerability management</li><li>He should have knowledge on compliance management. </li><li>He should have any basic security certification i.e CompTIA+ security, CCNA Security etc<br><br></li></ul><strong>1.2 Scope for onsite Resource:<br></strong><ul><li>Provide business hours support within defined SBI Card SLA of incident/change/problem management. </li><li>Provide L1 support for IT security incidents and incidents related to security components. </li><li>Track and monitor incidents surfaced from internal &amp; external attacks. Also, coordinate between the teams for root cause analysis and corrective actions</li><li>Anti-virus – Virus Incident review and end to end tracking &amp; ensure necessary remediation via the IT &amp; DC Support team. </li><li>Responsible to look after security alerts/Event for respective installed SecOps tools. </li><li>Responsible to participate in incident event and to prepare respective response. </li><li>Co-ordination with different team/stakeholder to close any incident, event, or changes. </li><li>He would have knowledge on ITIL process. </li><li>He would prepare and provide compliance /KPI etc related documents. </li><li>Work in 24*7 shift as per defined roster<br><br></li></ul><strong>What will make you a good fit for the role?</strong>

title: MS Engineer (L1)
description: <strong><u>Description</u></strong><p><br></p><strong> Engineer III </strong><p><br></p><strong> Build the Possibilities. Make an extraordinary impact. </strong><p><br></p>Responsible for the delivery of end to end system development and maintenance on complex technology systems within assigned client group, business unit or corporate department.<p><br></p><strong><u>How You Will Make An Impact</u></strong><p><br></p><strong> Primary duties may include, but are not limited to: </strong><p><br></p>Development on medium to large complex customer technology platforms or architectures. Maintains active relationships with internal and/or external stakeholder to develop business requirements. Analyzes and classifies complex change request and identifies and documents possible system code enhancements. Demonstrates knowledge of industry trends, our products and infrastructure. Collaborates with engineers and graphic designers, analyzes and classifies complex change request and reviews and evaluates possible enhancements. Works with development team to develop and define application scope and objectives and prepare functional and/or technical specifications. Analyzes and evaluates detailed business and technical requirements. Understands the product and analytics and drive requirements that take into account stakeholders needs. Identifies problems/risks. Codes and maintains complex components of information systems. Mentors others on coding standards and performs code reviews. Reviews test cases and advises QA on adjacent code/regression impact. Develops and performs system testing and fixes defects identified during testing and re-executes unit tests to validate results. Aids in integrating activities with other IT departments for successful implementation and support of project efforts. Provides on call support and monitors the system and identifies system deficiencies.<p><br></p><strong><u>Minimum Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p>Requires an BA/BS degree in Information Technology, Computer Science or related field of study and a minimum of 3 years experience on one platform, multi database, multi language or multi business application; or any combination of education and experience, which would provide an equivalent background. Experience mentoring others, leading small projects and providing troubleshooting support is strongly preferred.<p><br></p><strong><u>Preferred Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Hands on experience in ETL, Data warehouse, BI.</li><li> AWS/GCP Cloud Experience, Knowledge of EMR, Glue preferred.</li><li> Experience with Teradata, Snowflake</li><li> Strong relational database SQL skills including optimization techniques.</li><li> Experience with, Spark, python preferred.</li><li> Experience in the healthcare sector preferred.</li><li> Experience in Agile development methodology preferred.</li></ul><p><br></p>This is a hybrid work schedule to work from an Elevance Pulse Point 2-3 times per month.<p><br></p>Please be advised that Elevance Health only accepts resumes from agencies that have a signed agreement with Elevance Health. Accordingly, Elevance Health is not obligated to pay referral fees to any agency that is not a party to an agreement with Elevance Health. Thus, any unsolicited resumes, including those submitted to hiring managers, are deemed to be the property of Elevance Health.<p><br></p><strong>Be part of an Extraordinary Team</strong><p><br></p>Elevance Health is a health company dedicated to improving lives and communities – and making healthcare simpler. A Fortune 20 company with a longstanding history in the healthcare industry, we are looking for leaders at all levels of the organization who are passionate about making an impact on our members and the communities we serve. You will thrive in a complex and collaborative environment where you take action and ownership to solve problems and lead change. Do you want to be part of a larger purpose and an evolving, high-performance culture that empowers you to make an impact?<p><br></p>We offer a range of market-competitive total rewards that include merit increases, paid holidays, Paid Time Off, and incentive bonus programs (unless covered by a collective bargaining agreement), medical, dental, vision, short and long term disability benefits, 401(k) +match, stock purchase plan, life insurance, wellness programs and financial education resources, to name a few.<p><br></p>The health of our associates and communities is a top priority for Elevance Health. We require all new candidates in certain patient/member-facing roles to become vaccinated against COVID-19. If you are not vaccinated, your offer will be rescinded unless you provide – and Elevance Health approves – a valid religious or medical explanation as to why you are not able to get vaccinated that Elevance Health is able to reasonably accommodate. Elevance Health will also follow all relevant federal, state and local laws.<p><br></p>Elevance Health has been named as a Fortune Great Place To Work in 2022, has been ranked for five years running as one of the 2023 World’s Most Admired Companies by Fortune magazine, and is a growing Top 20 Fortune 500 Company. To learn more about our company and apply, please visit us at careers.ElevanceHealth.com. Elevance Health is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, citizenship status, color, creed, disability, ethnicity, genetic information, gender (including gender identity and gender expression), marital status, national origin, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, veteran status or any other status or condition protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws. Applicants who require accommodation to participate in the job application process may contact ability@icareerhelp.com for assistance.

title: Engineer III
description: <strong>A Place Where People Matter. <br><br></strong>Start your career journey with Univar Solutions! Here you can make an impact on the world around you and accelerate your career in areas that energize and excite you.<br><br>The Regional Transportation Analyst is a critical supply chain role that is essential in collecting and interpreting complex and copious amounts of transportation and logistics data in order to evaluate the efficiency of transits and provide transportation network optimization recommendations.<br><br>Develops complex routing and dispatch efficiency models using programs such as Lamasoft, Alteryx, and Tableau to extract data, identify efficiency opportunities, and present findings and suggestions in a succinct and executable fashion that can be used by the transportation management team to drive effective and efficient transportation operations within the region.<br><br>Additionally, this role will lead the effort in creating visual analytics dashboards to report key performance indicators and develop actionable recommendations to drive tangible transportation performance and network execution efficiencies within each of Univar Solutions’ regions.<br><br><strong>WHAT YOU'LL DO:<br></strong><ul><li>Utilizes data-gathering and complex modeling strategies as well as quantitative analytical processes for business visibility and reporting as well as modal and network optimization purposes.</li><li>Assists by preparing the actual business reports, which may include data on shipments, carriers, operational and financial performance, and modal management, by gathering data from multiple sources</li><li>Works in region, conferring with directors and managers, to gather requirements and specifications while developing and implementing complex mathematical models with enhanced data and reporting tools to aid in transportation modal management and risk assessment decisions driving effective and efficient transportation operations.</li><li>Works to gain a better sense of the current shortcomings in reporting technology and devise solutions to enhance reporting and data management.</li><li>Ensures a high level of accuracy, and efficiency. Validates results and conducts routine audits of data storage systems and database.</li><li>Develops complex routing and dispatch efficiency models using programs such as Lamasoft, Alteryx, and Tableau to extract data, identify efficiency opportunities, and present findings and suggestions in a succinct and executable fashion.</li><li>Analyst will be responsible for monitoring service, identifying cost saving opportunities, and driving service improvements.</li><li>Track the savings generated by other operational efficiency programs and strategic transformation initiatives.</li><li>Conduct quantitative analysis to make independent decisions in accordance with Univar Solutions’ delivery strategies and objectives</li><li>Prepare enhanced data visualizations, presenting network and performance information, developing data processing and analysis tools, and supporting development of dashboards and online platforms.<br><br></li></ul><strong>WHAT YOU'LL NEED:<br></strong><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree required, preferably in Logistics Management </li><li>Deep knowledge and proficiency using PC based packages such as Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook</li><li>Must have excellent analytical and problem-solving skills</li><li>Strong work ethic, highly motivated</li><li>Able to communicate and collaborate well to understand business needs and deliver data driven insights with efficiency and accuracy</li><li>Strong organizational and time management skills with the ability to handle diverse and significant workload.</li><li>Ability to recommend strategies and to translate strategies into tactics.</li><li>Working knowledge and experience with SAP, various TMS platforms, Lamasoft, Tableau, SQL, Alteryx, Python, and/or other inventory, modeling and visual business analytics (VBA) platforms</li><li>Working onsite three days/week<br><br></li></ul>Univar Solutions is a leading, global distributor of chemicals and ingredients <strong>essential to the safety, health, and well-being of our daily lives</strong> from life-saving medicines and vitamins to hand sanitizers and industrial materials used for cleaning, construction, and more. Our global team of more than <strong>10,000 employees </strong>supports our vision to redefine distribution and be the most valued chemical and ingredient distributor on the planet!<br><br>We offer a <strong>Total Rewards package </strong>that includes market-aligned pay and incentives as well as a diverse benefit offering to<strong> support our employees’ physical, emotional, and financial well-being.<br><br></strong>Univar Solutions supports <strong>sustainable solutions </strong>for the world around us so that we can do our part to<strong> help keep our communities healthy, fed, clean, and safe! <br><br></strong><strong>We are committed to a diverse workforce and a culture of inclusion.</strong> Together, we are building a culture that acknowledges individuals' unique experiences, perspectives and expertise and provides the development and growth opportunities to empower us to redefine our industry.<br><br>Univar Solutions is an equal-opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against based on their race, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or other protected classification.

title: Regional Transportation Analyst
description: Job Title<br><br>Senior Developer<br><br>Relevant Experience<br><br>(in Yrs)<br><br>4+<br><br>Technical/Functional Skills<br><br>Design, develop and maintain Azure Redis Cache solutions for our enterprise applications.<br><br>Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand application requirements and provide optimal cache solutions.<br><br>Optimize Redis Cache performance to ensure the highest levels of availability and scalability.<br><br>Monitor Redis Cache instances and troubleshoot issues to ensure optimal performance and stability.<br><br>Develop scripts and tools to automate deployment, management, and monitoring of Redis Cache instances.<br><br>Stay up-to-date with emerging technologies and industry trends related to Redis Cache and NoSQL databases.<br><br><strong><u>Experience Required<br><br></u></strong>Minimum 5-8 years<br><br>Roles &amp; Responsibilities<br><br>Package management of application using docker builds using maven/gradle.<br><br>Externalizing dependencies on docker using persistent volume claims.<br><br>Management of trust store and keystores using docker.<br><br>Expose services hosted on K8S using ISTIO ingress.<br><br>Versioning of docker images and storing them in repository ( ACR).<br><br>Housekeeping of SNAPSHOTs and Release docker image<br><br>Education<br><br>Bachelors or Masters with Majors in Science, EE, IT, CS, ECE etc<br><br>Start date (dd-mmm-yy)<br><br>01-Apr-2023<br><br>Duration of assignment (in Months)<br><br>12+ Months<br><br>Work Location (State, City and Zip)<br><br>Deerfield IL<br><br>Key words to search in resume<br><br>Redis, Cache

title: Redis Developer
description: <strong><u>Job Description</u></strong><p><br></p><strong>Identity &amp; Access Management Developer</strong> <strong>Remote </strong> <strong>6+ Months Contract</strong> Experience Required:<p><br></p><ul><li>3-5 years of advanced experience in all aspects of Active Directory Architecture and Administration (Schema, Replication, DNS, Permissions flow, Trust Management, Group Policy Management, Backup/Recovery, Security)</li><li>3-5 years of general Windows Server administration</li><li>2 years administering Azure Active Directory</li><li>PowerShell or equivalent scripting experience (python / C#)</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Preferred</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>LDAP Administration experience (example: ODSEE/OpenLDAP/OpenDJ/etc.)</li><li>Working knowledge of Azure Active Directory Connect and administering Microsoft 365</li><li>Previous experience with Privileged Access Management</li><li>Previous experience in Identity &amp; Access Management</li><li>Familiarity with Okta</li><li>Familiarity with SQL and ability to write simple queries.</li><li>Familiarity with using the Linux Operating System</li><li>Working knowledge of Firewalls and troubleshooting firewall and network issues</li><li>Working knowledge of 3rd party and Microsoft CA certificate management</li><li>Previous experience mentoring junior resources.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Required</u></strong><p><br></p><strong>Job Competencies:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Professional and effective written and oral communication skills</li><li>Ability to use analytical and quantitative skills and diagnostic techniques to resolve problems.</li><li>Ability to manage complex technical details.</li><li>Familiarity with project management and business analyst processes and methodology</li><li>Ability to communicate technical concepts to non-technical staff.</li><li>Ability to effectively converse with, and listen to, all levels of users to understand their environment and the impact of system changes.</li><li>Sensitivity to the cultural requirements on a campus for collegial and participative interactions.</li><li>Ability to work in a collaborative team environment.</li><li>Confidentiality related to sensitive University matters such as strategic initiatives, trade secrets, quiet periods, and scientific discoveries yet to be put in the public domain.</li><li>Confidentiality related to personal information access.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> 70%</li><li>Leads architectural discussion and implementation of directory services.</li><li>Provides tier two ticket support for all IAM services.</li><li>Provides tier one and tier two ticket support for the Directory.</li><li>Creates documentation (knowledge base articles) for IAM services.</li><li>Creates short instructional videos for IAM services.</li><li>Trains and mentor’s student Support Analysts</li><li>Helps to keep recurring projects, such as the Directory Reviewer Refresh, on track and current.</li><li> 25%</li><li>Works with the University divisions and departments to gather requirements for projects and updates to current services.</li><li>Develops requirements and feedback into documentation that can be used to further IAM development of new services or refinement of current services.</li><li> 5%</li><li>Other duties as assigned.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Job #: 23-09055</strong>

title: Identity & Access Management Developer - Remote #: 23-09055
description: <strong>We are open to hybrid candidates located near any Zeno US Office: NYC, DC, CHI, Silicon Valley/San Francisco.</strong><p><br></p><strong>We are open to fully remote candidates who are not located near a Zeno office and reside in the following states: CA, CO, CT, FL, GA, IL, IN, KY, MA, MD, MI, MN, NC, NJ, NY, OH, OR, PA, TN, TX, UT, VA, WA, WI</strong><p><br></p><strong><u>About The Job</u></strong><p><br></p>We are looking for an analytically talented individual to join the Zeno Group Analytics team. This individual will be responsible for managing the analytics strategy and performance reporting across our digital/paid media accounts.<p><br></p>This role is for a Senior Analyst in a communications world - straddling the intersection between numbers and messages. Daily, you will utilize tools and strategies to translate raw data into valuable business insights and optimization suggestions. Working closely with the PR and Digital teams in order to implement data-driven recommendations generated through proprietary in-house learnings at scale and across multiple clients.<p><br></p><strong><u>About You</u></strong><p><br></p>As a Senior Analyst, you will be the analytics lead for your respective accounts, getting involved at the inception of new campaigns/programs as well as new business opportunities. You will work with digital channel owners and media monitoring experts to help analyze performance and identify key learnings and provide recommendations that will propel the client forward. You will lead client-specific projects from data cleaning and aggregation to visual creation and finally to report completion as you analyze the results to create actionable insights that will guide strategic decisions, uncovering real-time optimization opportunities that impact the bottom line.<p><br></p>The candidate must be data agnostic, willing to leverage information from a bevy of sources to best analyze the problem and forge a solution. This person will build, develop and maintain data structures, reporting systems and build customized dashboards based on KPIs that will support key business decisions and shape future programming recommendations.<p><br></p>This analytics team works in lockstep with the digital team at Zeno and will interact with every facet of the organization and, at times, clients as well. If you have an affinity for a wide gamut of data and are yearning to augment your knowledge, this role will allow you access to some of the most diverse datasets and tools around. That said, this person must be willing to get their hands dirty and roll up their sleeves in order to optimize existing processes, create best practices, work cross-functionally, ensure data validation, as well as build data visualizations from the ground up.<p><br></p><strong><u>This Person Must</u></strong><p><br></p><strong><u>Love to tinker:</u></strong> What better way to learn than diving in and trying new tools or approaches to data and strategy? The more creative the solution, the better!<p><br></p><strong><u>Be a self-starter</u></strong>: Someone who loves taking challenges head-on.<p><br></p><strong><u>Love Technology</u>: </strong> An aptitude for and general interest in technology will go a long way to success in this role.<p><br></p><strong><u>Think critically</u>: </strong> PR is difficult to measure in nature, we're looking for candidates that can think outside the box and are solution-oriented.<p><br></p><strong><u>Learn, teach and collaborate</u>:</strong> This role is as much about teaching those around you as it is taking on challenges of your own. Collaboration is key and communication is essential.<p><br></p><strong><u>Be willing to laugh</u>: </strong> We have a lot of fun and we hope you would, too.<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Providing end-to-end marketing analytics support for multiple clients across our paid media portfolio.</li><li>Identifying appropriate KPIs based on business objectives and authoring related measurement and test plans. </li><li>Evaluating and recommending specific measurement partners/tools. </li><li>Implementing and testing tracking infrastructure prior to campaign launch, including tracking tag generation from website analytics systems (e.g., Google/Adobe Analytics) and/or ad serving systems (e.g., DCM). </li><li>Aggregating data from various sources (including but not limited to site analytics, third-party ad servers, social listening platforms, call center data, CRM, etc.) into integrated report templates or dashboards. </li><li>Providing quality assurance of data throughout the life of a campaign, including ongoing tracking, maintenance, and issue resolution with regard to measurement framework while programs are in the market. </li><li>Drawing insights from campaign data and making actionable recommendations for improvement; presenting findings to internal teams and/or clients. </li><li>Developing and maintaining relationships with key partners in the data, measurement, and analytics space.</li><li>Providing an accurate and timely review of junior staff work products as needed. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 (i.e., at least 2 weeks after last dose) and, if hired, present proof or vaccination before start date. Candidates may request an accommodation due to a disability or sincerely held religious belief or an exception required under applicable law. </li><li>3+ years of experience as a hands-on marketing analyst for paid media. </li><li>Intermediate level proficiency of web site analytics packages (Google, Adobe), online ad serving systems (DCM, The Tradedesk) or Supermetrics.</li><li>Working Knowledge of Tableau and / or Looker Data Studio.</li><li>Intermediate level proficiency of Microsoft Excel and pivot tables.</li><li>Detail-oriented and well-organized. </li><li>Strong qualitative and quantitative skills. </li><li>Strong communication skills (written &amp; verbal).</li><li>Ability to manage timelines and multitask across a variety of projects. </li><li>Ability to work independently as well as part of a team. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><em>Pay range: $52,000-$78,000/year USD</em></strong><p><br></p><strong><em>An employee’s pay position within the salary range will be based on several factors including, but not limited to, relevant education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, seniority, geographic location, performance, travel requirements, revenue-based metrics, any contractual agreements, and business or organizational needs. The range listed is just one component of DJEH’s total compensation package for employees. Other rewards may include annual bonuses, a Paid Time Off policy, and region-specific benefits.</em></strong><p><br></p><strong><u>About Us</u></strong><p><br></p>Zeno Group is the fiercely independent and global integrated communications agency, born from PR. We bring together the boldest and brightest talent to help clients across industries and sectors unleash the power of strategic communications. Guided by our ‘Fearless Pursuit of the Unexpected,’ we push the boundaries to achieve real business value and societal impact for clients. Winner of the industry’s most coveted awards including the 2021 <em>PRovoke </em>Global Creative Agency of the Year, 2021 <em>PRovoke</em> North American Agency of the Year and 2021 <em>PRWeek</em> Agency of the Year. We are honored to be a three-time winner of <em>PRWeek</em>’s Best Places to Work. Zeno has also been previously recognized by the Cannes Lions International Festival of Creativity. Zeno is a DJE Holdings Company.<p><br></p><strong><u>About Our Benefits</u></strong><p><br></p>Healthy, happy employees make Zeno better, so we have programs that support physical, mental and financial wellness. Our culture and benefits are designed to promote flexibility, celebrate diversity and support work/life balance. We offer a variety of medical, dental and vision insurance with prescription plans, as well as short and long-term disability. Our Be Kind to Your Mind program focuses on mental health, providing a paid subscription to Headspace and access to mental health providers and other services through a best-in-class employee assistance program. Employees are encouraged to bring their authentic self to Zeno and participate in our employee resource groups which build communities for sharing and support. And while we love our work, we believe in the restorative power of time off with generous vacation, paid holidays and self-care time. Employees are supported in their pursuit of financial wellness with a 401(k) plan, pretax flexible spending accounts, tuition assistance, life insurance and free access to a certified financial coach. And our unique ZenoFit program provides a monthly allowance to fund activities in your personal life that bring you joy and keep you healthy. These and other benefits are available to non-temporary employees in the US.<p><br></p>
description_json: <strong>We are open to hybrid candidates located near any Zeno US Office: NYC, DC, CHI, Silicon Valley/San Francisco.</strong><p><br></p><strong>We are open to fully remote candidates who are not located near a Zeno office and reside in the following states: CA, CO, CT, FL, GA, IL, IN, KY, MA, MD, MI, MN, NC, NJ, NY, OH, OR, PA, TN, TX, UT, VA, WA, WI</strong><p><br></p><strong><u>About The Job</u></strong><p><br></p>We are looking for an analytically talented individual to join the Zeno Group Analytics team. This individual will be responsible for managing the analytics strategy and performance reporting across our digital/paid media accounts.<p><br></p>This role is for a Senior Analyst in a communications world - straddling the intersection between numbers and messages. Daily, you will utilize tools and strategies to translate raw data into valuable business insights and optimization suggestions. Working closely with the PR and Digital teams in order to implement data-driven recommendations generated through proprietary in-house learnings at scale and across multiple clients.<p><br></p><strong><u>About You</u></strong><p><br></p>As a Senior Analyst, you will be the analytics lead for your respective accounts, getting involved at the inception of new campaigns/programs as well as new business opportunities. You will work with digital channel owners and media monitoring experts to help analyze performance and identify key learnings and provide recommendations that will propel the client forward. You will lead client-specific projects from data cleaning and aggregation to visual creation and finally to report completion as you analyze the results to create actionable insights that will guide strategic decisions, uncovering real-time optimization opportunities that impact the bottom line.<p><br></p>The candidate must be data agnostic, willing to leverage information from a bevy of sources to best analyze the problem and forge a solution. This person will build, develop and maintain data structures, reporting systems and build customized dashboards based on KPIs that will support key business decisions and shape future programming recommendations.<p><br></p>This analytics team works in lockstep with the digital team at Zeno and will interact with every facet of the organization and, at times, clients as well. If you have an affinity for a wide gamut of data and are yearning to augment your knowledge, this role will allow you access to some of the most diverse datasets and tools around. That said, this person must be willing to get their hands dirty and roll up their sleeves in order to optimize existing processes, create best practices, work cross-functionally, ensure data validation, as well as build data visualizations from the ground up.<p><br></p><strong><u>This Person Must</u></strong><p><br></p><strong><u>Love to tinker:</u></strong> What better way to learn than diving in and trying new tools or approaches to data and strategy? title: Senior Analyst, Digital
description: <strong>Identity &amp; Access Management Developer</strong><strong>Remote    </strong><strong>6+ Months Contract</strong> Experience Required:<ul><li>3-5 years of advanced experience in all aspects of Active Directory Architecture and Administration (Schema, Replication, DNS, Permissions flow, Trust Management, Group Policy Management, Backup/Recovery, Security)</li><li>3-5 years of general Windows Server administration</li><li>2 years administering Azure Active Directory</li><li>PowerShell or equivalent scripting experience (python / C#)</li></ul> <br><strong>Preferred:</strong><ul><li>LDAP Administration experience (example: ODSEE/OpenLDAP/OpenDJ/etc.)</li><li>Working knowledge of Azure Active Directory Connect and administering Microsoft 365</li><li>Previous experience with Privileged Access Management</li><li>Previous experience in Identity &amp; Access Management</li><li>Familiarity with Okta</li><li>Familiarity with SQL and ability to write simple queries.</li><li>Familiarity with using the Linux Operating System</li><li>Working knowledge of Firewalls and troubleshooting firewall and network issues</li><li>Working knowledge of 3rd party and Microsoft CA certificate management</li><li>Previous experience mentoring junior resources.</li></ul> <br><strong>Job Competencies:<br></strong>Required:<ul><li>Professional and effective written and oral communication skills</li><li>Ability to use analytical and quantitative skills and diagnostic techniques to resolve problems.</li><li>Ability to manage complex technical details.</li><li>Familiarity with project management and business analyst processes and methodology</li><li>Ability to communicate technical concepts to non-technical staff.</li><li>Ability to effectively converse with, and listen to, all levels of users to understand their environment and the impact of system changes.</li><li>Sensitivity to the cultural requirements on a campus for collegial and participative interactions.</li><li>Ability to work in a collaborative team environment.</li><li>Confidentiality related to sensitive University matters such as strategic initiatives, trade secrets, quiet periods, and scientific discoveries yet to be put in the public domain.</li><li>Confidentiality related to personal information access.</li></ul> <br><strong>Responsibilities:<br></strong> <br>   <br>      <br>• 70%<ul><li>Leads architectural discussion and implementation of directory services.</li><li>Provides tier two ticket support for all IAM services.</li><li>Provides tier one and tier two ticket support for the Directory.</li><li>Creates documentation (knowledge base articles) for IAM services.</li><li>Creates short instructional videos for IAM services.</li><li>Trains and mentor’s student Support Analysts</li><li>Helps to keep recurring projects, such as the Directory Reviewer Refresh, on track and current.</li></ul> <br>• 25%<ul><li>Works with the University divisions and departments to gather requirements for projects and updates to current services.</li><li>Develops requirements and feedback into documentation that can be used to further IAM development of new services or refinement of current services.</li></ul>• 5%<ul><li>Other duties as assigned.</li></ul>

title: Identity & Access Management Developer - Remote
description: <strong>JOB INFORMATION</strong><p><br></p><strong> Job Title: ETL Lead Developer </strong><strong> (100% Remote)</strong><p><br></p><strong> Role: Long Term Contract (C2C / W2 / 1099)</strong><p><br></p><strong> No CPT and OPT Resumes</strong><p><br></p><strong><u>Job Summary</u></strong><p><br></p>Minimum 5 years of experience in ETL and Abinitio. Experience in Pervasive ETL tool. Candidate should be good in data management, databases and SQL. Candidate should be efficient in Cloud environment skills like AWS and Unix scripting is must. Good in overall databases and skills. Strong exposure to business domain in banking is preferred. Candidate should be able to elaborate business requirements and comprehend business needs; good communication skills.<p><br></p><strong> Required Skills: </strong>Ab initio, ACE, Ab Initio Administration, Ab Initio Data Profiler<p><br></p><strong> Nice to Have Skills:</strong> Pervasive ETL Data Integrator, Snowflake<p><br></p><strong><u>Roles &amp; Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p>Develop and maintain ETL solutions to fit business needs. ETL development require one or more of the following: ETL tool knowledge, database, Agile and DevOps development.<p><br></p>Work independently or with own team to innovate on and enhance development practices and processes.<p><br></p>Collaborate within the team to innovate on and enhance development practices and processes.<p><br></p>Develops and maintains backend systems<p><br></p>Supports live systems to ensure business continuity<p><br></p>Creates and maintains devops processes, application infrastructure, and utilizes cloud services (including database systems and models)<p><br></p>Work with modelers to understand requirements and align on capabilities that a deliver reusability and automation<p><br></p>Experience in Python, Teradata, Snowflake development or related development experience<p><br></p>Experience in automated software build &amp; deployment automation in distributed cloud environment such as AWS, GCP, Azure<p><br></p><strong><u>Experience Developing And Implementing Automation Capabilities And Re-usable Components</u></strong><p><br></p>Experience working with code repositories such as Github, EME and competent in implementing versioning, branching<p><br></p>Experience working with a variety of data platforms such as S3, Snowflake<p><br></p>Understanding of observability and how to achieve reliability in a service<p><br></p>Understanding of software testing principles and methodologies<p><br></p>Experience as part of an Agile engineering or development team<p><br></p>Strong understanding of object-oriented principles

serve as the focal point for infrastructure-related issue / crisis resolution</li><li>See opportunities to save costs and more effectively handle assets</li><li>Ensure communication of process and procedure changes to key stakeholders</li><li>Design an effective test plan for any new / changed infrastructure technology and work with Project Managers, QA / Testing</li><li>Managers and Release Managers to ensure its implementation before the client takes possession of the system</li><li>Support identification and collection of metrics and performance reporting processes</li><li>Monitors delivery against SLAs and reports exceptions to management</li><li>Participate in process improvement initiatives, when applicable</li><li>Business Partnership</li><li>Maintain contact with the business users to proactively identify needed changes</li><li>Establish working relationships with technical, business and sourcing counterparts</li><li>Participate in process improvement initiatives</li><li>People Management</li><li>Handle individual workload and deliver to agreed upon milestones</li><li>Proactively promote consistent project-based performance measurement and skill development of junior staff</li><li>Actively participate in HR performance measurement processes</li><li>Demonstrate ability to work in team environment and help resolve issues</li><li>Provide input to staffing plans at the project-level to identify key / required skills<br><br></li></ul><strong>Qualifications<br></strong><ul><li>College degree in related technical / business areas or equivalent work experience</li><li>Understanding of the technology organization and / or business and technology</li><li>Re-engineering / process improvement experience, leading and coaching quality improvement projects</li><li>Strong change management skills; change agent</li><li>Excellent problem solving / analytical skills and knowledge of analytical tools</li><li>Excellent written and verbal communication skills</li><li>Ability to create / define metrics that accurately reflects the current state of a given process</li><li>Knowledge of Six Sigma, CMM and other relevant methodologies<br><br></li></ul>EEO Employer<br><br>Apex Systems is an equal opportunity employer. title: Infrastructure Engineer
description: <strong>Position: </strong> Software Engineer<p><br></p><strong>Duration: </strong>6-12 months<p><br></p><strong>Location: </strong> Chicago, IL 60606 - hybrid onsite 3 days a week<p><br></p>I am looking for a Software Engineer with expertise in Java and Informatica to join a Data Platform Architecture team.<p><br></p>As a Software Engineer, you will be responsible for fine-tuning the Service Layer of our software applications, ensuring their optimal performance and seamless integration. Your primary focus will be on utilizing Java and Informatica to enhance and optimize the service layer components of our systems.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Develop, enhance, and maintain the service layer components of our software applications using Java and Informatica.</li><li>Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including product managers, designers, and other developers, to understand requirements and design efficient solutions.</li><li>Fine-tune the service layer to improve performance, scalability, and reliability of our applications.</li><li>Identify and resolve bottlenecks, bugs, and performance issues in the service layer code.</li><li>Conduct code reviews to ensure adherence to coding standards, best practices, and quality guidelines.</li><li>Work closely with database administrators and backend developers to integrate the service layer with backend systems and databases.</li><li>Implement and maintain integrations with external systems using Informatica.</li><li>Optimize data flows and transformations within the service layer to ensure efficient data processing and accurate results.</li><li>Stay updated with the latest industry trends, tools, and technologies related to Java, Informatica, and service layer development.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Requirements:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Software Engineering, or a related field. A relevant master’s degree is a plus.</li><li>Proven experience as a Software Engineer, with a focus on developing and fine-tuning the service layer using Java and Informatica.</li><li>Strong proficiency in Java programming language and related frameworks (e.g., Spring, Spring Boot framework, Hibernate). </li><li>Hands on experience in data pipeline development using modern ETL tools specifically on Informatica PowerCenter and/or Informatica IICS</li><li>Solid understanding of service-oriented architecture (SOA) concepts and RESTful web services.</li><li>Proficiency in SQL and Scripting (Unix shell and /or Python)</li><li>Familiarity with performance optimization techniques and tools for Java applications.</li><li>Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.</li><li>Strong communication and collaboration skills to work effectively within a team.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Skills:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure) and their related services.</li><li>Knowledge of big data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark) and data analytics concepts.</li><li>Experience with containerization and orchestration technologies (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes).</li><li>Understanding of DevOps practices and tools for continuous integration and deployment. </li></ul><p><br></p><em>Did you know about Sterling? As a Sterling contract W2 employee you are become an owner in Sterling. We are an Employee-Owned ESOP (Employee Stock Option Program) Company that itself is an additional retirement benefit on top of our other exceptional Sterling benefits, including paid holidays, PTO, the ability to join the 401K with a company match. Sterling Engineering / Staffing could be your future home.</em><p><br></p><strong>Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or genetic information.</strong><p><br></p><strong>#SP</strong>

CHICAGO<br></li></ul><strong><u>Description<br><br></u></strong><strong>Job Title:</strong> <strong>Engineer III<br><br></strong><strong>Location:</strong> <strong>Hybrid (Considering applicants throughout the US)<br><br></strong><strong>Responsible for the delivery of end to end system development and maintenance on complex technology systems within assigned client group, business unit or complex change request and identifies and documents possible system code enhancements.<br><br></strong><strong>Demonstrates knowledge of industry trends, our products and infrastructure.<br><br></strong><strong>Collaborates with engineers and graphic designers, analyzes and classifies complex change request and reviews and evaluates possible enhancements.<br><br></strong><strong>Works with development team to develop and define application scope and objectives and prepare functional and/or technical specifications.<br><br></strong><strong><u>Analyzes And Evaluates Detailed Business And Technical Requirements.<br><br></u></strong><strong>Understands the product and analytics and drive requirements that take into account stakeholders needs.<br><br></strong><strong>Identifies problems/risks.<br><br></strong><strong>Codes and maintains complex components of information systems.<br><br></strong><strong><u>Mentors Others On Coding Standards And Performs Code Reviews.<br><br></u></strong><strong>Reviews test cases and advises QA on adjacent code/regression impact.<br><br></strong><strong>Develops and performs system testing and fixes defects identified during testing and re-executes unit tests to validate results.<br><br></strong><strong>Aids in integrating activities with other IT departments for successful implementation and support of project efforts.<br><br></strong><strong>Provides on call support and monitors the system and identifies system deficiencies.<br><br></strong><strong><u>Minimum Qualifications<br><br></u></strong><strong>Requires an BA/BS degree in Information Technology, Computer Science or related field of study and a minimum of 3 years experience on one platform, multi database, multi language or multi business application; or any combination of education and experience, which would provide an equivalent background.<br><br></strong><strong><u>Preferred Qualifications<br><br></u></strong><strong>Experience mentoring others, leading small projects and providing troubleshooting support is strongly preferred.<br><br></strong><strong>Knowledge of RDBMS SQL required, T/SQL (Microsoft or Sybase) preferred.<br><br></strong><strong><u>Exposure To ETL Tool (SSIS, Data Stage, Informatica) Preferred<br><br></u></strong><strong>Exposure to UNIX / LINUX preferred.<br><br></strong><strong>Knowledge of scripting language as a bonus.<br><br></strong><strong>If this job is assigned to any Government Business Division entity, the applicant and incumbent fall under a 'sensitive position' work designation and may be subject to additional requirements beyond those associates outside Government Business Divisions. Requirements include but are not limited to more stringent and frequent background checks and/or government clearances, segregation of duties principles, role specific training, monitoring of daily job functions, and sensitive data handling instructions. Associates in these jobs must follow the specific policies, procedures, guidelines, etc. as stated by the Government Business Division in which they are employed.<br><br></strong>Please be advised that Elevance Health only accepts resumes from agencies that have a signed agreement with Elevance Health. Accordingly, Elevance Health is not obligated to pay referral fees to any agency that is not a party to an agreement with Elevance Health. Thus, any unsolicited resumes, including those submitted to hiring managers, are deemed to be the property of Elevance Health.<br><br><strong>Be part of an Extraordinary Team<br><br></strong>Elevance Health is a health company dedicated to improving lives and communities – and making healthcare simpler. A Fortune 20 company with a longstanding history in the healthcare industry, we are looking for leaders at all levels of the organization who are passionate about making an impact on our members and the communities we serve. You will thrive in a complex and collaborative environment where you take action and ownership to solve problems and lead change. description: <ul><li>Job Family: Development and Engineering</li><li>Type: Full time</li><li>Date Posted:Apr 17, 2023</li><li>Req #: JR56408<br></li></ul><strong>Location:<br></strong><ul><li>IL, CHICAGO</li><li>National +50 Miles away from nearest PulsePoint, National +50 Miles away from nearest PulsePoint<br></li></ul><strong><u>Description<br><br></u></strong><strong>Job Title: Application Security Engineer III<br><br></strong><strong>Job Location: Chicago, IL (100% Remote)<br><br></strong><strong><u>Job Summary<br><br></u></strong>Responsible for managing the delivery of information and network security systems and/or technology services, which may include server, desktop, software, network, database, helpdesk components.<br><br><strong><u>Primary Duties Include But Are Not Limited To<br></u></strong><ul><li>Provides trouble resolution on complex problems and leads implementations for system and network security technologies</li><li>Develops testing plans to ensure quality of implementation</li><li>Coordinates and prepares the reporting of data security events and incidents</li><li>Provides system and network architecture support for information and network security technologies</li><li>Provides technical support to business and technology associates in risk assessments and implementation of appropriate information security procedures, standards and technologies</li><li>Represents major upgrades and reconfigurations in change control</li><li>Design &amp; analyze mix of vendor services meeting business and information security requirements</li><li>Maintains relationship with key vendors/strategic partners within organization</li><li>Determine and perform complex configuration changes to meet business and information security requirements</li><li>Perform capacity analysis</li><li>Recommend and implement capacity increases</li><li>Serve as the technical escalation for results of preventative maintenance routines</li><li>Supervise preventative maintenance</li><li>Represents infrastructure security support in significant projects and performs the most complex operations and administration tasks</li><li>Respond to level 3 &amp; 4 change and problem requests without supervision</li><li>Lead level 1 &amp; 2 incident recoveries and root cause analysis.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Minimum Requirements<br></u></strong><ul><li>Requires a BA/BS degree in Information Technology and a minimum of 3 years experience in a support &amp; operations or design &amp; engineering role in any of the following areas: access management or network security technologies, servers, networks, network communications, application security, cyber security or any combination of education and experience, which would provide an equivalent background.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Preferred Qualifications<br></u></strong><ul><li>Technical security certifications (e.g. Systems Security Certified Practitioner) strongly preferred.</li><li>Experience using Static scan tools and Dynamic scan tools like Checkmarx, prisma or Qualys preferred.</li><li>Good experience and understanding of the security best practices in every step of software development lifecycle (SDLC) .</li><li>Experience adhering to secure coding principles and aid in coding/testing the application against security risks/parameters before release.</li><li>Coordination with various cross functional teams on remediating application security findings that comes out pen test, Qualys, Prisma etc.</li><li>Knowledge using app security scan tools and also a good understanding of remediation steps for this is preferred.</li><li>This individual will be responsible for enabling and recommending developers on possible remediation efforts.</li><li>Good understanding of security protocols for web interfaces</li><li>Experience working on application security vulnerabilities remediation for .NET &amp; Java stack</li><li>Experience providing top-tier support for Application Security &amp; 2 or more of the information security technology areas: 1) Access Control, 2) Business Continuity and Disaster Recovery Planning, 3) Cryptography, 4) Information Security and Risk Management 5) Legal, Regulations, 6) Compliance and Investigations, 7) Operations Security, 8) Physical (Environmental) Security, 9) Security Architecture and Design, 10) Telecommunications and Network Security.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Pay Transparency Statement<br><br></u></strong>For candidates working in person or remotely in the below locations, the salary* range for this specific position is $83,520 to $167,040.<br><br>Locations:  California; Colorado; Nevada; Washington State; Jersey City, NJ; New York City, NY; Ithaca, NY and Westchester County, NY<br><br>In addition to your salary, Elevance Health offers benefits such as, a comprehensive benefits package, incentive and recognition programs, equity stock purchase and 401k contribution (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). The salary offered for this specific position is based on a number of legitimate, non-discriminatory factors set by the company.  The company is fully committed to ensuring equal pay opportunities for equal work regardless of gender, race, or any other category protected by federal, state, and local pay equity laws <strong>.<br></strong><ul><li>The salary range is the range Elevance Health in good faith believes is the range of possible compensation for this role at the time of this posting. This range may be modified in the future and actual compensation may vary from posting based on geographic location, work experience, education and/or skill level. Even within the range, the actual compensation will vary depending on the above factors as well as market/business considerations. No amount is considered to be wages or compensation until such amount is earned, vested, and determinable under the terms and conditions of the applicable policies and plans. The amount and availability of any bonus, commission, benefits, or any other form of compensation and benefits that are allocable to a particular employee remains in the Company's sole discretion unless and until paid and may be modified at the Company’s sole discretion, consistent with the law.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Government Statement<br><br></u></strong>If this job is assigned to any Government Business Division entity, the applicant and incumbent fall under a 'sensitive position' work designation and may be subject to additional requirements beyond those associates outside Government Business Divisions. Requirements include but are not limited to more stringent and frequent background checks and/or government clearances, segregation of duties principles, role specific training, monitoring of daily job functions, and sensitive data handling instructions. Associates in these jobs must follow the specific policies, procedures, guidelines, etc. as stated by the Government Business Division in which they are employed<br><br>Please be advised that Elevance Health only accepts resumes from agencies that have a signed agreement with Elevance Health. Accordingly, Elevance Health is not obligated to pay referral fees to any agency that is not a party to an agreement with Elevance Health. Thus, any unsolicited resumes, including those submitted to hiring managers, are deemed to be the property of Elevance Health.<br><br><strong>Be part of an Extraordinary Team<br><br></strong>Elevance Health is a health company dedicated to improving lives and communities – and making healthcare simpler. You will thrive in a complex and collaborative environment where you take action and ownership to solve problems and lead change. Do you want to be part of a larger purpose and an evolving, high-performance culture that empowers you to make an impact?<br><br>We offer a range of market-competitive total rewards that include merit increases, paid holidays, Paid Time Off, and incentive bonus programs (unless covered by a collective bargaining agreement), medical, dental, vision, short and long term disability benefits, 401(k) +match, stock purchase plan, life insurance, wellness programs and financial education resources, to name a few.<br><br>The health of our associates and communities is a top priority for Elevance Health. We require all new candidates in certain patient/member-facing roles to become vaccinated against COVID-19. If you are not vaccinated, your offer will be rescinded unless you provide – and Elevance Health approves – a valid religious or medical explanation as to why you are not able to get vaccinated that Elevance Health is able to reasonably accommodate. Elevance Health will also follow all relevant federal, state and local laws.<br><br>Elevance Health has been named as a Fortune Great Place To Work in 2022, has been ranked for five years running as one of the 2023 World’s Most Admired Companies by Fortune magazine, and is a growing Top 20 Fortune 500 Company. To learn more about our company and apply, please visit us at careers.ElevanceHealth.com. description: <p>Software Engineer&nbsp;</p><p>Chicago, IL (Hybrid)&nbsp;</p><p>w2 contract</p><p><br></p><p>Senior Engineer: This is a senior level position that is ideal for someone skilled, passionate about development, and eager to expand their influence in surrounding areas. This is an opportunity to practice mentorship skills with more-junior developers, often receiving guidance from more experienced mentors. Desired Experience: 4+ years of experience in a full-time development role. Previous experience as a tech lead or team lead, mentoring junior developers</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>Candidate will be expected to contribute immediately building applications in React and Node JS. For visual problems, a combination of JavaScript and CSS, for backend services, mostly Node JS and some Java.</p><p>&nbsp;</p>

title: Digital Reliability Analyst // Chicago, IL
description: <strong>IT Software Engineer II Data Products <br><br></strong><strong> Remote - Chicago IL, California, Florida, Illinois, Indiana, Maryland, Massachusetts, New Jersey, New York, Ohio, South Carolina, Virginia, Wisconsin, Washington D.C. <br><br></strong>The American Medical Association (AMA) is the nation's largest professional Association of physicians and a non-profit organization. We are a unifying voice and powerful ally for America's physicians, the patients they care for, and the promise of a healthier nation. To be part of the AMA is to be part of our Mission to promote the art and science of medicine and the betterment of public health.<br><br>We continuously work to embed equity in our internal practices and are committed to increasing the diversity of our staff across all levels of the organization. We intentionally work to create the right conditions to enable our employees to feel that they can be their authentic selves and fully participate in the life of the enterprise.<br><br>We encourage and support professional development for our employees, and we are dedicated to social responsibility. We invite you to learn more about us and we look forward to getting to know you.<br><br>We have an opportunity for a remote IT Software Engineer, Data Products our Software Strategy and Development team. As a IT Software Engineer, Data Products you will Analyze, design, develop and unit test software solutions (minimal to medium complexity) for business problems. Design, develop, configure, unit test, implement, upgrade, document, maintain, enhance, and support various software systems.Conducts assignments as directed under moderate supervision.<br><br><strong> RESPONSIBILITIES: <br><br></strong><strong> System Development <br></strong><ul><li> Participate in system development life cycle for new solutions as well as enhancements, including requirements analysis, design, and work estimation activities. </li><li> In addition, some projects may require a more iterative approach to software development depending on the methodology being utilized. </li><li> Develop exceptional software solutions to specified end-user business requirements, user stories and complete unit testing for all software development. <br><br></li></ul><strong> System Maintenance <br></strong><ul><li> Participate in technology renewal activities such as applying new software upgrades, patches, and completion of any required programming, testing, and improvements. </li><li> Work with the designated manager to provide operational system support. </li><li> Participate in “break-fix” issue resolution. </li><li> Assist proper validation with end-users to ensure system issue resolution. <br><br></li></ul><strong> System Scale &amp; Optimization <br></strong><ul><li> Proactively raise concerns, issues, and risks regarding assignments to management in a timely manner. </li><li> Share intellectual knowledge, learn, and understand existing application systems, and participate in cross-training with other team members. </li><li> Identify opportunities to simplify and/or optimize current technology investments and/or recommend new technologies for consideration. </li><li> Report project status regularly to project manager. <br><br></li></ul><strong>May Include Other Responsibilities As Assigned<br><br></strong><strong> REQUIREMENTS: <br></strong><ul><li> 3+ years’ experience with software development and/or analysis in applicable information systems tools and technology. Broad technical skills necessary, with a solid understanding of internet/intranet technology. </li><li> Understanding of the systems development life cycle (SDLC) in a Web based development environment. Familiarity with Internet/Intranet environments required. </li><li> HS diploma or equivalent required. BS or BA degree in information technology or related field or equivalent experience is preferred. </li><li> Ability to develop, debug, data analysis, problem analysis, resolve issues, and unit test within web-based application. Knowledge and understanding of the concepts and techniques of object-oriented design development is desirable. </li><li> Ability to effectively create unit test plan and ability to effectively unit test application development enhancements. Demonstrates an understanding of test-driven development.Experience with automated testing tools such as Selenium a plus. </li><li> Ability to work well with people from many different disciplines with varying degrees of technical experience and varying levels within the organization. Demonstrated ability to work well within a team of software engineers on project tasks. </li><li> Understanding of non-for-profit and/or healthcare related business processes a plus. </li><li> Ability to demonstrate effective problem-solving capabilities required. </li><li> Ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously. Manages own time effectively and requires minimal supervision. </li><li> Ability to express technical concepts effectively verbally and in writing. </li><li> Ability to travel occasionally, work long hours and meet with vendors and mid-level business leaders. <br><br></li></ul><strong>Additional Technical Skills<br></strong><ul><li> Understanding of NoSQL database technology preferred. </li><li> Experience with collaboration tools such as SharePoint and Lync a plus. </li><li> Experience with version control software and source code repositories such as Subversion or Github a plus. </li><li> Experience with more agile based or iterative software development methodologies a plus. <br><br></li></ul>The pay range for this position in Chicago IL, California, Florida, Illinois, Indiana, Maryland, Massachusetts, New Jersey, New York, Ohio, South Carolina, Virginia, Wisconsin, or Washington D.C. is 80k-$109k. This is the lowest to highest salary we in good faith believe we would pay for this role at the time of this posting. An employee’s pay within the salary range will be based on numerous factors including, but not limited to, relevant education, qualifications, experience, skills, geographical location and business or organizational needs.<br><br>We are an equal opportunity employer, committed to diversity in our workforce. Optimization <br></strong><ul><li> Proactively raise concerns, issues, and risks regarding assignments to management in a timely manner. </li><li> Share intellectual knowledge, learn, and understand existing application systems, and participate in cross-training with other team members. </li><li> Identify opportunities to simplify and/or optimize current technology investments and/or recommend new technologies for consideration. </li><li> Report project status regularly to project manager. <br><br></li></ul><strong>May Include Other Responsibilities As Assigned<br><br></strong><strong> REQUIREMENTS: <br></strong><ul><li> 3+ years’ experience with software development and/or analysis in applicable information systems tools and technology. title: Application Security Engineer III
description: <strong>Job Description</strong><p><br></p><strong>Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International?</strong><p><br></p><strong>Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It Matter.</strong><p><br></p>As part of the Mondelēz International Business Services division, you have responsibility for a specific discipline that may include partnering with leaders in sales, finance, marketing, customer service and logistics, procurement, HR, etc. You lead a team that delivers best-in-class service and value creation to their clients and that strives for operational excellence at all times.<p><br></p><strong>How You Will Contribute</strong><p><br></p><strong><em>About the role </em></strong><p><br></p><strong><em><br><ul><li>This position will be hybrid (1-2 Days in the office per week)**<br><br></li></ul>Mondelēz Consumer Solutions Global MDS ( IT) Team is looking for people with strong technology skills to play important roles as part of technology and business transformations across:<br><br>As an Integration Engineer at Mondelez, you will be responsible for designing, building and implementing services on top of Google Cloud Platform (GCP) and integrating them with the existing platforms &amp; SaaS capabilities leveraged across Consumer Engagement ecosystem. Such services will include Consumer Data related services including integration with Consumer Identity and Access Management (CIAM) systems, Privacy related Services &amp; Integrations, integrations with external SaaS capabilities. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to design and develop solutions that enable seamless data flow and application integration across various systems.<br><br><strong>What You Will Bring<br><br></strong>A desire to drive your future and accelerate your career. You will bring experience and knowledge in:<br><ul><li>Design and develop integrations between backend applications and GCP services using modern integration patterns and frameworks.</li><li>Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including application development, infrastructure, security, and operations teams, to ensure seamless integration and data flow across systems.</li><li>Design and implement integrations leveraging modern authentication and authorization protocols to be leveraged across multiple websites/applications.</li><li>Work closely with stakeholders to understand business requirements and translate them into technical requirements and design specifications.</li><li>Develop and maintain integration documentation, including technical design documents, deployment guides, and operational runbooks.</li><li>Conduct integration testing and resolve defects to ensure quality and reliability of the integrated systems.</li><li>Participate in agile ceremonies, including sprint planning, backlog grooming, and retrospectives.</li><li>Leading end-to-end process management for your specific discipline</li><li>Using shared services in a global environment</li><li>Leading teams, coaching, mentoring and experience managing performance driven by service level agreements and metrics</li><li>Customer service and managing relationships with demanding customers</li><li>Communicating effectively, organizational skills, problem solving and multi-tasking</li><li>Compliance and controls (experience in audits or part of programs where compliance is important)</li><li>Operating effectively in a changing environment and using initiative<br><br></li></ul><strong>More About This Role<br><br></strong><strong>What extra ingredients you will bring:<br></strong><ul><li>Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field.</li><li>4-8 years of experience in designing and developing integrations between applications and systems.</li><li>Experience with Google Cloud Platform (GCP) services, including Pub/Sub, Dataflow, Cloud Storage, and BigQuery.</li><li>Experience with integration frameworks and patterns, such as RESTful APIs, microservices, message queues, and event-driven architectures.</li><li>Experience with Consumer Identity and Access Management (CIAM) systems, authentication and authorization protocols</li><li>Strong programming skills in one or more of the following languages: .Net, Python, or Node.js.</li><li>Strong understanding of software development life cycle (SDLC) and agile methodologies.</li><li>Strong problem-solving skills and ability to debug complex integration issues.</li><li>Strong communication skills and ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.<br><br></li></ul>If you are passionate about designing and building innovative solutions that enable seamless data flow and application integration, we encourage you to apply for this opportunity at Mondelez.<br><br>No Relocation support available<br><br><strong>Business Unit Summary<br><br></strong>The United States is the largest market in the Mondelēz International family with a significant employee and manufacturing footprint. Here, we produce our well-loved household favorites to provide our consumers with the right snack, at the right moment, made the right way. We have corporate offices, sales, manufacturing and distribution locations throughout the U.S. to ensure our iconic brands—including <em>Oreo</em> and <em>Chips Ahoy!</em> cookies, <em>Ritz</em>, <em>Wheat Thins</em> and <em>Triscuit</em> crackers, and <em>Swedish Fish</em> and <em>Sour Patch</em> <em>Kids</em> confectionery products —are close at hand for our consumers across the country.<br><br>Mondelēz Global LLC is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law. Applicants who require accommodation to participate in the job application process may contact 847-943-5460 for assistance.<br><br><strong>Job Type<br><br></strong>Regular<br><br>Experience Management<br><br>Global Business Services</em></strong>
industry: Food and Beverage Services, Food and Beverage Manufacturing, and Manufacturing

title: GCP Integration Services Engineer
description: Role Title: Linux EngineerDuration: 6 months CTHLocation: Local to Chicago area- Hybrid position with 2x a week onsite (Tuesday’s and Thursday’s)Role Description: As a member of our team, your responsibilities will include designing, building, configuring, documenting, and administering server-based operating systems on both physical and virtual hardware. You will be responsible for advanced monitoring and troubleshooting of system-related issues, including performance tuning and root cause analysis. In addition, you will play a vital role in managing and maintaining one or more Microsoft Azure tenants, as well as participating in Disaster Recovery deployment, administration, and testing activities. As part of architecture design meetings, you will help to define processes and procedures, standards and be an escalation point for the Operations team.Requirements: Education Bachelor's degree in computer science or related field, or equivalent work experience. Work Experience - at least 5 years of experience in system administration. Experience with ticket-based tracking systems.Linux certifications a plus, Windows or VMware vSphere preferred but not requiredExperience administering a Microsoft Azure cloud tenant, preferred but not required5 years of experience installing, administering, and troubleshooting Linux operating systems and related products (i.e., SUMA/Spacewalk/Salt) in an enterprise environment5 years of experience administering and troubleshooting user account and root privilege management systems and related servicesAdvanced experience with a variety of Linux distributions (Suse, Redhat, Ubuntu, etc.), Linux shells and standard utilities, and common Linux security toolsAdvanced scripting knowledge (BASH, Python, Perl)Advanced operational knowledge of Network Attached Storage (NAS) and SAN block level storage including protocols such as NFS, iSCSI, SMB/CIFS and FCP.Advanced operational knowledge of virtual networking concepts and configurations such as virtual networking drivers and tools, VLAN tagging, and channel bonding/failover configurationsKnowledge of virtual machine backup configurations and deployment a plusHands-on knowledge and understanding of hardware configuration and troubleshooting.Ability to perform automated computing environment builds, site setup, user training, hardware/software installation, maintenance and support and documentation of operating procedures and processesAdvanced troubleshooting skillsKnowledge of certificate/PKI environments and management a plus

description_json: *Description:*<br><br>Key Responsibilities:<br><ul><li>Support and execute on sample preparation, fixture development and test execution.</li><li>Collaborate with global project teams to develop test plans, best practices, and report on test results.</li><li>Report to the project team status of test and commit to completing testing and reporting on time</li><li>Review and understand standard procedures then implement during validation testing to ensure repeatable, safe testing methodologies.</li><li>Work with outside vendors to develop customized fixtures</li><li>Continuous development in mechanical, electrical, and environmental testing</li><li>Identify and implement new test equipment</li><li>Perform root cause failure analysis</li><li>Skills:*<br><br></li></ul>Validation, Process validation, Electrical Testing, Electrical System, Validation Testing, Test Method Validation, Labview<br><ul><li>Top Skills Details:*<br><br></li></ul>Validation,Process validation,Electrical Testing,Electrical System,Validation Testing,Test Method Validation<br><ul><li>Additional Skills &amp; Qualifications:*<br><br></li></ul>5-days on-site!<br><ul><li>Experience Level:*<br><br></li></ul>Intermediate Level<br><br>About Actalent:<br><br>Actalent connects passion with purpose. Our scalable talent solutions and services capabilities drive value and results and provide the expertise to help our customers achieve more. Every day, our experts around the globe are making an impact. We’re supporting critical initiatives in engineering and sciences that advance how companies serve the world.
