title: Site Reliability Engineer
description: We are building a team of trailblazers, who embody growth, impact, and excellence.<br><br><strong><u>Job Description<br><br></u></strong>As a Reliability Data Analyst II, you will execute intermediate to advance level task work for engineering projects across multiple areas of reliability data gathering, organizing, analyzing, and strategizing.<br><br><strong><u>Job Duties<br></u></strong><ul><li>Solve complex reliability problems using professional judgment to ensure tasks include the appropriate level of assessment, analysis, and evaluation while following best practices and RAGAGEP</li><li>With minimal procedural guidance, analyze the overall risk levels for fixed and non-fixed assets to create reliability strategies</li><li>Organize and analyze pertinent data to evaluate the consequence and probability of failures in fixed and non-fixed assets across multiple sites and units</li><li>Gather and organize operations and maintenance data to make recommendations in reliability strategies</li><li>Facilitate customer validations meetings in process interviews, task selections, and other reliability focused areas of scope</li><li>Leverage internal and external software to deliver analysis and strategies for large industrial complex facilities</li><li>Extract and verify pertinent reliability information from multiple data sources using different technologies</li><li>Organize large industrial complex facilities into smaller and more manageable sections based on industry standards or customer guidance</li><li>Gather asset counts and documentation related to project scopes of work</li><li>Analyze effectiveness of historical non-destructive examination methods using various methodologies</li><li>Use verbal and written communication skills to work with our customers<br></li></ul><strong><u>Accountabilities<br></u></strong><ul><li>Meet and maintain excellent quality and efficiency for all deliverables</li><li>Execute strategies to deliver reliability services to our customers</li><li>Demonstrate effective time management skills to ensure timely completion of assigned tasks</li><li>Maintain professional relationships and effectively communicate with team members</li><li>Participate in endeavors that provide professional development and technical/soft skill training</li><li>Recognize inefficiencies and facilitate innovation that results in significant improvements<br></li></ul><strong><u>Required Qualifications<br></u></strong><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree in an engineering field or 3+ years working in the reliability data industry</li><li>Independent problem solver and high performing team player</li><li>Able to adapt to evolving client demands and dynamic work environment</li><li>Ability to understand technical literature (e.g. process descriptions, training manuals)</li><li>Ability to develop technical documents. (Technical Writing Skills)</li><li>Ability to understand Piping and Instrument Diagrams, Logic Diagrams, Cause and Effect Diagrams, and Electrical One-Line Diagrams</li><li>Effective and professional verbal and written communication skills</li><li>Detail-oriented with a strong aptitude for learning new processes and skills</li><li>Initiative to exceed beyond set expectations</li><li>Willingness to travel up to 50% of the time</li><li>Commitment to relocate domestically or internationally (multiple locations)</li><li>Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite<br></li></ul><strong><u>Preferred Qualifications</u></strong><ul><li>1+ years of professional working experience in the petroleum, chemical, mining process, or wastewater industries</li><li>Any of the following API Certifications:</li><ul><li>510</li><li>570</li><li>580</li><li>653<br></li></ul></ul><strong>Equipment and Software Knowledge <br></strong><ul><li>Microsoft Office Suite – intermediate to advanced level proficiently</li><li>Integrated Database Management Systems (PCMS, Meridium, etc.)<br></li></ul><strong>Direct Reports <br><br></strong>There will be no direct reports to this role.<br><br><strong>Working Environment <br></strong><ul><li>Conditions may include working inside and/or outside. May work around office machinery with moving parts and moving objects. Working near radiant and electrical energy. Working closely with others or working alone. Working extended or irregular hours and travelling by all possible modes of transportation.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Physical Job Requirements<br></u></strong><ul><li>Ability to sit for extended periods of time, repeated motions of the hands, wrists and fingers, identify colors, hear with aid, see, write, count, read, speak, communicate with other to exchange information, analyze, lift and carry under 30 lbs., and perceive depth.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Tools And PPE Requirements<br></u></strong><ul><li>Equipment (machines, tools, devices) used in performing the essential job function include but not limited to computers and related equipment, calculators, copiers, fax machines, and telephone. <br></li></ul><strong>Limitations and Disclaimer <br><br></strong>This job description describes the general job duties, accountabilities and physical requirements associates with the position; <strong>it is not an exhaustive list of all the duties, accountabilities, or skills required for the position. <br><br></strong>The general job duties, accountabilities and physical requirements associated with the position are subject to modification to reasonably accommodate individuals with disabilities. Some physical requirements may exclude individuals who pose a threat or risk to the health or safety to themselves or others.<br><br>This job description neither states nor implies that the listed general job duties, accountabilities, and physical requirements associated with the position are the only tasks expected of an employee. An employee is also required to follow any other job-related instructions and perform any other job-related tasks requested by their supervisor and not in violation of any applicable laws, regulations, or rules.<br><br><strong>Requirements are representative of minimum levels of knowledge, skills, and abilities</strong>. To perform this job successfully, an employee must possess the abilities and aptitude to perform each duty, accountability, and physical requirement proficiently.<br><br><strong>Visa Sponsorship: Employment eligibility to work with Pinnacle in the U.S. is required and the company will not pursue Visa sponsorship for this position.<br><br></strong>Pinnacle participates in E-Verify, a federal government system used to verify employment authorization and social security number of each new employee.<br><br><em>Pinnacle is an equal employment opportunity employer and does not discriminate based on race, color, national origin, religion, gender identity, sexual orientation, sex, age, disability, veteran or military status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.</em>

title: Test & Validation Engineer
description: Location <strong>IL, Mt. Prospect<br><br></strong>Department <strong>Engineering<br><br></strong>Employment Type <strong>Full Time<br><br></strong><strong>Software Engineer<br><br></strong><strong>Crane Payment Innovations<br><br></strong><strong>Mount Prospect, IL<br><br></strong>Crane Payment Innovations is the leader in world class automated payment solutions. We partner with businesses to provide payment experiences that set new and innovative standards for consumer convenience, security and reliability. We are excited to explore new ways every day to improve how millions of people across the globe can make their payments in a way that fits with their lives. Our global engineers develop products and deliver innovative solutions in currency validation technologies, cash management systems, digital payment technologies, mobile applications, security and digital advertising. We offer a range of devices for bill and coin validation, cash recycling and dispensing systems, IoT applications for our enterprise-level connected products and services, and software applications to integrate sensory hardware to machines and networks.<br><br>At CPI you will become a valuable part of an inclusive culture of collaboration and innovation with the support of over 2,000 associates working in one of our 15 offices across the world. If you want to have a hands-on global impact on payment solutions, we want you to join our team as a Software Engineer. This is a full-time position based at our Mt. Prospect Office in the Chicagoland area.<br><br><strong><u>Primary Function<br><br></u></strong>The <strong>Software Engineer</strong> will design and develop software to support our existing coin or note counters. This individual will assist with all phases of the software development cycle.<br><br><strong><u>Responsibilities And Duties<br><br></u></strong><strong>Technical skill sets:<br></strong><ul><li>Experienced in designing and testing new code in C/C++ for or Linux or Windows environment</li><li>Writing web-based applications using ASP, HTML5, JavaScript</li><li>Using installation tools to create and maintain Linux or Windows based installation packages</li><li>Provide support and development for automation test scripts</li><li>Utilizing version control system to manage product revisions: Git and ClearCase</li><li>Creating and maintaining issues using JIRA</li><li>Ability to troubleshoot and debug for root cause of system/subsystem failures</li><li>Experienced in adhering to an established engineering development process, – CPI EDP – (proof-of-concept, prototyping, design, integration/test, associated documentation)<br></li></ul><strong><u>Core Skillsets<br></u></strong><ul><li>Ability to work in a cross functional team environment</li><li>Good communications skillsets (verbal, written, presenting, etc.)</li><li>Computer skillsets (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Electrical Design ( IDEs ), etc</li><li>Self-Motivated – takes initiative to address issues, pursue new designs, identify cost reductions, researching of new parts</li><li>Innovative – Ability to design from a broad mandate statement, thinking out of the box, etc</li><li>Accountable – Assumes full responsibility of their designs or other designs which they have been assigned to maintain or debug<br></li></ul><strong><u>Value Added Skillsets<br></u></strong><ul><li>Familiarity with Kaizen methodology and Continuous Improvement Tools<br></li></ul><strong><u>Qualifications And Required Skills<br></u></strong><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree in Software Engineering or equivalent</li><li>Experience with creating architecture for Embedded Machines</li><li>4-7 years of experience in software development</li><li>Strong software/hardware debugging skillsets</li><li>Familiarity with test equipment such as oscilloscopes, digital analysers, IDEs, debug modules, DVM, data communication analysis tools, etc<br></li></ul><strong>Key Attributes for Success<br></strong><ul><li>High energy level, comfortable performing multifaceted projects in conjunction with day-to-day activities</li><li>Excellent influencing skills, analytical and problem-solving skills and the ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment</li><li>Ability to establish credibility and be decisive and able to recognize and support the organization's preferences and priorities</li><li>Results and people oriented with sound judgment—ability to balance other business considerations</li><li>Team player – able to work in a matrix organization</li><li>Excellent communication skills verbally and in writing</li><li>Up to 10% travel<br></li></ul><strong>We offer<br></strong><ul><li>Competitive salaries</li><li>Paid time off</li><li>Sick time off</li><li>Medical, dental, &amp; vision insurance</li><li>Flexible spending accounts</li><li>Life insurance and disability benefits</li><li>401K with Company contribution</li><li>Community involvement</li><li>Opportunities to travel and work at our global sites<br></li></ul><strong>Be a part of Crane Payment Innovations and Crane Co.<br><br></strong>CPI is a part of Crane Co., a diversified manufacturer of highly engineered industrial products. Founded in 1855, Crane Co provides products and solutions to customers in four business segments: Aerospace &amp; Electronics, Fluid Handling, Engineered Materials, and Payment &amp; Merchandising Systems. Crane has approximately 12,000 employees in North America, South America, Europe, Asia and Australia. Crane Co. is traded on the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE:CR).<br><br>Crane Co. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, disability, military status, or national origin or any other characteristic protected under federal, state, or applicable local law.

title: Software Engineer
description: <strong><u>Business Unit</u></strong><p><br></p>Financial and Valuation Advisory<p><br></p><strong><u>Industry</u></strong><p><br></p>PV - Portfolio Valuation<p><br></p><strong><u>Overview</u></strong><p><br></p>Over the past 40 years, Houlihan Lokey has established one of the largest worldwide financial and valuation advisory practices. Our transaction expertise and leadership in the field of valuation inspire confidence in the financial executives, boards of directors, special committees, retained counsel, investors, and business owners we serve. In 2019, Refinitiv (formerly known as Thomson Reuters) ranked us the No. 1 U.S. M&amp;A fairness opinion advisor over the past 20 years.<p><br></p>Our stability, integrity, technical leadership, and global capabilities make us a trusted advisor for clients worldwide, across a wide range of services, including Transaction Opinions, Transaction Advisory Services, Corporate Valuation Advisory Services, Portfolio Valuation &amp; Fund Advisory Services, Real Estate Valuation &amp; Advisory Services and Dispute Resolution Consulting.<p><br></p><strong>Scope</strong><p><br></p>We are growing our portfolio valuation team at the analyst level.<p><br></p>Financial Analysts within our Portfolio Valuation &amp; Advisory Services practice are fully integrated members of our engagement teams. You will work with a dedicated, highly talented staff of professionals who will give you broad exposure to many issues and concerns affecting businesses today.<p><br></p>We offer a unique opportunity to work on a wealth of projects that provide exposure to various financial and valuation advisory challenges, including the valuation of complex businesses, securities, and transaction structures. As a Financial Analyst, you will research and analyze financial markets data, financial statements, industry conditions and developments, acquisitions and divestitures, and various investment attributes of publicly traded and privately held securities. You will also have an opportunity to develop complex financial models, draft client deliverables, participate in presenting analyses and conclusions, interact with clients on active engagements, and participate in the firm’s marketing efforts.<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities (Portfolio Valuation Analyst)</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Supporting FVA portfolio valuation teams, which provide valuations of illiquid debt and equity securities held by hedge funds, private equity funds, and business development companies in connection with fair value reporting of the funds’ assets to investors;</li><li>Performing financial statement analysis and other quantitative and qualitative assessments;</li><li>Reviewing client investment memoranda, board of directors presentations, specific debt and equity agreements, and financial models to develop an understanding of the company or securities being analyzed;</li><li>Compiling statistical summaries of companies’ financial information, developing and computing financial ratios, and presenting the analyses in an organized manner and/or using our standard formats and presentations;</li><li>Reviewing and compiling published financial information, such as public company filings, press releases, reports from published research analysts, and Bloomberg data across a wide range of industries and sectors;</li><li>Identifying relevant comparable public companies and M&amp;A transactions within parameters established by FVA project teams, based upon information services such as S&P Capital IQ and Bloomberg, along with knowledge of the appropriate Standard Industrial Classification and other methods, as appropriate;</li><li>Constructing and reviewing valuation and other financial analyses, including the guideline public companies, guideline precedent transactions, and discounted cash flow analyses, using Houlihan Lokey proprietary models;</li><li>Researching and providing information on (a) general economic conditions, (b) industry-specific conditions and trends, (c) acquisitions and divestitures within specific industries, and (d) various investment attributes of publicly traded and privately held securities;</li><li>Participating in telephonic and in-person due diligence meetings/discussions, communicating with clients and responding to auditor questions regarding valuation analyses prepared by Houlihan Lokey;</li><li>Designing and drafting client deliverables;</li><li>Assisting in the preparation of fee proposals to clients, including scoping discussions, pitch materials, and internal engagement pricing committee memoranda;</li><li>Performing other ad-hoc research, analytics, and support for the FVA project teams as required;</li><li>Coordinating with internal administrative support teams to prepare engagement invoices, working paper files, and other compliance/end-of-engagement close out procedures;</li><li>Participating in discussions with in-house and outside legal counsel as required; and</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications (Portfolio Valuation Analyst)</u></strong><p><br></p>The environment at Houlihan Lokey is collegial and entrepreneurial and, as such, rewards staff with substantial responsibility and interaction with senior-level professionals and clients. The ideal candidate thinks strategically, is motivated, detail oriented, creative, outgoing, and possesses strong quantitative skills.<p><br></p>The Portfolio Valuation Financial Analyst will primarily support valuation professionals in the Portfolio Valuation &amp; Advisory Services practice firm-wide, may occasionally be required to work on certain valuation engagements in other FVA services, and will gain broad exposure to a wide range of industries and situations.<p><br></p>The ideal candidate may have some of the following qualifications:<p><br></p><ul><li>Minimum of one year of work experience at an accounting or valuation firm in a valuation capacity</li><li>Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, Business, or Applied Economics</li><li>Strong analytical abilities</li><li>Excellent understanding of financial statements analysis with the ability to work through key assumptions, implicit caveats, and limitations</li><li>A fundamental understanding of financial valuation theory, methodologies, and applications</li><li>Strong knowledge of Excel modeling, including integrated cash flow modeling</li><li>Excellent verbal and written communication skills</li><li>Demonstrated ability to work cooperatively with team members</li><li>Ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment</li><li>An exceptional work ethic</li><li>Big Four, Independent Valuation Consultants, and/or transaction advisory services experience is a plus</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Salary Range</strong><p><br></p><strong><u>Role</u></strong><p><br></p>The firm’s good faith and reasonable estimate of the possible salary range for this role at the time of posting is<p><br></p>Houlihan Lokey is committed to providing its employees with an exciting career opportunity and competitive total compensation package, which may include other components such as discretionary incentive compensation.<p><br></p>$70,000.00-$120,000.00<p><br></p>Actual salary at the time of hire may vary and may be above or below the range based on various factors, including, but not limited to, the candidate’s relevant qualifications, skills, and experience, as well as the service line and location where this position may be filled.<p><br></p><em><strong>We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.</strong></em>

Associate should have hands-on experience in <span>AWS,</span> SRE, <span>Core Java, SpringBoot, Oracle Skillset</span>. </li><li>Should have experience to work in an <span>Agile</span> team. </li><li>The candidates <strong>should have the energy aptitude for numbers and inclination</strong> to learn and work in this tech/domain rich team.</li><li>The candidate should have also have prior knowledge and hands on experience with Core Java, SpringBoot, Microservices, Oracle and also have knowledge on Database and its related concepts. </li><li>Good to have skills would be Microservices and Kafka experience.&nbsp;&nbsp;</li></ul><p><br></p><p><strong><u>For SRE/Prod Support</u></strong> – </p><ul><li>Mandatory Requirement: Candidate MUST have experience in <span>DevOps Observability Performance, Metrics and Monitoring Tools like AppDynamics, Prometheus, Grafana and Splunk</span>. </li><li>Candidate should have had experience in Performing Root Cause Analysis for Production incidents</li></ul><p><br></p><p>Thanks and Regards</p><p>Sarath kumar NB</p><p>VBeyond Corporation || PARTNERING FOR GROWTH</p><p>Hillsborough, New Jersey, USA</p><p>Email ID:&nbsp;SarathK@vbeyond.com</p><p>Contact : (908) 540-0300 Ext: 7018</p><p>Website:&nbsp;www.vbeyond.com</p><p>LinkedIn: linkedin.com/in/sarath-kumar-nb-49725b1aa</p>

title: Power Automate Developer
description: <strong><u>Job Description<br><br></u></strong>LaSalle Network has partnered with a manufacturing organization to hire a motivated and skilled <strong>Interim Accounting Analyst</strong> to join their dynamic team! As an <strong>Interim Accounting Analyst</strong>, you will be responsible for performing a variety of accounting duties, such as reconciling accounts, preparing financial statements and assisting with month-end close processes. You will work alongside a team of experienced professionals, who will guide you and provide opportunities for professional growth.<br><br><strong><u>Interim Accounting Analyst Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li> Reconcile accounts and ensure accuracy of financial data </li><li> Prepare financial statements and reports </li><li> Assist with month-end close processes, including journal entries and account reconciliations </li><li> Analyze financial data and prepare ad-hoc reports as required </li><li> Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify process improvements and streamline workflows </li><li> Assist in the preparation of audit schedules and responses to auditor inquiries </li><li> Perform other duties as assigned by the Accounting Manager or Director of Finance <br></li></ul><strong><u>Interim Accounting Analyst Requirements<br></u></strong><ul><li> Bachelor's degree in accounting, finance or related field </li><li> Strong analytical skills and attention to detail </li><li> Proficient in Microsoft Excel and experience with accounting software </li><li> Excellent communication and interpersonal skills </li><li> Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple tasks simultaneously </li><li> Self-motivated and able to work independently or as part of a team </li><li> Positive attitude and eagerness to learn <br></li></ul>If you are an entry-level candidate looking for an exciting opportunity to kick-start your accounting career, then this <strong>Interim Accounting Analyst</strong> role is for you! We are looking for someone who is passionate about accounting, eager to learn and driven to succeed. Apply today and take the first step towards an exciting career in accounting!<br><br>Thank you,<br><br>Cara Jarosz<br><br>Accounting and Finance Team Lead<br><br>LaSalle Network<br><br><strong> Keywords and Related Terms: </strong> 3e , adarent , elite , legal billing , AP , accounts payable<br><br>LaSalle Network is an Equal Opportunity Employer m/f/d/v.<br><br>LaSalle Network is the leading provider of direct hire and temporary staffing services. For over two decades, LaSalle has helped organizations hire faster and connect top talent with opportunities, from entry-level positions to the C-suite. With units specializing in Accounting and Finance, Administrative, Marketing, Technology, Supply chain, Healthcare Revenue Cycle, Call Center, Human Resources and Executive Search. LaSalle offers staffing and recruiting solutions to companies of all sizes and across all industries. LaSalle Network is the premier staffing and recruiting firm, earning over 100 culture, revenue and industry-based awards from major publications and having its company experts regularly contribute insights on retention strategies, hiring trends and hiring challenges, and more to national news outlets.<br><br>

title: Financial Analyst - Financial and Valuation Advisory (Portfolio Valuation)
description: Spaulding Ridge is an advisory and IT implementation firm. We help global organizations get financial clarity into the complex, daily sales, and operational decisions that impact profitable revenue generations, efficient operational performance, and reliable financial management.<br><br>At Spaulding Ridge, we believe all business is personal. Core to our values is our relationships with our clients, our business partners, our team, and the global community. Our employees dedicate their time to helping our clients transform their business, from strategy through implementation and business transformation.<br><br><strong>What You Will Do And Learn<br><br></strong>We are looking for a <strong>Salesforce Architect</strong> with <strong>CPQ </strong>knowledge to join our <strong>Salesforce Delivery</strong> team. This is an exciting and challenging position where you'll be driving customer engagements by determining process gaps and pain points, then rapidly designing and implementing best-in-class solutions utilizing Salesforce and Salesforce CPQ. Ultimately, as an Architect you will serve as the primary design owner and trusted SME for all CPQ related deliverables.<br><br><strong>Ideal candidates will be able to:<br></strong><ul><li>Build a world-class solution design strategy and action plan for each client engagement. </li><li>Lead a variety of workshops including business process reviews, discovery sessions, requirements gathering sessions, and design sessions. </li><li>Perform analysis of complex business information including business and technical requirements, process models, user stories, and process gaps. </li><li>Lead a team of Consultants and Analysts to build your designed CPQ solution. </li><li>Work alongside a PM to manage project budget and profitability, delivery schedules and overall quality of the solution. </li><li>Advise clients on industry, Salesforce, and CPQ best practices to drive process transformation. </li><li>Support pre-sales and internal continuous process improvement initiatives. </li><li>Assist the practice lead in the evolution and refinement of delivery methodologies and best practices<br><br></li></ul><strong>Qualifications:<br></strong><ul><li>Salesforce Admin, Advanced Admin, Salesforce CPQ, and Sales Cloud certified. </li><li>5+ years of experience in a Project Lead, Solution Architect, or Lead Business Analyst role. </li><li>5+ years of experience as an Administrator or Developer in Salesforce Sales, Service, or Marketing Clouds. </li><li>3+ years in Salesforce Quote to Cash/Salesforce CPQ, preferably in an Administrator, Consultant, or Sales Ops user role. </li><li>3+ years of experience in user acceptance test planning and execution</li><li>Proven ability to manage projects, lead discovery and build cycles, and work in a collaborative team environment. </li><li>Strong oral, written and presentation skills. </li><li>Demonstrated problem solving and troubleshooting skills in a rapidly changing environment. </li><li>Demonstrated industry or domain expertise. </li><li>Undergraduate degree in Business, Computer Science or equivalent experience. <br><br></li></ul><strong>We take care of you!<br><br></strong>As an employee of Spaulding Ridge, you will part of a company that is providing innovative opportunities to impact our clients in a meaningful way. We believe giving back is core to our values and as part of this effort, you will be given the opportunity to participate in different opportunities throughout the year including SR's day of service, giving back to our global community. Here are some our great perks and top benefits to highlight:<br><ul><li>Competitive benefits package, including medical, dental, vision, 401(K) and Life insurance</li><li>Flexible Time Off</li><li>Paid holiday time</li><li>Paid maternity and paternity leave</li><li>Monthly technology and wellness allowance</li><li>Annual training allowance program<br><br></li></ul><strong>Spaulding Ridge's Diversity Commitment<br><br></strong>When we engage the expertise, insights and creativity of people from all walks of life, we become a better organization, we deliver superior services to clients, and we transform our communities and world for the better.<br><br>At Spaulding Ridge, we believe our team should reflect the rich diversity of society and we take seriously the responsibility to cultivate a workplace where every bandmate feels accepted, respected and valued for who they are. We do this by creating a culture of trust and belonging, through practices and policies that support DEI, and through our employee-led committees: CRE (Cultural Race and Ethnicity), Women Elevate, Women Ambassadors, Sexual Orientation and Gender Identity(SOGI) Alliance, and Community Outreach.<br><br>The company is committed to offering Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with Spaulding Ridge and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to our VP of Human Resources, Cara Halladay (challaday@spauldingridge.com) Requests for reasonable accommodation will be considered on a case-by-case basis.<br><br>Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their age, race, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status or disability.
description_json: Spaulding Ridge is an advisory and IT implementation firm. We help global organizations get financial clarity into the complex, daily sales, and operational decisions that impact profitable revenue generations, efficient operational performance, and reliable financial management.<br><br>At Spaulding Ridge, we believe all business is personal. Core to our values is our relationships with our clients, our business partners, our team, and the global community. Our employees dedicate their time to helping our clients transform their business, from strategy through implementation and business transformation.<br><br><strong>What You Will Do And Learn<br><br></strong>We are looking for a <strong>Salesforce Architect</strong> with <strong>CPQ </strong>knowledge to join our <strong>Salesforce Delivery</strong> team. This is an exciting and challenging position where you'll be driving customer engagements by determining process gaps and pain points, then rapidly designing and implementing best-in-class solutions utilizing Salesforce and Salesforce CPQ. Ultimately, as an Architect you will serve as the primary design owner and trusted SME for all CPQ related deliverables.<br><br><strong>Ideal candidates will be able to:<br></strong><ul><li>Build a world-class solution design strategy and action plan for each client engagement. </li><li>Lead a variety of workshops including business process reviews, discovery sessions, requirements gathering sessions, and design sessions. </li><li>Perform analysis of complex business information including business and technical requirements, process models, user stories, and process gaps. </li><li>Lead a team of Consultants and Analysts to build your designed CPQ solution. </li><li>Work alongside a PM to manage project budget and profitability, delivery schedules and overall quality of the solution. </li><li>Advise clients on industry, Salesforce, and CPQ best practices to drive process transformation. </li><li>Support pre-sales and internal continuous process improvement initiatives. </li><li>Assist the practice lead in the evolution and refinement of delivery methodologies and best practices<br><br></li></ul><strong>Qualifications:<br></strong><ul><li>Salesforce Admin, Advanced Admin, Salesforce CPQ, and Sales Cloud certified. </li><li>5+ years of experience in a Project Lead, Solution Architect, or Lead Business Analyst role. </li><li>5+ years of experience as an Administrator or Developer in Salesforce Sales, Service, or Marketing Clouds. </li><li>3+ years in Salesforce Quote to Cash/Salesforce CPQ, preferably in an Administrator, Consultant, or Sales Ops user role. </li><li>3+ years of experience in user acceptance test planning and execution</li><li>Proven ability to manage projects, lead discovery and build cycles, and work in a collaborative team environment. </li><li>Strong oral, written and presentation skills. </li><li>Demonstrated problem solving and troubleshooting skills in a rapidly changing environment. </li><li>Demonstrated industry or domain expertise. </li><li>Undergraduate degree in Business, Computer Science or equivalent experience. <br><br></li></ul><strong>We take care of you!<br><br></strong>As an employee of Spaulding Ridge, you will part of a company that is providing innovative opportunities to impact our clients in a meaningful way. We believe giving back is core to our values and as part of this effort, you will be given the opportunity to participate in different opportunities throughout the year including SR's day of service, giving back to our global community. Here are some our great perks and top benefits to highlight:<br><ul><li>Competitive benefits package, including medical, dental, vision, 401(K) and Life insurance</li><li>Flexible Time Off</li><li>Paid holiday time</li><li>Paid maternity and paternity leave</li><li>Monthly technology and wellness allowance</li><li>Annual training allowance program<br><br></li></ul><strong>Spaulding Ridge's Diversity Commitment<br><br></strong>When we engage the expertise, insights and creativity of people from all walks of life, we become a better organization, we deliver superior services to clients, and we transform our communities and world for the better.<br><br>At Spaulding Ridge, we believe our team should reflect the rich diversity of society and we take seriously the responsibility to cultivate a workplace where every bandmate feels accepted, respected and valued for who they are. We do this by creating a culture of trust and belonging, through practices and policies that support DEI, and through our employee-led committees: CRE (Cultural Race and Ethnicity), Women Elevate, Women Ambassadors, Sexual Orientation and Gender Identity(SOGI) Alliance, and Community Outreach.<br><br>The company is committed to offering Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with Spaulding Ridge and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to our VP of Human Resources, Cara Halladay (challaday@spauldingridge.com) Requests for reasonable accommodation will be considered on a case-by-case basis.<br><br>Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their age, race, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status or disability.

title: Site Reliability Engineer
description: Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, gt.school. Have you got what it takes?<p><br></p>Do you take pleasure in looking at and interpreting data? Are you passionate about education and want a role in a startup that wants to revolutionize how technology is used to learn? If yes, keep on reading…<p><br></p>We’re looking for individuals who:<p><br></p><ul><li>Are strategic problem solvers who can quickly devise and implement solutions to address ad-hoc issues facing our students</li><li>Are excellent communicators; able to concisely and effectively describe processes in written playbooks, design engaging student communication, and keep other team members consistently updated with progress on projects. </li><li>Consider themselves to be consistent, high performers who rarely have ‘off-days’.</li><li>Understand the importance of revolutionizing the education space with cutting-edge technology.</li></ul><p><br></p>In this role, you’ll work directly with our EdTech company, gt.school. You’ll develop an expert understanding of the data we collect on students and become familiar with all the apps and systems we use to collect and store this information. You will build new edtech tools and operational processes, and restructure existing processes to be more efficient.<p><br></p>Not only will you gain valuable experience, but you’ll also receive regular coaching and training from a team of global tech experts and operations professionals. You’ll get constructive feedback on all of your work to help you develop and get a chance to meet daily with other team members to work collaboratively on projects.<p><br></p>Interested in a role that involves research, strategy, product development, and data science in the cutting-edge field of education and technology? Apply below.<p><br></p><strong><u>What You Will Be Doing</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Participating in daily stand-up calls to solve the most critical issues facing students in our program, other staff members such as Motivational Coaches, Academic Coaches, Program Directors, or the leadership team.</li><li>Converting important decisions made by leadership into work units that a junior Operations team can perform.</li><li>Creating robust processes that stand the test of time and capture all of the edge-cases to ensure maximum probability of success the first time around. </li><li>Troubleshooting issues facing our students due to data issues, human error, or automation error; quickly strategizing a bulletproof solution that solves the issue and prevents further recurrence in the future.</li><li>Working as a team to ensure progress is being made on key tasks by communicating with other operations analysts and managers to ensure no lapse in service for internal or external stakeholders.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>What You Won’t Be Doing</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Collecting data or performing administrative tasks - we have a junior operations analyst team to do this type of work.</li><li>Providing loose or generalized solutions that don’t actually get implemented.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Senior Data Scientist Key Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p>Same as “What you will be doing”, above.<p><br></p><strong><u>Basic Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Excellent written and verbal English communication skills</li><li>Proficient in Python or R (we will test this)</li><li>2+ years of work experience working in a technical field (science, technology, financial services, data science)</li><li>Bachelor’s degree from a top 20 US university or a top 100 global university.</li><li>Consistently able to work 8 hours per day, Monday through Friday, between 6AM and 6PM CST</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Nice-to-have Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Advanced in Python and Apps Script</li><li>Familiarity with Canvas (LMS)</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>About Gt.school</u></strong><p><br></p>gt.school is a stealth EdTech startup in Austin, Texas, the center of educational innovation in the US. Our unique approach leverages 50+ years of learning science, cutting-edge data analytics and high-performance life skills coaching. In doing so, we can help students learn 5x faster and unlock their full potential in both academics and in life. We are a remote-first company that hires globally via Crossover.<p><br></p>There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!<p><br></p><strong>Working with Crossover</strong><p><br></p>This is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $30 USD/hour, which equates to $60,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.<p><br></p><strong>What to expect next:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.</li><li>Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Important!</strong> If you do not receive an email from us:<p><br></p><ul><li>First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.</li><li>Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.</li><li>Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.</li><li>If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/password-recovery if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.</li></ul> Crossover Job Code: LJ-4880-US-Chicago-SeniorDataScie.001<p><br></p>
industry: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Technology, Information and Internet

title: Interim Accounting Analyst
description: *Position is Bonus eligible*<p><br></p>Prestigious Financial Company is currently seeking a AWS DevOps Engineer with Kafka experience. Candidate will provide subject matter expertise for ongoing support of third-party tools like Kafka, Artifactory, Terraform, and Apigee.<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Support the lower environments for incident and problem management</li><li>Resolve complex support issues in non-production environments.</li><li>Have an understanding of Cloud Native applications running on Kubernetes within AWS.</li><li>Assist production support and development staff in debugging environment defects.</li><li>Create procedural and troubleshooting documentation related to cloud native applications</li><li>Write complex automation scripts using common automation tools, such as Jenkins, Ansible, and Terraform</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Systems administration and change management practices</li><li>Message-oriented technologies such as Kafka</li><li>Internet/Web based technologies</li><li>ITLT Best Practices</li><li>Scripting and coding</li><li>Network technologies</li><li>CI/CD tools such as Artifactory, Jenkins, and GIT</li><li>Cloud native applications, including Terraform experience</li><li>Technologies used to support microservices</li><li>Encryption technologies (SSL/TLS, PKI Infrastructure management)</li><li>Security controls as applied to software technologies</li></ul>

description: <strong><u>Job Description<br><br></u></strong>Financial Analyst at a mid-sized real estate company<br><br><strong><u>About The Company<br><br></u></strong>Our company is a dynamic and growing real estate investment firm with a strong track record of success. We specialize in creating value for our investors through strategic acquisitions and rigorous analysis.<br><br><strong><u>Why You Should Work Here<br><br></u></strong>Joining our team means being part of a collaborative and innovative organization that values employee development and growth. Our company culture is rooted in integrity, teamwork, and a commitment to excellence.<br><br><strong><u>Top Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li> Monitoring and analyzing financial data to support the fund accounting function</li><li> Conducting financial modeling and analysis to inform strategic decision-making</li><li> Working with other departments to forecast financial performance and identify areas for improvement</li><li> Preparing reports for senior management and investors</li><li> Participating in special projects as assigned<br></li></ul><strong><u>Requirements<br></u></strong><ul><li> Bachelor’s degree in finance, accounting, or related field</li><li> 2-3 years of experience in financial analysis, preferably in the real estate industry</li><li> Strong analytical skills and the ability to work with large data sets</li><li> Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and other financial modeling tools</li><li> Excellent oral and written communication skills, strong organizational skills, and ability to work independently or as part of a team.<br></li></ul>If you are looking for an exciting opportunity to grow your career in the real estate industry, we encourage you to apply for our Financial Analyst position.<br><br>#CBMAY2023<br><br>Id: EB-4538812749

title: AWS Kafka DevOps Engineer
description: Komatsu is an indispensable partner to the construction, mining, forestry, forklift, and industrial machinery markets, maximizing value for customers through innovative solutions. With a diverse line of products supported by our advanced IoT technologies, regional distribution channels, and a global service network, we tap into the power of data and technology to enhance safety and productivity while optimizing performance. Komatsu supports a myriad of markets, including housing, infrastructure, water, pipeline, minerals, automobile, aerospace, electronics and medical, through its many brands and subsidiaries, including TimberPro, Joy, P&amp;H, Montabert, Modular Mining Systems, Hensley Industries, NTC, and Gigaphoton.<br><strong><u>Job Overview<br></u></strong>The <strong>Financial Analyst</strong> is a key role within the Komatsu Organization and will have knowledge of Komatsu Mining Corporation (KMC) Financial Information that is not made known publicly or to all Company employees and will be able to tell the “story” within the financial numbers. This Role interacts with the Director of Finance, KMC Corporate Accounting - FP&amp;A and Financial Excellence, Operations Accounting, Regional Finance Directors, Managers and Controllers, Milwaukee leadership and Internal/External Auditors to name a few.<br><strong><u>Key Job Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li> Support financial planning cycle by preparing templates that will be used to gather relevant data from business divisions; load corporate departmental data into SAP/BPC; analyze reconciliation of US GAAP to Standard Variable Margin (“SVM”) reporting. </li><li> Consolidate financial forecasts on a quarterly and annual basis. Compare forecasts with business trends and macro-economic data to determine the reasonableness of the current forecast. </li><li> Consolidate and report monthly the rolling CAPEX plan supporting approvals, purchase order, actual and planned spending for the current fiscal year and three-year plan. </li><li> Obtain variance explanations for capacity costs by business division. </li><li> Decision support including analysis of historical financials, obtain variance explanations, update risks and opportunities to current plan and maintain Key Performance Indicators (“KPI’s”) historical and planned trends. </li><li> Maintain trends for bookings and sales data by region, product, and commodity. </li><li> Prepare monthly flash of financial results to executive leadership. </li><li> Prepare monthly, quarterly, and annual bridge analysis. </li><li> Prepare monthly reporting metrics of KPI’s. </li><li> Preparation of monthly presentations to Executive Leadership and quarterly presentations to Komatsu Ltd. Management Committee. </li><li> Review calculation of foreign exchange impact on sales, operating profit, and bookings and backlog compared to prior year and budget. </li><li> Prepare ad hoc financial reports and analysis required by Komatsu Ltd., CFO, EVP Finance, Corporate Controller, Treasury, Tax, Human Resources, and segments. <br></li></ul><strong><u>Qualifications/Requirements<br></u></strong><ul><li>Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting or Finance (Discipline Preferred)</li><li>2+ years of experience in Financial Planning &amp; Analysis or Accounting, preferably for a manufacturing or global company. Ability to prepare financial statements and explain results.</li><li>SAP/BPC experience a plus</li><li>High level of proficiency with MS Excel. Proficiency in MS PowerPoint and Word. Especially strong with data analysis. </li><li>Working with and interpreting large amounts of data, developing trend lines, and assisting in formulating action plans.</li><li>Strong analytical, critical thinking, Problem Solving, written / verbal communication and interpersonal skills.</li><li>Attention to detail and accuracy is needed.</li><li>Work both independently and in collaboration with team members.</li><li>Ability to prioritize and manage multiple time-sensitive tasks. Committed to meeting established deliverables accurately and on-time.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Additional Information<br></u></strong>Komatsu is an Equal Opportunity Workplace and an Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.

title: Financial Analyst
description: You will play a key role in supporting our domestic and international growth by developing and supporting our D365 Finance solution and its integrations for the Accounting and Finance department. In this role you will be exposed to the technical and business sides of our company as you support both our customers and our Accounting and Finance team by customizing and maintaining our D365 solution. This will include extending the solution using the Power Platform, X++, and C#/.NET development, as well as assisting in DevOps pipeline management and supporting upgrades.<p><br></p><strong>More than just important work</strong>.<p><br></p>Epic is located in Madison, Wisconsin, a city regularly ranked as one of America's best places to live. Epic's environment is one of continuous learning; you'll have access to opportunities to expand your skill set and share your knowledge with others. We offer comprehensive benefits to keep you healthy and happy as you grow in your life and career, and your merit-based compensation will reflect the impact your work has on the company and our customers. You'll also be eligible for annual raises and bonuses, as well as stock grants, which give you an even greater stake in the success of Epic and our customers. Epic is an Equal Opportunity employer. We seek diverse perspectives, backgrounds, and experiences in our mission to improve healthcare. Research has shown that job-seekers who are women, LGBTQ+, or members of the global majority are less likely to apply for roles they don't seem completely qualified for, so we encourage all who are interested to apply. Please see our full non-discrimination statement at https //careers.epic.com/EEO.<p><br></p><ul><li>Experienced with X++ development</li><li>Experience with Power Platform (Power Apps, Power Automate, and Power BI)</li><li>Experience with object-oriented development (.NET, C#, MVC, HTML, CSS, JavaScript)</li><li>Experience with Microsoft SQL databases, including development and reporting (SSRS)</li><li>Strong project management and organizational skills</li><li>Eligible to work in the US without sponsorship</li><li>Relocation to the Madison, WI area (reimbursed)</li><li>COVID-19 vaccination</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Desired Skills</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Professional accounting or finance experience</li><li>Advanced Excel skills including Power Pivot</li></ul>

title: Hadoop Admin with Cloudera CDP exp.
description: <strong>ABOUT US</strong>:<br><br>Braintrust is a user-owned talent network that connects you with great jobs with no fees or membership costs—so you keep 100% of what you earn.<br><br><strong>ABOUT THE HIRING PROCESS:<br><br></strong>When you join Braintrust, you will be invited to a screening process for Braintrust to learn more about your previous work experiences. Once completed, you will have access to the employer for this role and other top companies that seek high-quality talent. Apply to this job to kick off the process.<br><ul><li>JOB TYPE: Freelance, Contract Position (no agencies/C2C - see notes below)</li><li>LOCATION: Remote-United States only (TimeZone: EST | Partial overlap)</li><li>HOURLY RANGE: Our client is looking to pay $100 – $112/hr</li><li>ESTIMATED DURATION: 40h/week - Long term<br><br></li></ul><strong>THE OPPORTUNITY<br><br></strong><strong>Requirements<br><br></strong><strong>Qualities that will help you thrive in this role are:<br></strong><ul><li>You have familiarity with some of the following: Google Cloud Platform (GCP) services, such as Cloud Storage, BigQuery, Cloud Dataflow, Cloud Pub/Sub, and Data Loss Prevention (DLP), creating dashboards in tools such as Looker or Tableau for monitoring and insights, building and monitoring cloud services, infrastructure as code technologies such as Terraform, AWS Cloud Formation, Ansible, etc, Big Data experience with tools such as Spark.</li><li>You understand that being an effective software engineer is about communicating with people as much as it is about writing code</li><li>You are generous with your time and experience, and can mentor and learn from other engineers</li><li>You can tackle unconstrained problems and know when to seek help</li><li>You are flexible with languages and tools and willing to learn whatever is necessary to complete the job.</li></ul> <strong><strong>What you’ll be working on<br><br></strong></strong><strong>What’s the role?<br><br></strong>Our client's Data Enablement organization's mission is to enable the use of data at scale and to unlock learning through experimentation. As part of the Data Governance &amp; Privacy team, you will join a highly visible team with a top priority of protecting sensitive information of our client's buyers and sellers. The team is responsible for building services and processes to protect Personally Identifiable Information (PII) in their data warehouses. You'll be part of our client's journey to modernize how they protect personal data<br><br>They work with Google Cloud Platform (GCP) services, such as Cloud Storage, BigQuery, Cloud Dataflow, Cloud Pub/Sub, and Data Loss Prevention (DLP). Languages include Java, Python, PHP and SQL, and they work with technologies like Terraform, Spark, Airflow, and BigQuery. Experience with any of these is helpful but not required; above all, they value curiosity, responsibility, and eagerness to solve complex engineering problems. They're looking for a flexible engineer, who can work with the internal customers, and embraces pivoting to the appropriate tool for the job rather than having deep expertise in single systems<br><br>The technical staff believes that code is craft, and that the work they do is part of a larger creative culture that includes the hundreds of thousands of inspired artists and designers who make the Company such a unique marketplace. They believe that small, empowered, self-motivated teams can do big things. They believe in measuring everything, taking advantage of their continuous deployment system to ship code early and often, and keeping up a blameless culture based on trust and a commitment to learning.<br><br>This is a position reporting to the Engineering Manager, Data Governance &amp; Privacy. For this role, they are considering candidates who are either remote, flex, or office-based. The team is geographically dispersed, but works in North America Time Zones<br><br><strong>What does the day-to-day look like?<br></strong><ul><li>You will build and maintain internal tools for tracking and inventorying GCS file sets using Google Storage Insight</li><li>You will work with your team to develop methods to programmatically apply column tags and Policy Tags on BigQuery data sets to identify and protect Personally Identifiable Information</li><li>You will help measure the team’s progress in our work by creating dashboards and monitoring in tools such as Looker or Tableau<br><br></li></ul><strong>Apply Now!<br><br></strong>Braintrust Job ID: 6589<br><br>C2C Candidates: This role is not available to C2C candidates working with an agency. If you are a professional contractor who has created an LLC/corp around their consulting practice, this is well aligned with Braintrust and we’d welcome your application.<br><br>Braintrust values the multitude of talents and perspectives that a diverse workforce brings. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status.

title: Financial Analyst
description: <strong>ABOUT US</strong>:<br><br>Braintrust is a user-owned talent network that connects you with great jobs with no fees or membership costs—so you keep 100% of what you earn.<br><br><strong>ABOUT THE HIRING PROCESS:<br><br></strong>When you join Braintrust, you will be invited to a screening process for Braintrust to learn more about your previous work experiences. Once completed, you will have access to the employer for this role and other top companies that seek high-quality talent. Apply to this job to kick off the process.<br><ul><li>JOB TYPE: Direct Hire Position (no agencies/C2C - see notes below)</li><li>LOCATION: Remote - United States</li><li>SALARY: $125,000 – $160,000/yr</li><li>ESTIMATED DURATION: 40hr/week - Long term<br><br></li></ul><strong>THE OPPORTUNITY<br><br></strong><strong>Requirements<br><br></strong><strong>Required Qualifications <br></strong><ul><li>5+ years technical software experience </li><li>Proficiency with fundamental front-end languages such as HTML, CSS, and JavaScript</li><li>Proficiency with server-side languages such as PHP</li><li>Proficiency with database technology such as SQL Server and MySQL</li><li>Database design and management, including being up on the latest practices and associated versions</li><li>Strong understanding of software architecture, data structures, and computer science fundamentals </li><li>Strong security background (comfortable working with PII/sensitive data)</li><li>Experience with agile and fast-paced software development methodologies </li><li>Strong organizational, project management, and communication skills</li><li>Good problem-solving skills</li><li>Attention to detail<br><br></li></ul><strong>Preferred Qualifications<br></strong><ul><li>Prior experience working and communicating directly with clients</li><li>Laravel and Node.js experience helpful</li><li>Familiarity with CSS preprocessors, bundlers, and associated languages/syntaxes/libraries (e.g., Sass, Less, and webpack)</li><li>An eye for design and user experience</li><li>Technical literacy and hands-on experience across the software stack, infrastructure, and dev-ops</li><li>Knowledge of Enterprise HR systems (WorkDay, SuccessFactors, Oracle, SAP)</li><li>Proficiency with Git</li><li>Appreciation for clean and well documented code</li></ul> <strong><strong>What you’ll be working on<br><br></strong></strong>Full Stack Software Engineer, you will be working on the design, architecture, development, and innovation of customized HR software for some of the world’s most sophisticated companies. You will use PHP, SQL, JavaScript, and CSS to deploy software quickly to meet their needs. Our work is fast-paced, creative, and flexible–your days will be too! You will spend time problem solving with clients live, helping them see the range of what’s possible, building what they need, and working directly with HR experts. You will work alongside client team-members and thrive on the responsibility to own large projects from conceptualization to sunset.<br><br><strong>Responsibilities<br></strong><ul><li>Build the software development process from conception to deployment </li><li>Maintaining and upgrading the software following deployment </li><li>Managing the end-to-end life cycle for the production of software and applications </li><li>Modifying and testing changes to previously developed applications </li><li>Deliver high quality code in a fast and efficient manner </li><li>Must be fluent in all things PHP, MySQL, and Javascript </li><li>Develop front-end and back-end software using PHP/MySQL and HTML/Javascript/CSS with Vue.js or React.js </li><li>Identify and mitigate end-to-end security concerns </li><li>Ensuring the entire stack is designed and built for speed and scalability </li><li>Mentoring other engineers </li><li>Work across the organization to foster a culture of architecture that allows for iterative, autonomous development and future scaling. <br><br></li></ul><strong>Apply Now!<br><br></strong>Braintrust Job ID: 6496<br><br>C2C Candidates: This role is not available to C2C candidates working with an agency. If you are a professional contractor who has created an LLC/corp around their consulting practice, this is well aligned with Braintrust and we’d welcome your application.<br><br>Braintrust values the multitude of talents and perspectives that a diverse workforce brings. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status.

title: Microsoft Dynamics (D365) Finance Developer
description: Prestigious Financial Institution is currently seeking a ServiceNow Solutions Engineer. Candidate will provide services to an existing Platform team to architect, design, develop and deploy solutions utilizing the ServiceNow platform. Their deliverables will be focused on development and delivery of value-added integration, out-of-box configuration and consultative services for low code software development. They will collaborate with a team of Engineers to design, deploy and integrate various product capabilities.<p><br></p>Successful execution of delivery on Enterprise Technology Solution epics in-scope for enabling IT Service Management and Security Operations within the ServiceNow platform. This person will provide testing and support for ServiceNow upgrade that we have scheduled in early November, where all functionality has been tested/validated for User Acceptance and any bugs have been fixed. Additionally, Architecture/Designs related to Security Operations and the ITSM in the cloud for our roadmap.<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Contribute to design, technical direction, and architecture with various teams to build fit for purpose solutions</li><li>Participates in code reviews, proactively identifying and mitigating potential issues and defects as well as assisting with continuous improvement</li><li>Follows agreed upon SDLC procedures to ensure that all information system products and services meet both explicit and implicit quality standards, end-user functional requirements, architectural standards, performance requirements, audit requirements, security rules are upheld, and external facing reporting is represented</li><li>Writes unit and integration tests to maintain quality technology improvements</li><li>Performs application and project risk analysis and recommends quality improvements</li><li>Manage Production Support on system functionality and provide fixes as required</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>5+ years of experience in implementing ServiceNow or similar platforms for ITSM, SecOps and/or GRC/IRM modules</li><li>3+ years of experience with Javascript</li><li>Experience with RESTful APIs and JSON</li><li>Ability to write clean, bug-free code that is easy to understand and easily maintainable</li><li>Strong understanding of CMDB, including importing customer data</li><li>Experience with Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe), Agile/Scrum, and DevSecOps methodologies</li><li>BS degree in Management Information Systems, Computer Science, similar technical field</li></ul>

title: Software Engineer - Freelance [Remote]
description: As a Mobile Engineer you will be responsible for designing, developing, debugging, and troubleshooting innovative software solutions for existing product enhancements and new product applications.<p><br></p>Origami Risk is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We thrive and benefit from diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive and equitable environment for all employees. We do not discriminate against any individual based upon race, religion, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, color, sex, national origin, age, marital status, military or veteran status, disability, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Implements React Native features, including creation of UI Screens, handling of navigational and animation behavior, state management, authentication, API calls, repository logic and DTO transformation . </li><li> Practices test driven development, writing and maintaining both unit and integration tests. </li><li> Builds intuitive, secure, and highly scalable mobile applications. </li><li> Builds responsive mobile applications that work well across multiple screen sizes. </li><li> Develops UI components in isolation. </li><li> Improves code quality through code reviews and pair programming. </li><li> Provides ongoing maintenance, support, and enhancements to existing applications. </li><li> Provides recommendations for continuous improvement. </li><li> Collaborates with product owner, delivery lead, quality assurance and business stakeholders to ensure that features developed meet customer needs. </li><li> Assists with writing documentation. </li><li> Other duties as assigned. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field. </li><li> 5+ years of programming experience with mobile development. </li><li> Experience in cross-platform development with React Native with TypeScript for the Android and iOS platforms. </li><li> Experience with build and deployment tool scripting and setup is a plus, experience with Expo Application Services (EAS) is a plus. </li><li> Experience with NativeBase or other component libraries is a plus. </li><li> Experience with a state container desired, Zustand knowledge is a plus. </li><li> Experience with hexagonal architecture and/or dependency injection is a plus. </li><li> Experience with local storage technologies desired, Realm knowledge is a plus. </li><li> Experience with test driven development desired, Jest and Detox libraries knowledge is a plus. </li><li> Experience using Storybook or similar libraries to build UI components in isolation is a plus. </li><li> Experience with logging technologies like Firebase and Sentry.io is a plus. </li><li> Experience with building mobile applications using Xamarin is a plus. </li><li> Experience with Scrum/Agile development methodologies a plus. </li><li> Risk management and insurance expertise is a plus. </li><li> Prior experience with managing client product implementations is a plus. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Who We Are</strong><p><br></p>Origami Risk is a leading provider of integrated SaaS solutions for risk management, insurance, safety, and compliance. We've designed our single-platform, cloud-based software to be easily configurable to meet the needs of insured corporate and public entities, brokers and risk consultants, insurers and MGAs, third party claims administrators (TPAs), risk pools, and more. To fulfill our singular focus of helping our clients achieve their business objectives, our software is supported by a best-in-class service team of experienced risk, insurance, and safety professionals who have an ideal balance of industry knowledge and technological expertise.<p><br></p>Since its founding in 2009, Origami Risk has received more than two dozen awards for service excellence, technology innovation, and workplace culture. In addition to inclusion in Deloitte’s Technology Fast 500™, a ranking of the 500 fastest-growing tech companies in North America, Origami Risk also has been repeatedly recognized by Inc. magazine as one of the “Best Places to Work” and Best and Brightest® Companies To Work For in the Nation by the National Association for Business Resources (NABR).

intuitive, secure, and highly scalable mobile applications. </li><li> Builds responsive mobile applications that work well across multiple screen sizes. </li><li> Develops UI components in isolation. </li><li> Improves code quality through code reviews and pair programming. </li><li> Provides ongoing maintenance, support, and enhancements to existing applications. </li><li> Provides recommendations for continuous improvement. </li><li> Collaborates with product owner, delivery lead, quality assurance and business stakeholders to ensure that features developed meet customer needs. </li><li> Assists with writing documentation. </li><li> Other duties as assigned. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field. </li><li> 5+ years of programming experience with mobile development. </li><li> Experience in cross-platform development with React Native with TypeScript for the Android and iOS platforms. </li><li> Experience with build and deployment tool scripting and setup is a plus, experience with Expo Application Services (EAS) is a plus. </li><li> Experience with NativeBase or other component libraries is a plus. </li><li> Experience with a state container desired, Zustand knowledge is a plus. </li><li> Experience with hexagonal architecture and/or dependency injection is a plus. </li><li> Experience with local storage technologies desired, Realm knowledge is a plus. </li><li> Experience with test driven development desired, Jest and Detox libraries knowledge is a plus. </li><li> Experience using Storybook or similar libraries to build UI components in isolation is a plus. </li><li> Experience with logging technologies like Firebase and Sentry.io is a plus. </li><li> Experience with building mobile applications using Xamarin is a plus. </li><li> Experience with Scrum/Agile development methodologies a plus. </li><li> Risk management and insurance expertise is a plus. </li><li> Prior experience with managing client product implementations is a plus. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Who We Are</strong><p><br></p>Origami Risk is a leading provider of integrated SaaS solutions for risk management, insurance, safety, and compliance. We've designed our single-platform, cloud-based software to be easily configurable to meet the needs of insured corporate and public entities, brokers and risk consultants, insurers and MGAs, third party claims administrators (TPAs), risk pools, and more. To fulfill our singular focus of helping our clients achieve their business objectives, our software is supported by a best-in-class service team of experienced risk, insurance, and safety professionals who have an ideal balance of industry knowledge and technological expertise.<p><br></p>Since its founding in 2009, Origami Risk has received more than two dozen awards for service excellence, technology innovation, and workplace culture. In addition to inclusion in Deloitte’s Technology Fast 500™, a ranking of the 500 fastest-growing tech companies in North America, Origami Risk also has been repeatedly recognized by Inc. magazine as one of the “Best Places to Work” and Best and Brightest® Companies To Work For in the Nation by the National Association for Business Resources (NABR).

title: RedCAT Systems - Full Stack Software Engineer - Direct Hire [Remote]
description: PGS Worldwide is actively seeking a skilled Embedded Software Engineer to support ongoing projects for an Aerospace leader in Rolling Meadows, IL. This is an initial 1-year contract-to-hire opportunity and I will respond immediately to all qualified candidates.<p><br></p><strong><u>Job Description</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Designs, develops, documents, tests and debugs applications software and systems that contain logical and mathematical solutions.</li><li>Conducts multidisciplinary research and collaborates with equipment designers and/or hardware engineers in the planning, design, development, and utilization of electronic data processing systems for product and commercial software.</li><li>Determines computer user needs; analyzes system capabilities to resolve problems on program intent, output requirements, input data acquisition, programming techniques and controls; prepares operating instructions; designs and develops compilers and assemblers, utility programs, and operating systems.</li><li>Ensures software standards are met.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>2+ years of experience in the last 3 years, or 5 years plus experience in the last 8 years with LabView &amp; TestStand Software development and maintenance.</li><li>Complete understanding and wide application of technical principle, theories, and concepts in the field.</li></ul> Job ID: 11033-1

title: ServiceNow Solutions Engineer ITSM
description: <em>An empty treadmill isn’t compelling, but once someone steps on it, the stories are limitless. Our goal is to connect people emotionally to their fitness journey. We are a global team coming from different cultures and backgrounds with a shared passion to achieve and live our mission of inspiring healthier lives. <br><br></em><em>Inspire. Innovate. Make an impact and join our team!<br><br></em>Our<strong> Software Test Engineer</strong> is responsible for designing and implementing test procedures, including manual and automation testing, in support of our growing Agile-based product development activities on our fitness equipment software. The ideal candidate, with a Computer Science background, will execute manual and automation testing and should have the ability to handle interruptions while fluidly switching between several assignments.<br><br><strong><u>Responsibilities<br><br></u></strong>The engineer must be able to perform the following:<br><ul><li>Familiar with Software-as-a-Service model (SaaS)</li><li>Critical thinking to solve problems unique to developing technologies.</li><li>Regularly apply technical knowledge to daily engineering activities.</li><li>Analyze architecture, code bases to develop critical path experiments to ensure safety and reliability.</li><li>Leverage analysis tools when needed to determine root causes.</li><li>Continuously improve analysis and validation techniques and apply them in daily practice.</li><li>Able to be an independent engineer that understands the project scopes and best-adheres to project timelines / goals.</li><li>Integrate and communicate well with other engineering teams, making known individual contributions and assisting others when necessary.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Preferred Skills<br><br></u></strong><strong>Languages / Toolsets<br></strong><ul><li>Java, PostGres, MySQL, Android, Automation (e.g. Monkey Runner, WebDriver, Selenium), Atlassian Suite<br></li></ul><strong>Networks<br></strong><ul><li>TCP / IP, UDP<br></li></ul><strong>Networking Principles<br></strong><ul><li>Analysis Methods, Learning, Failing, Improving, Controlling, Unit Testing, Functional Testing , Code Reviews, Critical Thinking<br></li></ul><strong><u>Testing Skills<br></u></strong><ul><li>Develop/execute test cases from user stories</li><li>Automate test cases using the tools like (Monkey Runner, WebDriver, Selenium)</li><li>Strong understanding of functional testing, regression testing and Sanity testing</li><li>Good understanding on Agile methodologies and techniques<br></li></ul><strong><u>Operating Systems<br></u></strong><ul><li>Linux Windows</li><li>Exhaustive knowledge is not mandatory, but a candidate is expected to discuss their preference at a high level<br></li></ul><strong><u>Controlled Repositories<br></u></strong><ul><li>Knowledge about controlled code revision methods, GIT, Subversion<br></li></ul><strong>Software Design Principles<br></strong><ul><li>Paradigms, Encapsulation, Patterns, Synchronization and Communication Methods<br></li></ul><strong><u>EXPEREIENCE<br><br></u></strong>3+ years software development or testing experience<br><br><strong><u>EDUCATION<br><br></u></strong>Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related discipline<br><br>Want to take the next step in your career?<br><br>Life Fitness takes pride in our talented employees and believe in providing opportunities for further growth and advancement. We encourage you to test your strengths, push your limits and unleash your potential.<br><br>If you feel the open position you see is right for you, we invite you to apply.<br><br><em>Learn more about us here.<br><br></em><em>Life Fitness does not accept applications, inquiries or solicitations from unapproved staffing agencies or vendors.<br><br></em>Equal Opportunity Employer: Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled<br><br>EEO is The Law - click here for more information<br><br>Life Fitness and Workday Privacy Policies
