title: Mobile Engineer (Hybrid)
description: <strong>Want to be a part of our team?<br><br></strong>Responsible for setup and installation of technical systems, applications, or process designs for client’s purchased or outsourced technology and business process solutions. Works directly with client to manage initial access, map and transfer data, create process documentation, and train or coordinate training for client users. Tests and troubleshoots functionality of installed systems; identifies and documents technical issues to be escalated to product and system integration teams for resolution. Provides feedback based on client experiences to product and professional services teams for product and process improvements. May work directly with clients on-site or provide installation support remotely.<br><br><strong>Working at NTT<br><br></strong>The primary responsibility of the TS Implementation Engineer is to provide technical support to NTT (Ltd) clients. This includes remotely supporting clients within service level agreements (SLAs), to install and configure software and hardware, resolve incidents, perform root cause analysis and adhere to any related processes such as change management. The TS Implementation Engineer (L3) is involved in more complex environments for installation, configuration and fault management.<br><br><strong>Key Roles and Responsibilities:<br></strong><ul><li>Interact with clients on site to meet complex requirements of a solution. </li><li>Escalate unresolved problems and issues to the relevant third parties. </li><li>Respond to escalated client requests and support client applications to a first line resolution. </li><li>Escalate complex problems to the relevant third parties. </li><li>Write reports and proposals and complete and maintain project documentation. </li><li>Assist with the documentation of standard operating procedures relating to installations and fixes. </li><li>Act as coach and mentor to more junior Implementation Engineers and Technicians. </li><li>Assume responsibility for the co-ordination of the activities of the Engineers, in line with performance targets. </li><li>May be required to serve periodically on the customer service desk, providing third line telephonic, remote and on-site support and problem management. </li><li>Included in higher complexity design work, with input to the design expected. </li><li>Expected to take ownership of relevant technologies according to domain or specialization. <br><br></li></ul><strong>Knowledge, Skills and Attributes:<br></strong><ul><li>Good understanding and appreciation of technical design and business principles</li><li>Demonstrates project management and administration ability</li><li>Good project skills which are demonstrated in the execution of installations and other assignments</li><li>Demonstrate customer engagement skills</li><li>Demonstrate relevant domain specialist knowledge</li><li>Good verbal communication skills</li><li>Client focused and display a proactive approach to solving problems</li><li>Ability to work under pressure</li><li>Ability to coach, mentor and provide guidance to team members</li><li>Good understanding of project management principles<br><br></li></ul><strong>Academic Qualifications and Certifications:<br></strong><ul><li>Computer Science / Information Technology Degree or equivalent together with specialised training in new technologies and legacy systems or equivalent</li><li>Project management certification<br><br></li></ul><strong>Required Experience:<br></strong><ul><li>Solid work experience in a technical implementation engineering or similar role</li><li>Experience engaging with clients and conducting presentations</li><li>Good project administration and documentation experience</li><li>Report writing experience</li><li>Basic project management<br><br></li></ul><strong>What will make you a good fit for the role?</strong>

title: Embedded Software Engineer
description: CDW’s vision is to be THE national provider of Managed Services. We’ll achieve this reputation by continuing to delight our customers and being the employer of choice for Managed Services. Engineers at CDW are responsible for the development and delivery of our Managed Services offerings. Engineers apply the necessary technical breadth to providing top level technical support services and operational leadership, including problem resolution, and technical change implementation for Managed Services clients. Engineers at CDW are smart, hardworking individuals with top level experience and enjoy working on highly visible, technically challenging projects and service offerings. They are high caliber, well rounded professionals who are passionate about emerging technology, with exceptional customer service and communication skills<p><br></p>Key Areas of Responsibility<p><br></p><ul><li>Provide design, implementation, technical support services and consulting to Managed Services clients to meet their business needs.</li><li>Design plan, and implement solutions using the latest technology</li><li>Provide innovative technical solutions to complex hardware/software problems.</li><li>Understand and Deliver Managed Services offerings as outlined in the CDW Service Descriptions and Service Catalog</li><li>Understand and follow the processes and procedures defined in the CDW ManS Standard Operating Procedures manual (SOP).</li><li>Provide detailed and effective communication to internal and external customers</li><li>Clearly and concisely articulate problems and solutions for issues to clients both over the phone, via e-mail and in person.</li><li>Member of on-call rotation to provide 24 X 7 support to critical systems and ensure availability objectives are met.</li><li>Conduct throughput analysis, problem solving, and infrastructure planning</li><li>Participate in various client projects intended to continually improve/upgrade technology infrastructures</li><li>Create and execute test plans to meet project requirements for assigned components</li><li>Identify and communicate potential opportunities for cross-selling to the sales team Manage time and expense to meet or exceed expectations defined in the Statement of Work </li><li>Provide high quality content deliverables using the appropriate document templates </li><li>Ensure solution is implemented as designed to the customer’s satisfaction and approval<br><br></li></ul><p><br></p>Responsibilities<p><br></p><ul><li>As a Consulting Engineer provide technical services with little supervision from Supervisors, Team Leads, and Technology Owners</li><li>Ability to follow through with tasks, projects, troubleshooting with little supervision.</li><li>Serve as technical point of contact on customer engagements, and internal projects</li><li>Complete projects/tasks on a timely basis, according to commitments made to stakeholders and management</li><li>Performs scopes of work as detailed in implementation plans assigned (system builds, test plans, documentation, training, etc).</li><li>Handles several tasks simultaneously (ie: pre-sales, troubleshoots and develops internal network, responds to emergencies).</li><li>Communicates with Engineering Manager all events that are not anticipated (new product requirements, equipment failure, design changes, schedule changes).</li><li>Responds to all customers professionally and courteously and relays any customer questions or concerns to manager.</li><li>Demonstrates and actively promotes an understanding and commitment to the mission of CDW through performing behaviors consistent with the CDW Way.</li><li>Assist in creating and documenting policies and procedures.</li><li>Understand SLAs in a production environment and proactively strive to meet the commitments.</li><li>Provide support to Service Account Managers, Project Managers and product developers.</li><li>Contribute to written proposals and technical documentation.</li><li>Assist Professional Services team when required with client consultation including assessing and recommending architectural designs/changes to client systems in response to performance issues, growth requirements, etc.</li><li>Review assigned service requests daily, following up and providing status updates to clients; ensure data pertaining to the status of service requests is entered into the problem tracking systems accurately and promptly to provide an up-to-date picture of service delivery status and backlog.</li><li>Supports and conducts self in a manner consistent with customer service expectations.</li><li>Tests, evaluates, and develops new products, offerings, and solutions.</li><li>Conducts training of customers and company employees in both formal and informal environments.</li><li>Works directly with Project Managers to update project plans and communicate project status. <br><br></li></ul><p><br></p><strong> Minimum Qualifications </strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Minimum of 3 year engineering experience</li><li>BA/BS degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Electrical Engineering, or related discipline; equivalent experience acceptable.<br><br></li></ul><p><br></p>Other Required Qualifications<p><br></p><ul><li>Capable of resolving critical issues in a time sensitive manner, cognizant of requisite service levels.</li><li>Ability to establish customer trust and confidence in the CDW Managed Services knowledge of and concern for customers’ business needs.</li><li>History of balancing multiple priorities simultaneously with the ability to adapt to the changing needs of the customers while meeting deadlines.</li><li>Critical attention to detail and solid creative problem solving skills.</li><li>Ability to perform intermediate root cause analysis.</li><li>Strong organizational, analytical, and problem solving skills.</li><li>Customer Service focused and a high level of professionalism.</li><li>Ability to consistently follow policies and procedures.</li><li>Strong communication and documentation skills.</li><li>Excellence verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to effectively interact with all coworkers and stakeholders, in including senior leadership.</li><li>Ability to prioritize work and handle multiple tasks simultaneously in a fast paced, diverse and growth-oriented environment.</li><li>Must know when to ask for assistance. Must be approachable, teachable, a team player with a strong desire to continue learning and expanding their experience in a highly evolving technical environment.</li><li>Must have good time management skills and be able to meet rigid and urgent assignment schedules.<br><br></li></ul><p><br></p>Preferred Qualifications<p><br></p><ul><li>Expert level knowledge of Microsoft technologies in Microsoft Teams UC.</li><li>Expert level knowledge of Microsoft Teams quality of service</li><li>Expert level knowledge of AudioCodes or Ribbon SBCs and Gateways</li><li>Working knowledge of Microsoft Teams Video and Meetings Solutions</li><li>Working knowledge of Microsoft 365 Ecosystem and Associated Solutions</li><li>Hands-on experience in a large Data Center environment</li><li>ITIL Foundations Certification<br><br></li></ul>

Must be approachable, teachable, a team player with a strong desire to continue learning and expanding their experience in a highly evolving technical environment.</li><li>Must have good time management skills and be able to meet rigid and urgent assignment schedules.<br><br></li></ul><p><br></p>Preferred Qualifications<p><br></p><ul><li>Expert level knowledge of Microsoft technologies in Microsoft Teams UC.</li><li>Expert level knowledge of Microsoft Teams quality of service</li><li>Expert level knowledge of AudioCodes or Ribbon SBCs and Gateways</li><li>Working knowledge of Microsoft Teams Video and Meetings Solutions</li><li>Working knowledge of Microsoft 365 Ecosystem and Associated Solutions</li><li>Hands-on experience in a large Data Center environment</li><li>ITIL Foundations Certification<br><br></li></ul>

title: Business Associate - Android & iOS
description: Job Summary This role performs and implements activities that impacts components / processes of specified functional areas of the Walgreens business software products OR Digital/Online application in an Agile environment. Work is typically received in short-term assignments that often require the application of independent judgment. Operates within the context of defined procedures that provide desired functionality to digital solutions, products and programs, typically for intermediary, basic to complex systems. Implements activities that influence entry to mid-level components of the functional area Job Responsibilities Writes code that meets specifications. Develops software applications and tools. Completes programming and performs testing and debugging applications Develops software applications and tools using Agile development methodologies. Participates actively in the design, architecture and build phases, to aim at producing high quality deliverables, working with existing architects where appropriate. Participates in the evaluation of compatibility of programs with existing communications hardware and software features. Develops professional expertise, applies company policies and procedures to resolve a variety of issues. Works on problems of moderate scope where analysis of situations or data requires a review of a variety of factors. Exercises judgment within defined procedures and practices to determine appropriate action. Builds productive internal/external working relationships. Receives general instructions on routine work, detailed instructions on new projects or assignments. Usually works with some supervision, conferring with superiors on unusual or complex matters Demonstrates proficiency in several areas of the professional function. Has working knowledge of programming languages important to the organization Effectively resolves problems and roadblocks as they occur. Has working knowledge of programming languages important to the organization. Interacts with internal and external peers and/or managers to exchange semi-complex information related to assigned activities. Acts as individual contributor as well as team member Utilizes experience in order to identify problematic relationships. Anticipates, prevents and eliminates problems and creates efficient fixes. Gathers and updates necessary information and communicates to appropriate parties. An Equal Opportunity Employer, including disability/veterans About Walgreens Boots Alliance Walgreens Boots Alliance (Nasdaq: WBA) is a global leader in retail pharmacy, impacting millions of lives every day through dispensing medicines, and providing accessible, high-quality care. With more than 170 years of trusted healthcare heritage and innovation in community pharmacy, the company is meeting customers and patients needs through its convenient retail locations, digital platforms and health and beauty products. Including equity method investments, WBA has a presence in more than 25 countries, employs more than 450,000 people and has more than 21,000 stores. WBAs purpose is to help people across the world lead healthier and happier lives. The company is proud of its contributions to healthy communities, a healthy planet, an inclusive workplace and a sustainable marketplace. WBA is a participant of the United Nations Global Compact and adheres to its principles-based approach to responsible business. WBA is included in FORTUNEs 2021 list of the Worlds Most Admired Companies*. This is the 28th consecutive year that WBA or its predecessor company, Walgreen Co., has been named to the list. More company information is available at www.walgreensbootsalliance.com. Basic Qualifications Bachelors Degree and at least 2 years of Engineering, Software Engineering or similar field experience OR High School/ GED and at least 4 years of Engineering, Software Engineering or similar field experience Experience writing code for applications or automation Experience with programming languages for online applications, microservices, APIs or mobile applications Experience building, testing applications or automation Knowledge of the Software Development Life Cycle Experience creating coding solutions to fix moderate problems/issues Willing to travel up to 5% of the time for business purposes (domestically and/or internationally). Preferred Qualifications Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or similar field Experience working in an Agile environment At least 2 years of progressively complex related experience. Experience identifying operational issues and recommending and implementing strategies to resolve problems DevOps 2+ years of on experience is Deployment automation for various applications IaaS, PaaS platforms 2+ years of hands-on experience in automation software like Chef, Puppet, Ansible, Terraform or equivalent Good knowledge of GIT workflows and Repo management Excellent knowledge in implement of CI/CD pipelines for Cloud deployments using containers/Docker Working knowledge of Kubernetes and microservices architecture and other DevOps tooling and Linux environments Working knowledge or experience of software development for Web and Mobile applications in agile environments Web/backend Developer Previous experience with full stack development ranging from front-end user interfaces to back-end systems Proficient in back-end languages like Java, Node/Typescript, .NET, Python etc. with exposure to performance optimization of high traffic &amp; scalable services Hands on with modern UI frameworks like React with good knowledge of front-end design pattern (stateless components, conditional rendering, controlled components, hooks etc.) Excellent knowledge of distributed SQL (e.g., Oracle, MySQL), NoSQL (MongoDB, Cassandra) design &amp; consumption patterns Have an exposure to implementation, capacity planning &amp; performance tuning of Cloud technologies Azure (ACS, AKS), Google, IBM, AWS or Cloud Foundry Knowledge of software engineering best practices including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build process, testing &amp; operations Mobile Developer 2 years of Mobile App development experience and hands on skills in Swift, SwiftUI, Objective C ( iOS) 2 Years of Mobile App development experience and hands-on skills in Kotlin ( Android) Experience in building client applications consuming JSON based on APIs Knowledge of software engineering best practices including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build process, testing &amp; operations Software Engineer in Test 3+ years of experience as an SDET, Developer, or strong Automation Engineer Experience developing automation in at least one OO language - Java, C#/C++, Python or web based technologies Proven experience creating automation frameworks and tools to support test automation Experience working in a Microservices based architecture in a cloud native environment Data &amp; Analytics 2 years of experience in integrating, transforming and consolidating data from various structured and unstructured data systems for building analytics solutions in any cloud Platforms: Microsoft Azure, AWS or GCP Experience with relational and NoSQL databases such as Cosmos, Cassandra 2 years of Experience in SQL, Java or Python programming Experience in Data Pipeline and integration workflow management tools: Talend, Store Proc, Change Data Capture (CDC), Spark &amp; Azure API Experience identifying operational issues and recommending fixes to resolve problems Knowledge in Azure cloud technologies like Data Flow, Data Bricks, Azure Synapse, Power BI Analytics Experience in any of reporting tools like Power BI, Business objects, Cognos or Tableau An employee in this position can expect a salary/hourly rate between $90,0155 and $166,760 plus bonus pursuant to the terms of any bonus plan if applicable. The actual salary will depend on experience, seniority, geographic locations, and other factors permitted by law. To review benefits, please click here jobs.walgreens.com/benefits.

title: .Net Architect
description: Sphera is a leading global provider of enterprise software and services that enables companies to manage and optimize their environmental, health, safety and sustainability. Our mission is to create a safer, more sustainable and productive world.<br><br>Sphera is a portfolio company of Blackstone, a U.S.-based alternative asset investment company that focuses on private equity, technology and innovation, and more. Blackstone businesses succeed through strong partnerships, a personalized approach and a commitment to exceptional performance with uncompromising integrity. Sphera and Blackstone are leaders in the Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) space.<br><br>We are guided by our core values of Customer Centricity, Accountability, Bias to Action, Innovation, and Collaboration. These values help us recruit the right talent to join our rapidly expanding team of around 1000 Spherions around the globe. It is important to us that each and every Spherion is not only eager to challenge themselves and knows how to get work done but is an awesome addition to our company culture.<br><br><strong><u>Job Description<br><br></u></strong>Sphera is looking for a Software Engineer to join our SpheraCloud engineering team. Our software helps companies achieve their ESG (Environmental, Social, and Governance) goals. Come work on a team that utilizes the best technologies to deliver great new features to a quickly growing SaaS product.<br><br><strong><u>Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li>Scrum/Agile based development of a SaaS Application </li><li>Technical Design/Build/Unit Testing of new features </li><li>Analysis and Refactoring of existing source code </li><li>Analyze requirements, suggest concepts, and assess development efforts</li><li>Establish yourself as a Subject Matter Expert </li><li>Mentor other engineers<br></li></ul><strong><u>Required Skills<br></u></strong><ul><li>1-3 years’ experience building applications on Microsoft Azure </li><li>Expertise using Scala</li><li>Experience with analytics/Big Data solutions (ie. Hadoop, Azure Data Lake, Synapse, Azure Data Factory)</li><li>Experience with database design and optimization</li><li>Experience with current trends in software development</li><li>Experience with Software Design Patterns and Best Practices<br></li></ul><strong><u>Skills Considered a Plus<br></u></strong><ul><li>Experience with containerization </li><li>Experience optimizing applications for performance </li><li>SaaS Product Development experience </li><li>Scrum/Agile experience <br></li></ul>Sphera is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.<br><br>This job description is intended to convey information essential to understanding the scope of the job and the general nature and level of work performed by job holders within this job. This job description is not intended to be an exhaustive list of qualifications, skills, efforts, duties, responsibilities or working conditions associated with the position.

title: Software Engineer-(RxR) Chicago-A
description: <ul><li>Are you looking for an exciting Embedded Software opportunity in the Aerospace and Defense industry? This is the position you are looking for!* ***Must be eligible to obtain a security clearance*** Actalent connects passion with purpose. We help visionary companies advance their engineering and science initiatives through access to specialized experts that drive scale, innovation, and speed to market. With a network of almost 30,000 engineering and sciences consultants and more than 4,500 clients across the U.S., Canada, Asia, and Europe, Actalent serves many of the Fortune 500. title: Full Stack Developer (React and Node JS)
description: <strong>Overview<br><br></strong>The individual will be primarily responsible for independently conducting fundamental credit research on current and potential holdings within assigned sectors in the US high yield and/or leveraged loan markets.<br><br>A high yield credit analyst will assist Portfolio Managers that manage US and Global High Yield funds. The analyst will maintain models, aggregate data, and interact with management teams to help assess a debt issuer’s risk/return profile. The analyst should be comfortable with capital structure and cash flow analyses. The analyst should be able to aggregate data for the purpose of ongoing monitoring of purchased securities. The analyst should maintain relationships with sell side and rating agency counterparts. The analyst will work closely with portfolio managers in the construction of portfolios.<br><br><strong>Responsibilities</strong><ul><li> Conduct fundamental corporate credit research on US high yield issuers</li><ul><li> Produce financial models to assess credit quality </li><li> Meet with management teams on a regular basis to help inform investment opinions </li><li> Interact with market participants to bolster data collection to support investment views (e.g., rating agency analysts, buy side/sell side counterparts, industry experts) </li><li> Utilize alternative data sources to complement traditional data collection </li></ul><li> Deliver timely investment recommendations on issuers within the high yield and/or leveraged loan markets</li><ul><li> Assess credit quality through a proprietary scenario analyses template </li><li> Daily communication with portfolio managers in both the US and UK </li></ul><li> Assess macroeconomic factors and their impact on covered issuers as well as industrial and financial sectors</li><ul><li> Participate in monthly HY strategy meetings to contribute to team macroeconomic views <br></li></ul></ul><strong>Qualifications<br></strong><ul><li> Leveraged finance (high yield bonds and/or leveraged loans) experience of 5-12 years </li><li> Experience in evaluating fundamental credit factors that could impact the valuation of a fixed income security </li><li> Experience in financial forecasting and maintaining fundamental earnings models </li><li> Deep understanding of complex capital structures and sectors with an ability to identify opportunities within these capital structures and/or sectors. </li><li> Track record of providing investment recommendations appropriate for various fund objectives/restrictions </li><li> An ability to incorporate ESG factors into the fundamental analysis of credit quality </li><li> Familiarity with Microsoft Office and Bloomberg </li><li> Experience at an asset management firm is preferred <br><br></li></ul><strong>PERSONAL CHARACTERISTICS:<br></strong><ul><li> Driven individual with an ability to multi-task </li><li> Relentlessly inquisitive </li><li> Ability to work in a fast-fast paced team-oriented structure </li><li> Solid credit skills and disciplined underwriting process </li><li> Demonstrated ability to formulate investment ideas and monitor a portfolio of debt issuers </li><li> Ability to work independently and take ownership of work </li><li> Exceptional written and verbal skills </li><li> Commitment to LGIMA’s firm values of trust, listening, learning, and diversity </li><li> Experience in a performance driven culture is preferred <br><br></li></ul><strong> EOE Statement <br><br></strong>As an EOE employer, Legal &amp; General Investment Management America will extend equal opportunity to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, ancestry, national origin, age, disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, pregnancy, military status, and/or any other characteristic protected under applicable federal, state or local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment.

title: Software Engineer - Low-Level Device Driver
description: Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, gt.school. Have you got what it takes?<p><br></p>Do you take pleasure in looking at and interpreting data? Are you passionate about education and want a role in a startup that wants to revolutionize how technology is used to learn? If yes, keep on reading…<p><br></p>We’re looking for individuals who:<p><br></p><ul><li>Are strategic problem solvers who can quickly devise and implement solutions to address ad-hoc issues facing our students</li><li>Are excellent communicators; able to concisely and effectively describe processes in written playbooks, design engaging student communication, and keep other team members consistently updated with progress on projects. </li><li>Consider themselves to be consistent, high performers who rarely have ‘off-days’.</li><li>Understand the importance of revolutionizing the education space with cutting-edge technology.</li></ul><p><br></p>In this role, you’ll work directly with our EdTech company, gt.school. You’ll develop an expert understanding of the data we collect on students and become familiar with all the apps and systems we use to collect and store this information. You will build new edtech tools and operational processes, and restructure existing processes to be more efficient.<p><br></p>Not only will you gain valuable experience, but you’ll also receive regular coaching and training from a team of global tech experts and operations professionals. You’ll get constructive feedback on all of your work to help you develop and get a chance to meet daily with other team members to work collaboratively on projects.<p><br></p>Interested in a role that involves research, strategy, product development, and data science in the cutting-edge field of education and technology? Apply below.<p><br></p><strong><u>What You Will Be Doing</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Participating in daily stand-up calls to solve the most critical issues facing students in our program, other staff members such as Motivational Coaches, Academic Coaches, Program Directors, or the leadership team.</li><li>Converting important decisions made by leadership into work units that a junior Operations team can perform.</li><li>Creating robust processes that stand the test of time and capture all of the edge-cases to ensure maximum probability of success the first time around. </li><li>Troubleshooting issues facing our students due to data issues, human error, or automation error; quickly strategizing a bulletproof solution that solves the issue and prevents further recurrence in the future.</li><li>Working as a team to ensure progress is being made on key tasks by communicating with other operations analysts and managers to ensure no lapse in service for internal or external stakeholders.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>What You Won’t Be Doing</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Collecting data or performing administrative tasks - we have a junior operations analyst team to do this type of work.</li><li>Providing loose or generalized solutions that don’t actually get implemented.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Senior Software Engineer Key Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p>Same as “What you will be doing”, above.<p><br></p><strong><u>Basic Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Excellent written and verbal English communication skills</li><li>Proficient in Python or R (we will test this)</li><li>2+ years of work experience working in a technical field (science, technology, financial services, data science)</li><li>Bachelor’s degree from a top 20 US university or a top 100 global university.</li><li>Consistently able to work 8 hours per day, Monday through Friday, between 6AM and 6PM CST</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Nice-to-have Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Advanced in Python and Apps Script</li><li>Familiarity with Canvas (LMS)</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>About Gt.school</u></strong><p><br></p>gt.school is a stealth EdTech startup in Austin, Texas, the center of educational innovation in the US. Our unique approach leverages 50+ years of learning science, cutting-edge data analytics and high-performance life skills coaching. In doing so, we can help students learn 5x faster and unlock their full potential in both academics and in life. We are a remote-first company that hires globally via Crossover.<p><br></p>There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!<p><br></p><strong>Working with Crossover</strong><p><br></p>This is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $30 USD/hour, which equates to $60,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.<p><br></p><strong>What to expect next:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.</li><li>Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Important!</strong> If you do not receive an email from us:<p><br></p><ul><li>First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.</li><li>Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.</li><li>Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.</li><li>If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/password-recovery if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.</li></ul> Crossover Job Code: LJ-4880-US-Chicago-SeniorSoftware<p><br></p>

description: Location:- LisleWorking Days :- 3 days from Office. Job Description:-ResponsibilitiesPerform in a team environment and collaborative atmosphereSoftware design and app development of automotive data acquisition, OTA, device to cloud communicationSoftware testingSupport software integration and releasesAutomation using scripting languages such as Perl, Python, etc.Actively participate in internal and external peer reviews to foster continuous improvement of both the products and the development processCollaborate with multi-functional teams and business partners top develop and improve software functionalityDesired SkillsB.S. or M.S. degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related technical degreeStrong proficiency in C++ (min C++11; preferably C++14), OOP best practices, design patterns, Cpp templates metaprogrammingGood understanding of data structures and algorithms, runtime memory management and garbage collectionExperience with developing embedded software applications under Linux, RTOSIn-Vehicle communication via CAN and the associated protocols (J1939, UDS, XCP)Problem solving and issue root cause identification techniques, Runtime crash analysis (Core dumps with GNU GCC debugger for ARM Arch), exceptions handlingFamiliarity with Gtest suite, CMake, CPack, CI, Shell/Bash scriptingSoftware debugging and testing tools (CANalyzer, debuggers); Software optimization (Profiling/ Instrumentation/ Tracing)Strong understanding of IPC Mechanisms, MQTT; familiarity with JSON, XMLExperience with professional software engineering best practices for full software development life cycle, including coding standards, source code control &amp; revision management, build processes, testing<p><br></p>C++ Engineer

Job seekers looking for an organization that prioritizes company culture and willing to teach new skills, apply here for more information! title: Embedded Software Engineer
description: <strong>You are passionate about technology and have a desire to be part of an innovative team that develops and maintains mission-critical applications that align with an organization's objectives. You enjoy working collaboratively with other developers, as well as stakeholders, to deliver high-quality software solutions. Your strong understanding of software architecture, web development technologies, and coding languages pairs well with your ability to create and maintain software applications and websites that are user-friendly, efficient, and visually pleasing. You enjoy working in a dynamic team environment, working on multiple projects simultaneously and celebrating successes along the way.</strong><p><br></p>If this sounds like you (or someone you know), please read on!<p><br></p>The Full Stack Developer will perform the development and maintenance of our applications to support the Academy's Registry program. The Developer’s role is to write, code, test, and analyze software programs and applications. The Developer will also analyze and amend software errors in a timely and accurate fashion and provide status reports where required. Support other client/server and web-based systems, including web sites, third party vendor interfaces, off-the-shelf enterprise software, and other custom developed solutions.<p><br></p><ul><li>Design &amp; develop software solutions that meet needs defined in the business requirements. </li><li>Complete development of all assigned tasks on time. </li><li>Participate in conceptualization and development of new software programs and applications. </li><li>Participate in the preparation and documentation of program requirements, detailed technical specifications and the technical deployment documents. </li><li>Conduct research on emerging application development software products, languages, and standards in support of procurement and development efforts. </li><li>Provide issue escalation and resolution as well as timely execution of deadlines. </li><li>Interact with team leads and business analysts to ensure accurate and comprehensive understanding of the requirements. </li><li>Must possess excellent diagnostic, problem-solving and debugging skills. </li><li>Have an understanding of using clean coding techniques. </li><li>Participate in grooming session to provide point estimates on user stories, epic based on complexity, volume (amount of change) &amp; risk/uncertainty. </li><li>Deploy software to Development, QA, UAT and Production environments. </li><li>Review UI/UX designs produced by BA or UI/UX designer and provide feedback on the design. </li><li>Good experience in writing SQL procedures, views, scripts, etc. </li><li>Create deployment plans for releases. </li><li>Continuously learn new technologies &amp; languages.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Exemplifies The Essential Values Of The Academy</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Teamwork: Effective collaboration and team-focus to solve complex problems and drive innovation. </li><li> Empowerment: The authority, information, and skills to make decisions and drive results. </li><li> Accountability: Ownership of process and results that drive decisions and ensure implementation. </li><li> Mindset of Growth/Continuous Learning: Focused on and invested in self and staff development to become more adaptable, making the Academy more agile, innovative, and sustainable. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Travel</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Up to 5 business days</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualification s</u></strong><p><br></p><strong>Required</strong> :<ul><li>Bachelor's degree in computer science, engineering, or related fields </li><li>6+ years of .NET software development experience in creating full stack web-based solutions using OOP and software design patterns. </li><li>Five or more years of development experience with</li><ul><li>ASP.NET MVC C# </li><li>Entity Framework </li><li>jQuery </li><li>JSON </li><li>REST API </li><li>HTML5 </li><li>Angular </li></ul><li>Proficient in writing SQL server queries, stored procedures, and query optimization. </li><li>Four plus years of experience using SQL Server to perform following</li><ul><li>Write stored procedures and scripts </li><li>Write database triggers and views </li></ul><li>Experience working with Git to create feature branches, merge branches, resolve merge conflicts required. </li><li>Experience in designing, developing, debugging &amp; maintaining one or more multi-threaded solutions </li><li>Experience with using Entity Framework &amp; LINQ. </li><li>Test Driven Development, mocking frameworks, IoC, dependency injection. </li><li>Experience with Microsoft Azure cloud development is a plus but not required. </li><li>Experience implementing or utilizing CI/CD practices working with Azure DevOps. </li><li>Experience working in a scrum development team a must. </li><li>Excellent verbal and written communication skills</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Desired</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Experience in applying domain driven design principles a big plus. </li><li>Flexibility, ability to change priorities quickly, and capacity to handle multiple tasks. </li><li>Self-directed and proactive; thinks beyond the immediate problem. </li><li>Experience using Azure appliances specifically Cosmos, Azure Functions, Azure Data Factory and Azure Storage a plus </li><li>Strong written and oral communication skills.</li></ul><p><br></p>If this describes YOU, please apply by sharing the following:<p><br></p><ul><li>Clearly communicate why you are the ideal candidate for this role, providing specific examples and experiences as proof points.</li><li>Resumes must be accompanied by a cover letter with salary expectations to be considered. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Please Note</u></strong><p><br></p><strong>This position is based in Rosemont, Illinois or Washington, D.C. and is open to applicants who are able to commute weekly to one of these offices.</strong><p><br></p>Applicants must already be authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis. We are unable to sponsor or take over sponsorship of work visas.<p><br></p><strong>JOB CODE: 1000044</strong>

title: Senior Software Engineer, gt.school (Remote) - $60,000/year USD
description: At Northrop Grumman, our employees have incredible opportunities to work on revolutionary systems that impact people's lives around the world today, and for generations to come. Our pioneering and inventive spirit has enabled us to be at the forefront of many technological advancements in our nation's history - from the first flight across the Atlantic Ocean, to stealth bombers, to landing on the moon. We look for people who have bold new ideas, courage and a pioneering spirit to join forces to invent the future, and have fun along the way. Our culture thrives on intellectual curiosity, cognitive diversity and bringing your whole self to work - and we have an insatiable drive to do what others think is impossible. Our employees are not only part of history, they're making history.<br><br>Our Systems Engineering Integration &amp; Test (SEIT) organization provides complex subsystems and defense electronics. This position can be hired as a Senior (Sr.) Principal Systems Engineer depending on qualifications and years of experience. This position is located at our Rolling Meadows, IL location. This opportunity is available in the Systems Design discipline in SEIT. Duties and responsibilities can include:<br><ul><li>Creating and refining Model Based Systems Engineering Products (System behavioral models, Use Case realizations, State Machines, etc.)</li><li>Generation and update of specifications in DOORS, including requirements traceability</li><li>Functional algorithm development</li><li>Risk assessment and burn down of mitigation steps</li></ul>In addition, the ideal candidate is a subject matter expert (SME) in the field of communication system and antenna design. Specifically, the ideal candidate will have experience in the following specialty areas in regards to antenna design.<br><ul><li>Advanced knowledge and recent experience in one or more of the following areas related to EOIR/RF systems: antennas, transmitters &amp; receivers, sensors, and optics</li><li>Communication hardware, software, and system</li><li>Real-time signal processing</li><li>Requirements analysis and allocation as related to Systems Engineering</li></ul>As part of the SEIT team, a System Design Engineer is exposed to the front-end Systems Engineering process and coordinate across many disciplines to ensure that the system description and requirements are properly and thoroughly defined, captured, and meet the mission need for the end customer.<br><br><strong>Additional $10k sign-on bonus for selected candidates who possess an ACTIVE TS/SCI clearance, and an additional $5k sign-on bonuses to selected candidates who possess an active Polygraph.<br><br></strong><strong><u>Basic Qualifications<br></u></strong><ul><li>For Sr. Principal Systems Engineer, BS degree in Electrical Engineering or related technical degree with 9+ years (or MS with 7+ years, or PhD with 4+ years) related experience</li><li>Demonstrated proficiency in analytical thinking and problem-solving skills</li><li>Excellent decision making and communication (written and oral) skills</li><li>Strong work ethic and the ability to work in an integrated product team (IPT) environment</li><li>Active or Current Top Secret Clearance is required to be considered</li><li>Must have the ability to obtain SCI level access</li></ul><strong>Preferred Qualifications:<br></strong><ul><li>Advanced knowledge and experience in antenna design</li><li>Familiarity with orbital mechanics, dynamics and controls, rendezvous and proximity operations (RPO), orbit determination, and attitude planning</li><li>Full life cycle experience developing, integrating, and deploying space systems</li><li>Working knowledge of DOORS</li><li>Recent experience in requirements allocation &amp; derivation, and verification traceability</li><li>Model Based Systems Engineering experience, especially in Cameo</li><li>Agile development experience, including use of Atlassian products</li><li>Ability and willing to travel</li><li>Active Top Secret Clearance with SCI and polygraph</li></ul> <strong>Salary Range: </strong> $120,000 USD - $180,000 USD<br><br>Employees may be eligible for a discretionary bonus in addition to base pay. Annual bonuses are designed to reward individual contributions as well as allow employees to share in company results. Employees in Vice President or Director positions may be eligible for Long Term Incentives. In addition, Northrop Grumman provides a variety of benefits including health insurance coverage, life and disability insurance, savings plan, Company paid holidays and paid time off (PTO) for vacation and/or personal business.<br><br><strong>The health and safety of our employees and their families is a top priority</strong>. The company encourages employees to remain up-to-date on their COVID-19 vaccinations. U.S. Northrop Grumman employees may be required, in the future, to be vaccinated or have an approved disability/medical or religious accommodation, pursuant to future court decisions and/or government action on the currently stayed federal contractor vaccine mandate under Executive Order 14042 https://www.saferfederalworkforce.gov/contractors/ .<br><br>Northrop Grumman is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class. For our complete EEO/AA and Pay Transparency statement, please visit http://www.northropgrumman.com/EEO . U.S. Citizenship is required for most positions.

title: Apigee Software Engineer
description: <strong>Overview<br><br></strong>The Trade Operations and Asset Services Team provides post-execution trade support, daily reconciliation of cash and security positions, corporate actions processing, and operational support for client implementations.<br><br>LGIMA is currently seeking a candidate to serve as a Senior Analyst within the Fixed Income Operations team. The successful candidate will be responsible for supporting post-execution trade processing for the Active Fixed Income and LDI teams and processing related corporate action activity.<br><br><strong>Responsibilities<br></strong><ul><li> Ensure timely settlement of trades and actively chase on fails </li><li> Process TBA trade bookings, confirmation, and SIFMA assignment documentation </li><li> Liaise with portfolio managers regarding corporate action elections and postings </li><li> Investigate and resolve data transfer breaks between internal systems </li><li> Coordinate with custodian banks and other external parties to meet cut off times for instructing and reporting on daily trade activity </li><li> Liaise with Business Relations team for fund setups as necessary, monitoring all new account activity closely to ensure successful onboarding </li><li> Partner with global operations teams to enhance capabilities and coverage domestically </li><li> Proactively seek opportunities to leverage technology and automate manual processes </li><li>Collaborate with relevant stakeholders to support changing business deliverables<br><br></li></ul><strong>Qualifications<br></strong><ul><li> Proven experience (5+ years) in a fixed income operations role </li><li> Strong understanding of fixed income confirmations and settlements processes and platforms, including SWIFT, custodian portals, CTM, Alert, and AccessFintech </li><li> Team oriented individual with collaborative nature </li><li> Excellent organizational and problem-solving skills </li><li> Proactive mindset with focus on risk mitigation and quick resolution of issues </li><li> Willingness to approach existing processes with fresh outlook and challenge the status quo where appropriate </li><li> Strong communication skills; ability to articulate issues accurately and efficiently </li><li> Thrives when met with competing priorities in a fast paced, deadline driven environment </li><li> Strong research and root cause analysis skills with desire to drive systemic change </li><li>Knowledge of SQL and VBA a plus<br><br></li></ul><strong> EOE Statement <br><br></strong>As an EOE employer, Legal &amp; General Investment Management America will extend equal opportunity to all employees<br><br>and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, ancestry,<br><br>national origin, age, disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, pregnancy, military status, and/or any<br><br>other characteristic protected under applicable federal, state or local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment. (2020)

title: C# Backend Developer w/Angular
description: Position Title: .NET Web Application Developer Duration: LONG TERM Location: Chicago, ILDynamic Interactive Business System Inc. is looking for a .NET Web Application Developer for its direct Client in Chicago, IL. The developer will work onsite/remote at the Client headquarters performing project-based tasks as assigned.Responsibilities:Support the Information Technology department’s activities to ensure completion and maintenance of the Client's ASP.NET Web Applications, including but not limited to: Waitlist Portals, Section 3 Portals, HCV QA/QC Tracking and Reasonable Accommodation Portals.Develop new ASP.NET Web Applications and/or re-engineer the existing ASP.NET Web Applications.Engineer high level requirements to derive system and architecture specifications, functional specifications, detailed design specifications and feasibility prototypes.Conduct and participate in code reviews of either Client's developed or vendor-supplied applications.Develop test scripts to ensure the quality of applications.Support data model development interoperability of the various ASP.Net Web Applications.Collaborate with project teams and key stakeholders to assess the needs of “buy-or-build” systems.Participate in project meetings to communicate architecture concepts across various projects and provide applicable architecture development status.Identify risks and provide recommendations to mitigate and/or eliminate risk.Interface with development teams and contribute in a fast paced, integrated team environment.Education and Experience Requirements: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or equivalent work experience.Solid Knowledge of object-oriented design and development on a Microsoft .NET platform.Solid Knowledge of the methodology of Agile Development.A minimum of five (5) years of development experience in HTML5, CSS, JavaScript, C#, ASP.NET and MVC with MS Visual Studio.Demonstrated experience in developing three tier applications based on the .NET platform.Demonstrated experience with IIS web applications.Ability to effectively test/certify developed mobile applications.Understanding of Microsoft Active Directory (AD) and AD Security.Ability to diagnose and correct performance problems.Understanding of and experience with SharePoint (2013/2016) is preferred.Ability to customize SharePoint portal layout, implement features, create dynamic workflows, develop web parts and generate reports with SharePoint Reporting Server is preferred.Self-motivated and focused, with a positive outlook and excellent organizational skills.Experience working within an Agile project framework in team-oriented environment.Excellent oral and written communication skills. Effective interpersonal skills, ability to maintain good working relationships.Ability to make decisions according to rules, regulations, and procedures.Ability to understand and carry out complex instructions, prepare and maintain complex records and files.Discretion in handling confidential/sensitive information. .NET Developer - $30/hr

description: Cerebra Consulting Inc is a System Integrator and IT Services Solution provider with a focus on Big Data, Business Analytics, Cloud Solutions, Amazon Web Services, Salesforce, Oracle EBS, Peoplesoft, Hyperion, Oracle Configurator, Oracle CPQ, Oracle PLM and Custom Application Development. Utilizing solid business experience, industry-specific expertise, and proven methodologies, we consistently deliver measurable results for our customers. Cerebra has partnered with leading enterprise software companies and cloud providers such as Oracle, Salesforce, Amazon and able to leverage these partner relationships to deliver high-quality, end-to-end customer solutions that are targeted to the needs of each customer. Java Kafka Developer Location: Hybrid (Chicago IL ,3 Days onsite) Duration: 7 Months What you need to succeed: At least 9+ years' experience in building highly scalable, high performance, and highly available back-end applications. Kafka streaming experience Experience with event driven framework Strong Mongo DB skills and experience Development expertise in REST/SOAP/JSON API. Solid working knowledge of NoSQL (e.g., Elasticsearch + Time Series Databases). Unix background with RedHat Spring Cloud Stream preference skill Payment's domain or financial industry experience Experience with large volumes of data Solid understanding of algorithm complexity, parallel/distributed systems, advanced data structures, computer networking, and operating systems. Prior experience working with Agile/Scrum methodologies. Start-up environment experience will be a plus, although not mandatory. Strength in backend service development Self-initiating developer Takes ownership and is reliable Thanks Sai Revanth Email - Phone|
